title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
**The Position**

iD Tech is looking for a positive and collaborative individual to join our team as a Human Resources Generalist! In this role, you will be responsible for providing HR expertise on everything from employee relations to benefits administration. This is a great position for a self-motivated, creative problem-solver who wants to be part of a dynamic, mission-driven company. This position will report to the VP of Human Resources and work remotely.

**The Day-to-Day**

* Partner with and advise managers on employee relations issues that arise, including performance management guidance, performance improvement plans, investigations, etc.
* Oversee company engagement programs, including managing employee surveys, reviewing results with managers, and implementing activities that support employee engagement and our company culture
* Work with team to actively monitor developments in employment laws and present recommendations on operational changes needed to comply
* Maintain relationship with benefits brokers, oversee plan administration and open enrollment
* Assist in developing and implementing policies, in addition to maintaining internal department process documentation
* Oversee bi-annual performance review process from end-to-end
* Oversee compliance related activities such as annual EEO-1, CA pay data, and ACA reporting
* Provide guidance on the management of employee leaves of absence and coordination of FMLA, CA SDI/PFL, STD/LTD plans
* Create systems to self-audit processes to ensure nothing slips through the cracks
* Cultivate an atmosphere of inclusion -- one that values diversity and is encouraging of unique perspectives.
* Anticipate and identify organizational and HR department needs in the spirit of continuous improvement

**The Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or a related field, with a PHR or SPHR preferred
* 5+ years of progressive HR generalist experience, with hands-on experience in employee relations, ADA interactive process, and leave administration
* High emotional intelligence, with the ability to coach and advise both managers and employees in alignment with company goals and values
* Ability to prioritize and be flexible in a dynamic work environment
* Self-motivated and highly organized, with a curious mind and a desire for continuous learning
* Strong knowledge of federal, state and local employment laws with experience administering HR policies across multiple states preferred
* Hands-on experience with UKG Pro preferred
* Proficiency working with Microsoft Office and Google Suite, particularly Excel.
* Ability to handle private and personal information with professionalism and confidentiality
* Must have a positive attitude and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment

**5 Reasons Why This is the #BestJobEver**

* iD Tech has been voted a Top Workplace over 10 times!
* Purpose-driven company and a national leader in youth STEM education
* Employees receive FREE medical, dental and vision insurance
* Some of our extra perks include generous PTO, holidays, three paid company closures each year, and camp scholarships
* Skip the commute and work from home!

**Our Company. Our Mission.**

We are a team of talented, creative people who care deeply about revolutionizing STEM education for the next generation of game designers, programmers, web and app developers, filmmakers, tech leaders, and entrepreneurs. We have purposefully created a comfortable and flexible work environment where people genuinely engage with each other and have fun! iD Tech has been named a Top Workplace by the Bay Area News Group 10+ times. We strive to embody the summer camp spirit year-round.

If you are looking for a family-oriented, purpose-driven company, please apply!

iD Tech is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Talent Acquisition Manager
description:
**About PeopleOps Jobs**

We started PeopleOps Jobs (https://peopleopsjobs.io) to help companies that care about HR find the right people in the HR and People Operations world.

--

**Job Description**

The position is at a tech company. As a key component of our dynamic team, the Talent Acquisition Manager drives our development and success by identifying, recruiting, and keeping top-tier talent. You will oversee the whole recruiting process, from devising creative sourcing tactics to conducting interviews and negotiating offers.

**Responsibilities**

* Create and implement innovative sourcing methods to recruit top talent using a variety of channels, including job boards, social media, networking events, and industry alliances.
* Utilize a strong technical sourcing background to successfully discover, engage, and hire engineers and product experts with the necessary skills and knowledge to advance our technology and product development efforts.
* Conduct rigorous applicant evaluations, including resume screening and virtual interviews, to determine individuals' credentials, abilities, and potential contributions to the culture.
* Develop good connections with hiring managers to better understand their workforce requirements, offer advice on recruiting best practices, and guarantee a seamless recruitment process.
* Collaborate with the Leadership Team to develop job descriptions, remuneration packages, and hiring strategies that are consistent with the company's goals and growth targets.
* Manage the candidate experience from application to onboarding, delivering a good and smooth trip for all applicants.
* To consistently enhance our talent acquisition operations, we must stay up to date on industry trends, best practices, and unique recruitment tactics.
* Use data to track recruitment statistics, evaluate hiring patterns, and give insights to help you make better decisions and enhance your recruiting efforts.

**Qualifications**

* An experienced and well-rounded TA Manager with a track record of success, notably in engineering and product positions in start-ups. You've hired for positions ranging from entry-level to VP and beyond, focusing on bringing in the appropriate people at the right time.
* When it comes to candidate sourcing, be scrappy and look outside the box. We all know that LinkedIn is a terrific resource, but what else do you use?
* You thrive in an autonomous setting and hold strong opinions about what you do. You have fresh insights and are not afraid to try new things or challenge recruiting supervisors.
* Analytical, assessing the health of your pipelines using funnel data rather than sentiments.
* Curious and thoughtful, understand the hiring manager's/team's needs during the intake process, and recalibrate throughout to guarantee we bring on top performers.
* Hungry and with a clear goal, we ensure that we track and measure each level of the funnel, ensuring that prospects get through the process on time.

**Pay:** $85k to $115k annually

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $85,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: Remote

title: HR Business Partner II
description:
Job Summary:
The Human Resources Business Partner II is responsible for providing strategic direction and input to business leaders regarding overall human capital strategies that support the culture, company direction, and the growth needs of the business and employees.
Essential Functions:* Provides strategic direction and input to business leaders regarding overall human capital strategies that support the culture, company direction, and the growth needs of the business and employees
* Primary point of contact for the business to ensure optimal work environment, serve as advocate for all employees, and enable support for employee career success
* Provide expert and objective advice, coaching counsel to leaders and employees on HR policy and procedures, employment/labor laws, conflict resolution, change management, diversity, and organizational development to promote a fair and equitable work environment
* Build strong, trusting and transparent relationships with employees and leadership to deliver goals
* Effectively use data to resolve issues and drive decisions
* Assist with the employee hiring process, including screening, interviewing, reference checking, extending offers and successful onboarding of candidates
* Assist with investigations and counseling for a variety of issues, propose appropriate options for consideration, make recommendations as necessary
* Monitor internal and external changes in law, policies, and practices to define and confront risk to employees and the business
* Assist in the development and implementation of HR policies and procedures
* Partners with Centers of Excellence (COE’s) resources: Talent Acquisition, Benefits, Payroll and Compensation
* Collaborate with other departments to understand, resolve and remove barriers that impact a department or employee from being able to perform at their best
* Actively promote cross-department collaboration and information sharing within your own team and the organization
* Maintain employee files and records in electronic and paper form
* Perform any other job duties as requested


Education and Experience:* Bachelor’s Degree in human resources, leadership or a related field or equivalent years of relevant work experience is required
* A minimum of two (2) years of experience as an HR Business Partner with an emphasis in organizational development and employee relations is required


Competencies, Knowledge and Skills:* Proficiency with Microsoft Office, to include Word, Excel and PowerPoint
* Ability to effectively connect, build and maintain strong relationships, and influence all levels of the organization
* Outstanding service orientation with a consultative lens; ability to apply appropriate sense of urgency
* Proven ability to work well under pressure situations and flexible in adapting and responding to changing conditions and situations
* Excellent analytical, problem solving and organizational skills
* Strong understanding of organizational structure, business operations and financial impact/analysis.
* Solid knowledge of HR rules, regulations, applicable laws.
* Proven ability to maintain the integrity of confidential information
* Ability to work independently, is an effective team player, committed to results; solution oriented
* Excellent communication skills (written and verbal); ability to present, train, influence and negotiate
* Familiarity with managed care and government programs
* Critical listening and thinking skills


Licensure and Certification:* Professional in Human Resources (PHR) / Senior Professional in Human Resources (SPHR) OR Strategic Human Resource Business Partner (sHRBP) certification is preferred


Working Conditions:* General office environment; may be required to sit or stand for extended periods of time
* Some travel may be required


Compensation Range:
$60,300.00 - $96,500.00
CareSource takes into consideration a combination of a candidate’s education, training, and experience as well as the position’s scope and complexity, the discretion and latitude required for the role, and other external and internal data when establishing a salary level. We are highly invested in every employee’s total well-being and offer a substantial and comprehensive total rewards package.
Compensation Type (hourly/salary):
Salary
Organization Level Competencies* Create an Inclusive Environment
* Cultivate Partnerships
* Develop Self and Others
* Drive Execution
* Influence Others
* Pursue Personal Excellence
* Understand the Business

  

This job description is not all inclusive. CareSource reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. CareSource is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and veteran status. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

title: (REMOTE) HR Rep I - HR Service Center
description:
**Employment Type:**
Full time**Shift:**
Day Shift**Description:**
Serves as the first point of customer contact in the HR Service Center environment for support and resolution of HR inquiries for all Trinity colleagues, OTE functional areas and vendors. Work activities include, but are not limited to processing of colleague position status change requests, tuition reimbursement applications, audit of HR transactions, telephone support and various HR administrative work as assigned. May investigate and resolve general issues related to HR processes and procedures and assist via telephone and e-mail***Position allows for work from home/remote opportunity.***

***Position works the 10:30am to 7:00pm shift Monday-Friday EST.***

***This is a position in the HR Shared Services Contact Center.***


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS  

Works under the supervision of the Contact Center Phone and Live Chat Manager.
Maintains strict confidentiality of data and information. Possess the ability to handle sensitive information with tact and discretion. Initiates the workflow for the department by creating and assigning cases to functional areas within the HR Service Center, which includes the Contact Center, Administration, Leave Administration, and Onboarding via Case Management System.


Works under the supervision of the Manager, utilizes knowledge of Health and Welfare, FMLA, Workers Compensation, I-9 regulations, open enrollment, JCAHO, and other related laws/procedures to prioritize and escalate colleague inquires to the functional areas in the HR Service Center.


Identifies and classifies employee documents utilizing forms mapping tools and established departmental procedures. Operates data capture technology to extract and import digitized documents into document management system.


Assists other functional areas of the HR Service Center and the organization for open enrollment, benefit eligibility, leaves of absence, employment data changes, workers compensation, performance reviews, licensure reviews, etc.


May participate in projects, such as discovery and implementation of document administration for supported RHM's and includes coordination and timing of communications, report generation and presentation to HR management.


Uses critical thinking skills while meeting established weekly performance metrics and creating minimal errors. Managers daily workload and contributes to the overall performance of the team.


Other duties as needed and assigned by the manager or HR Rep Senior.


a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State, and local laws and regulations, Trinity Health’s Organizational Integrity Program, Standards of Conduct, as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical, and professional behavior.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Must possess a comprehensive understanding of Human Resources, Benefits, Payroll, Annual Enrollment, Leave Administration, HRIS, process integration and Contact/Service Center operations. Subpoena and file request previous experience preferred. A High School diploma with two (2) years of experience in an HR administrative or customer support role in a high volume work environment is required or an equivalent combination of education and experience.


Proficient knowledge of HRIS, HR processes and the downstream impact of transactions to benefits, pay, and other areas required. Familiarity with PeopleSoft, and Kronos time and attendance, Case Management system is preferred.


Demonstrated decision making skills. Excellent communication skills, including strong listening and comprehension skills, and excellent human relations and interpersonal skills. Strong analytic, problem solving, judgment, critical thinking, and conflict resolution skills. Flexibility and ability to manage competing tasks of differing priorities.


Ability to effectively interact and successfully represent the Department with higher level managers, other various departments, functional areas and Health Ministries.


Demonstrated proficiency in MS Office Suite.


Must be comfortable operating in a collaborative, shared leadership environment.


Must possess a personal presence that is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals and values of Trinity Health.

**PHYSICAL** **AND MENTAL****REQUIREMENTS AND****WORKING CONDITIONS**


Must be able to set and organize own work priorities and adapt to them as they change frequently. Must be able to work concurrently on a variety of tasks/projects in an environment that may be stressful with individuals having diverse personalities and work styles.


Must be able to travel to the various Trinity Health sites (10%) as needed.


Operates in a typical office environment. The area is well-lit, temperature controlled and free from hazards.


Communicates frequently, in person and over the phone, with people in all locations on product support issues. Hearing is needed for extensive telephone and in person communication.


Manual dexterity is needed in order to operate a computer keyboard.


Must possess the ability to comply with Trinity Health policies and procedures.


Hourly payrate: $18-46 - $27.70

**Diversity and Inclusion**


Trinity Health employs about 133,000 colleagues at dozens of hospitals and hundreds of health centers in 22 states. Because we serve diverse populations, our colleagues are trained to recognize the cultural beliefs, values, traditions, language preferences, and health practices of the communities that we serve and to apply that knowledge to produce positive health outcomes. We also recognize that each of us has a different way of thinking and perceiving our world and that these differences often lead to innovative solutions.

**Trinity Health's Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**


Trinity Health's dedication to diversity includes a unified workforce (through training and education, recruitment, retention and development), commitment and accountability, communication, community partnerships, and supplier diversity.

**Note:**

Bargaining unit employees are governed by the terms and conditions of their respective collective bargaining agreements, which supersede the Employment-At-Will Statement.

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**

  

Trinity Health is one of the largest not-for-profit, Catholic healthcare systems in the nation. Built on the foundation of our Mission and Core Values, we integrate diversity, equity, and inclusion in all that we do. Our colleagues have different lived experiences, customs, abilities, and talents. Together, we become our best selves. A diverse and inclusive workforce provides the most accessible and equitable care for those we serve. Trinity Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by law.

title: Senior HR Generalist
description:
Overview:

The **Senior People Experience (PX) Generalist** is responsible for delivering an elevated level of service to a broad range of PX functions including, but not limited to, business partnering, employee relations, and employee engagement. This role is also responsible for interfacing with various functional groups across the business including Finance, IT, and Payroll. This position will be based at PowerSchool headquarters in Folsom, CA.
Responsibilities:
**Essential duties and responsibilities** **include the following:**

* Contribute to business strategy activities by supporting the Director and Senior PXBP managers to build organizational capabilities, behaviors, structures, and processes.
* Provide business partner support to a specific line of business in the Customer Experience organization and drive PX initiatives and outcomes.
* Provide day-to-day performance management guidance to key leaders and managers (e.g., coaching, counseling, career development, disciplinary actions).
* Serve as first point of contact for general PX inquiries.
* Ability to understand complex reporting and how to professionally deliver data to business leaders.
* Assist in the investigative process on employee relations matters and propose viable solutions.
* Analyze exit data and make recommendations for corrective action and continuous improvement.
* Responsible for offboarding employees and completing exit interviews.
* Actively participate in PX team meetings and attend other meetings, as required.
* Participate in developing team goals and supporting strategic initiatives across PX.
* Support PowerSchool’s DE&I initiatives.

**Regional responsibilities:**

* Support Canada regional manager regarding policy updates, legislative compliance, as well as acquisitions and organizational changes.


Reasonable accommodation(s) may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Qualifications:

To be considered for and to perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.

**Qualifications include:**

* Bachelor's degree, preferred, or relevant industry experience.
* 3+ years of HR generalist or business partner experience.
* Experienced in HR best business practices.
* Excellent communication skills: ability to respond appropriately to all levels in the organization.
* Strong people skills and ability to follow through and deliver high-level service to internal stakeholders.
* Ability to interpret data, trends, and provide advice to the business in terms of workforce planning while aligning to business strategies.
* Able to work both independently and collaboratively, as a part of a global People Experience team.
* Detail-oriented and highly organized.
* Uses appropriate discretion and maintains confidentiality.
* Consistently demonstrates credibility and ethical/professional conduct.
* Strong knowledge of U.S. employment law required.
* Experienced with Office 365 including communication tools such as Slack and Zoom.
* Professional HR Certification preferred (required after 2 years)
* Ability to travel, as required.

 **Preferred requirements:**

* Current knowledge of provincial Canadian legislation.
* Knowledge of Canadian HR reporting, compliance, and record keeping requirements.


Compensation & Benefits:
**PowerSchool offers the following benefits:**

  

* Comprehensive Insurance Coverage (including Medical, Dental, Vision, Pharmacy benefits, Life Insurance and AD&D)
* Flexible Spending Accounts with company contributions
* Health Savings Accounts
* Short-Term Disability and Long-Term Disability
* Comprehensive 401(k) plan with employer match
* Generous Parental Leave
* Unrestricted paid time off (known as Discretionary Time Off - DTO)
* Paid Community and Volunteer Time Off (VTO)
* Wellness Program, including ClassPass & Employee Assistance Program
* Tuition Reimbursement for undergraduate and graduate degree programs
* Optional Benefits: Pet Insurance, Identity Theft Protection, Student Debt Repayment Program and Prepaid Legal coverage.


A reasonable estimate of the base compensation range for this position is $80,000–$95,000. The compensation range is specific to the United States and incorporates many factors including but not limited to an applicant’s skills and prior relevant experience and training; licensures, degrees, and certifications; internal equity; internal pay ranges; and market data/range parameters.


EEO Commitment:
*PowerSchool is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. PowerSchool is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Our inclusive culture empowers PowerSchoolers to deliver the best results for our customers. We not only celebrate the diversity of our workforce, we celebrate the diverse ways we work. If you have a disability and need an accommodation regarding our recruiting process, please let us know by emailing accommodations@powerschool.com.* *#LI-RS1 #LI-HYBRID*

title: Recruiting Coordinator
description:
**Company Overview:**  


  

The next generation of ADT Commercial is here. At Everon, we truly believe that our people are the difference – for our organization, the customers we serve and the communities we protect. When you’re a part of Everon, you’ll have the opportunity to be a part of that difference every day. With more than 100 locations, a deep national presence, and comprehensive portfolio of solutions and services, our employees are always poised for career advancement and growth. For more information, visit www.everonsolutions.com or follow us on LinkedIn.
The next generation of ADT Commercial is here. At Everon, we truly believe that our people are the difference – for our organization, the customers we serve and the communities we protect. When you’re a part of Everon, you’ll have the opportunity to be a part of that difference every day. With more than 100 locations, a deep national presence, and comprehensive portfolio of solutions and services, our employees are always poised for career advancement and growth. For more information, visit www.everonsolutions.com or follow us on LinkedIn.

**Position Highlights:**



This position will support a team of Recruiters on key administrative processes for fast paced, high volume recruitment. The Recruiting Coordinator is required to demonstrate unparalleled integrity and high energy while working under minimal supervision.





**Responsibilities & Qualifications:**


* Create and open requisitions via the company Applicant Tracking System (Horizon) ensuring that postings are managed for effectiveness and within appropriate guidelines/timeframes
* Create and extend offer letters via Applicant Tracking System (Horizon).
* Responsible for generating and managing the background verification/pre-employment process.
* Troubleshoot and assist candidates throughout the hiring process. Maintain solid candidate contact from offer acceptance to start date.
* Collaborate with and proactively support Recruiters, Hiring Managers and Candidates, providing superior customer service and candidate experiences throughout each step of the recruiting process
* Keep accurate record keeping via excel on all candidates in process and starts.
* Coordinate first day details with recruiter, hiring manager and local onboarding coordinator once start date is confirmed.
* Send first day instructions to candidate ensuring a positive onboarding experience.
* Participate in special projects on as needed basis.


**Education / Work Experience Required:**


* Associates or Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience
* Strong comfort level with Excel, ability to run reports as needed by Management
* Ability to multi-task in a dynamic environment
* Working knowledge of Horizon is preferred.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Strong sense of urgency
* Must have excellent communication skills, both verb and written.

Must have superior follow through skills

title: Human Resources Director
description:
**About PeopleOps Jobs**

We started PeopleOps Jobs (https://peopleopsjobs.io) to help companies that care about HR find the right people in the HR and People Operations world.

--

**Job Description**

The position is at a technology company. Reporting directly to the Head of Human Resources for North America, you will develop the talent strategy and advise on all things People related to the Mail Related Solutions (MRS) business: performance management, talent development, leadership coaching, employee relations, and organizational design.

**Responsibilities**

* Provide strategic partnership and counsel to Sales business leaders and individual contributors, ensuring employee advocacy and fairness.
* Craft and implement creative and progressive talent strategies tailored to your client Sales groups, addressing retention and development needs.
* Support your leadership teams through all People processes including compensation, talent development, performance management, employee relations, change management, organizational design, etc.
* Primary driver and leader in all of your Sales clients’ people-related activities and programs.
* Coach and develop leaders at all levels within the organization, from line managers to executives.
* Utilize qualitative and quantitative data in order to inform key business and talent decisions.
* Collaborate with HR COEs -- total rewards, talent acquisition, talent development and diversity, and employee experience to inform the design and implementation of People programs and processes.
* Be a culture ambassador, fostering diversity and inclusion.
* Mentor and coach other members of the North American HR team.

**Qualifications**

* 12+ years of overall HR experience, 10+ years of strategic human resource business partner experience supporting various functions, 3+ years of HR management experience, supporting Sales leaders, with experience in both hardware & software industries.
* Change leadership experience: helping to pivot culture and improve the overall effectiveness of the business and teams. Deep understanding of rapidly changing work environments and cultures. Confident and able to thrive in ambiguous and transforming environments.
* Demonstrated ability to drive long-term initiatives and apply patience and perspective to balance short-term demands while driving progress toward long-term goals by making trade-offs and choosing priorities carefully.
* Building or scaling/evolving Talent practices.
* Excellent judgment and problem-solving capabilities, as well as the ability to make thoughtful decisions.
* You are intellectually curious about people and organizational issues; you have a creative, solutions-based mindset.
* Analytically driven; you utilize qualitative and quantitative approaches to problem-solving and root cause analysis.
* Possess experience driving key people, programs, and processes (performance management cycles, calibration facilitation, compensation planning, executive coaching, employee relations/conflict resolution, organizational design, etc.).

**Benefits**

* Company-subsidized Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* 401(k) Retirement Plan with Strong Company Match
* Life & Disability Insurance – Company Sponsored
* Paid Vacation, Sick Leave, and 12 Company Holidays
* Career & Leadership Development
* Tuition Reimbursement Program
* Company Sponsored Groups
* and more

**Pay:** $165k to $248k annually

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $165,000.00 - $248,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Recruitment Manager
description:
We are seeking a highly driven and organized Recruiting Manager to oversee the recruitment of tour guides for the variety of tours, including ghost tours, food tours, brewery tours, history tours, and more.

***This is a remote W-2 role and not a contract position. You must reside within the United States and be fluent in the English language.***

**Job Description**

The Recruiting Manager will be responsible for leading the recruitment and selection process for the tour guides. This individual will work closely with department managers to understand their staffing needs, develop and implement effective recruitment strategies, and identify and attract the best talent for the company.

**Recruiting Manager Skills and Expertise:**

* Develop and implement recruiting strategies: This includes determining the best sources for attracting candidates, establishing relationships with colleges and universities, and identifying opportunities for diversity recruiting.
* Manage the hiring process: This includes coordinating interviews, negotiating offers, and ensuring a smooth onboarding process for new hires.
* Source and screen candidates: This includes conducting initial phone screens, evaluating resumes, and conducting in-person interviews.
* Position may require some social media management: reply to messages and make occasional posts.
* Use data to drive decision-making: This includes tracking key recruiting metrics, analyzing trends, and making data-driven recommendations to improve the recruiting process.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant laws and regulations: This includes staying current with equal employment opportunity laws and immigration regulations.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

The ideal candidate for a Recruiting Manager position will have a bachelor's degree in human resources, business, or a related field, and 2 years of experience in recruitment and staffing. Strong leadership skills, excellent communication skills, and a deep understanding of the hiring process are also critical for success in this role.

* Excellent time management skills and the ability to organize work
* Ability to manage multiple projects with competing priorities
* Common sense approach to problem-solving
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy
* Excellent oral and written communication skills: the ability to diffuse customer complaints both on the phone and in written responses to emails, instant messages, and online reviews.
* Proficiency with Google Docs, Microsoft Office and Dropbox preferred
* Professional and dependable with a positive outlook required

**We offer:**

* Competitive Compensation - Best-in-Industry Pay
* Health Benefits
* Paid Time Off – 80 Hours
* Sick Pay – 5 Days
* Remote Work Monday to Friday
* A steep learning curve and growth trajectory based on individual performance.
* We offer a positive environment where growth is encouraged and supported by experienced leaders.
* Our collaborative approach provides plenty of opportunities to work as a team. So, if you are looking for career growth where your work makes an impact then you are the right fit for us!

**Zaal Ventures is a remote company.**

**Zaal Ventures is a Veteran-Friendly Employer. We value the perspectives, backgrounds, skills, work ethic and leadership that those who are military connected bring to the workforce.**

**As part of our People First culture, Zaal Ventures is proud to offer a robust and competitive Total Rewards benefits package.**

**Zaal Ventures is an Equal Opportunity Employer that celebrates diversity and believes employing a diverse workforce is key to our success. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals.**

**We are not able to sponsor work visas for this position.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $42,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Recruiting: 5 years (Required)
* Human Resources: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Facilitator, Learning & Development
description:
**About Us:**
-------------



DailyPay, Inc. is transforming the way people get paid. As the industry's leading on-demand pay solution, DailyPay uses an award-winning technology platform to help America's top employers build stronger relationships with their employees. This voluntary employee benefit enables workers everywhere to feel more motivated to work harder and stay longer on the job, while supporting their financial well-being outside of the workplace. DailyPay is headquartered in New York City, with operations in Minneapolis and Belfast. For more information, visit DailyPay's Press Center.

**The Role:**
-------------



You'll be a member of the Learning & Development Team within the Shared Services group, working closely with the DailyPay Customer Operations organization to facilitate its Training programs.



In this role you will help DailyPay support agents and specialists cultivate their skills and knowledge. You will create reference content and training material, facilitate training. The ideal candidate should possess excellent writing skills, be highly organized, proficient in time management, and be a great communicator.



If this opportunity excites you, we encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all of the qualifications.


**How You Will Make an Impact:**
--------------------------------


* Create internal, Support Operations agent facing Knowledge Base (FAQ) content including support scripting (talk tracks)
* Create Support Operations agent training modules: Instructor-led (ILT) and e-learnings
* Create ad-hoc internal-facing communication content as needed: newsletters, email notifications, slack posts ect.
* Conduct Training: in-person, which may require travel overseas; virtual sessions
* Support Training initiatives at BPO sites: run Train-the-Trainer (TTT) sessions, observe (remotely/in-person) training and provide guidance; assist with New Hire nesting (ramp from training to production).
* Partner with cross- functional teams to stay up to date on product and process changes to proactively update Support Ops reference (Knowledge Base) and training content.
* Proactivelly identify areas of improvement in Support Ops reference content (Knowledge Base) and training content.

**What You Bring to The Team:**
-------------------------------


* Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) and a minimum of 2+ years of proven experience in a Learning & Development role
* Strong editorial skill set, including both writing and editing (copy and developmental/strategic)
* Strong proficiency with Google Suite and/or Microsoft Suite (Slides, PPT); experience with e-learning module creation a plus
* Hands-on approach to stakeholder engagement and content creation
* Understanding of effective teaching methodologies and tools; Experience with remote training/virtual learning a plus
* You are a positive person, team player, collaborator, and an excellent communicator
* You are organized and manage your time well to always deliver by deadline

**What We Offer:**
------------------


* Exceptional health, vision, and dental care
* Opportunity for equity ownership
* Life and AD&D, short- and long-term disability
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Resource Groups
* Fun company outings and events
* Unlimited PTO
* 401K with company match

 **Pay Transparency.** DailyPay takes a market-based approach to compensation and compensation may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into two tiers based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The salary ranges are listed by geographic tier. Additionally, this role may be eligible for variable incentive compensation in addition to stock options. Where a candidate fits within the compensation range for a role is based on their demonstrated experience, qualifications, skills and internal equity.

**National Compensation Range**


$53,000—$69,000 USD**Premium Compensation Range**


$59,000—$76,000 USD  


DailyPay is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable culture of belonging, grounded in empathy and respect, which values openness to opinions, awareness of lived experiences, fair treatment and access for all. We strive to build and develop diverse teams to create an organization where innovation thrives, where the full potential of each person is engaged, and their views, beliefs and values are integrated into our ways of working.



We encourage people of all backgrounds to join us on our mission. If you require reasonable accommodation for any aspect of the recruitment process, please send a request to peopleops@dailypay.com. All requests for accommodation will be addressed as confidentially as practicable.



DailyPay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion or creed, alienage or citizenship status, political affiliation, marital or partnership status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, childbirth (or related medical conditions), sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, genetic disorder, genetic predisposition, carrier status, military status, familial status, or domestic violence victim status and any other basis protected under federal, state, or local laws.

title: People Business Partner
description:
**#Description#**  



  

Employ empowers organizations of all sizes to overcome their greatest recruiting and talent acquisition challenges. Offering a combination of purpose-built intelligent software technologies, services, and industry expertise, Employ provides businesses of all sizes with powerful solutions for recruiting a diverse workforce. Through its JazzHR, Lever, and Jobvite technologies, and NXTThing RPO services, Employ serves more than 21,000 customers across all industries. For more information, visit **www.employinc.com**.  

As Employ's People Business Partner, you will be primarily supporting our G&A teams as well as our NXTThing RPO line of business. We are a global organization with Employsters in the U.S., Canada, the UK, and India. Building relationships. supporting and growing our employees are our Business Partners' top priorities.  

**What you will do:*** Ensure legal compliance by monitoring and implementing applicable US and Canadian federal and state/territory requirements, conducting investigations and maintaining records
* Act as a resource for strategic support on all People related initiatives and operational efficiencies
* Provide expertise, guidance and coaching to leaders in managing highly sensitive and complex employee relations matters, including performance management, terminations, and other People related matters
* Anticipate training & development needs, developing plans & programs, and then coordinate implementation and delivery
* Support leaders in proactive management of compensation packages, performance evaluation programs and job descriptions
* Act as a change agent related to any people related initiatives
* Assist international employees with Immigration matters
* Maintain knowledge of legal requirements for day to day management of employees, reducing legal risks and complying with legal requirements and partners with legal as needed/required

  

**What you will bring:*** Must have experience complying with employment and labor regulations in Canada
* Minimum of 5+ years of experience in a strategic Human Resources role, working directly with all levels within company
* Ability to make administrative and procedural decisions, and exercise judgment with sensitive/ confidential issues
* Strong coaching, conflict resolution, relationship and team building skills, and demonstrated ability to influence
* Excellent communication skills, including the ability to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles.
* Startup experience preferred
* Bachelors Degree in Human Resources or Business, preferred

  

**Employ is an Equal Opportunity employer.**  

**Employ is an EVerify employer.**

title: Training Manager
description:
**Who WE are:**


RailPros is a leading engineering and safety services company in the rail and transit industry. Our mission is to enhance mobility, safety, and quality of life for residents, passengers, and companies. We achieve this by providing unique services to rail and transit companies across North America. Through teamwork, continuous improvement, and a passion for excellence, we strive to understand our customers' challenges and earn their trust. Our dedication to staying updated on industry developments enables us to help our customers succeed. We are driven by a shared goal of keeping America moving and ensuring customer satisfaction.

 **Keywords:** #Safety Training Manager, #RailPros, #delivery, #implementation, #regulatory, #custom-made training programs, #subject matter expert, #RailPros Training & Media Services, #high-quality, #industry/CFR 243 approved product, #customer expectations, #primary liaison, #external customers, #federal, #state, #local agencies, #external stakeholders, #essential service, #support, #Training and Media services teams, #reputation, #growth, #business unit, #program content, #training records, #regulatory guidelines, #professional relationships, #external customers, #liaison, #project updates, #critical feedback, #meetings, #conferences, #Training and Media Services customer base.

 **Job Summary:**


The Training Manager executes on the delivery and implementation of regulatory and custom-made training programs. This subject matter expert role will work directly with RailPros Training & Media Services to deliver a high-quality and industry/CFR 243 approved product, meeting and exceeding our customers’ expectations. The Training Manager serves as the primary liaison with assigned external customers, federal, state, and local agencies, and other external stakeholders in these areas. The position provides essential service and support to our Training and Media services teams, contributing to the overall reputation and assisting in the growth of the business unit.

  



**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Delivers and implement program content, as assigned
* Maintain training records in accordance with program and regulatory guidelines
* Establish and maintain professional relationships with external customers
* Serve as a primary liaison for external customer(s), providing regular project updates and communicating critical feedback
* Attend meetings and/or conferences to further Training and Media Services customer base
* Other duties as assigned or required to meet the business needs

 **Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:**

* Able to apply logical thought processes and organize resources in order to solve issues and meet commitments
* Proven experience in making decisions and seizing opportunities in the context of business objectives
* Able to satisfy internal and external customer expectations and developing customer partnerships
* Proven experience managing and overseeing the entire scope of assigned projects
* Proficiency with electronic communications including e-mail and text as well as standard office applications (i.e., Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word)

 **Required Education and Experience:**

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Previous experience and/or certification as a PMP or leader of PMO
* 7 years of direct railroad experience within the Transportation (TY&E) department and/or the equivalent experience within the FRA or similar industry governing body, with a significate portion of the time in the role focused on safety, rules, and training

 **Preferred Education and Experience:**

* Bachelor's degree within the business, training, or safety fields
* Highly effective as an instructor/teacher for adult learners
* Ability to develop teaching resources, such as presentations, workbooks, tests, checklists, and other items to develop and enhance associate safety and rules competence
* Proven leadership skills
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to work with federal, state, and local agencies, regulators, field and office staff, railroad officials, potential clients, and existing clients
* Proven ability to exercise discretion in the handling of sensitive and/or confidential materials and information
* Previous experience with Six Sigma and Lean management

 **Additional Qualifications, Certifications, etc.:**

* Must have a valid driver license
* Knowledgeable in FRA railroad rules and regulations
* Knowledgeable in Transportation based regulations (Train, Engine & Yard) and the practical application in the field
* Knowledgeable in GCOR and/or US Operating Rules and experience working under Class 1 Railroad rules
* Knowledgeable in both OSHA 1910 and 1926 regulations

 **Supervisory Responsibilities:**

* The Manager of Training has no direct supervisory authority; however, is “in charge” of the jobsite in the sense that their safety related directives to the protected personnel must be followed

 **Why RailPros:**

* **Industry Expertise:** RailPros is a leading company in the rail industry, offering a wealth of knowledge and experience in railway operations and safety. A Safety Training Manager would benefit from working for RailPros by gaining exposure to cutting-edge practices and industry trends.
* **Career Development Opportunities:** RailPros provides ample opportunities for professional growth and advancement. As a Safety Training Manager, one can enhance their skills, knowledge, and expertise through ongoing training programs and exposure to diverse projects within the rail sector.
* **Collaborative Work Environment:** RailPros fosters a collaborative and supportive work culture where employees are encouraged to work together towards common goals. A Safety Training Manager would thrive in such an environment, working with a team of dedicated professionals to deliver high-quality training programs.
* **Impactful Work:** Working as a Safety Training Manager at RailPros offers the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on railway safety and operations. By developing and implementing training programs, the Safety Training Manager plays a crucial role in ensuring the safety and compliance of railway operations, contributing to the overall success of the company and the industry.

 **Benefits / Perks:**

* Comprehensive Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision)
* Accident Plan, Critical Illness Plan, Hospital Indemnity (Employee to Family Coverage)
* Life and Disability Insurance Coverage (Employer Paid, plus Voluntary Options)
* Retirement Savings Plans (401(k) with Employer Match)
* Paid Time Off (Paid Time Off, Holidays)
* Wellness Programs
* Discount Programs
* Company-funded allowance for merchandise in our on-line store
* Health Savings Accounts (HSA) with Employer Match
* Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA) – Employer Funded
* Flexible Spending Accounts - Dependent Care (FSA)
* Employee Assistance Programs (EAP)
* Professional Development and Training Opportunities
* Work-Life Balance Initiatives

  

Join RailPros for a fulfilling career in a thriving and stable industry. Our core values drive us to excel as a team, prioritize customer satisfaction, and adapt to industry changes swiftly. Be part of a passionate and dedicated team that values continuous improvement, trust, and problem-solving. Apply now for an opportunity to contribute to our success.

  



**Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO):**

  

RailPros provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified candidates, regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic. We are committed to making reasonable accommodations for known physical or mental limitations of qualified employees and applicants with disabilities unless such accommodations would impose undue hardship on our business operations. If you are considering applying for a job and require a reasonable accommodation in accordance with the ADA, please reach out to us at hr@railpros.com.

title: Senior HR Business Partner
description:
We are looking for an experienced HR Business Partner to join our team!


**Who are we?**



Sanity.io is a modern, flexible content platform that replaces rigid legacy content management systems so companies like **PUMA, Spotify, Figma, Riot Games**, and **Skims** can create amazing digital experiences for their customers.



One of our big differentiators is treating content as data so that it can be stored in a single source of truth but seamlessly adapted and personalized for any channel without extra effort. Forward-thinking companies choose Sanity because they can create tailored content authoring experiences, customized workflows, and content models that reflect their business.



Backed by Netlify, Vercel, the founders of Twitter and Medium, Heroku's ex-CEO, and leading VCs like ICONIQ Growth, Threshold Ventures, and Lead Edge Capital, Sanity is at the epicenter of the modern digital product development stack.



You can only build a great company with a great culture. Read about our values and join us in building a diverse and inclusive team.


### **About the Role**



You'll join a globally distributed People team as our first dedicated HR Business Partner, reporting directly to the VP of People. Together, we support a swiftly growing company: today, we're about 140 employees and expect to grow to around 200 people in the next 12 months. Sanity is remote-first, with hybrid offices in San Francisco and Oslo, Norway, and many remote employees in between. As a People Team, we have established some great foundational practices so far, and our goal this year is to iterate for scale.



You will be a trusted partner across the organization, especially to our management team, providing coaching and proactive support for everything from performance management, to employee relations, to organizational thought-partnership. You will support People Programs such as performance reviews and calibrations, and you will help identify ways to further develop our teams.


### **What you will be doing**


* Develop and foster relationships across the organization; partner closely with the management team to gain a deep understanding of their teams and areas ripe for development.
* Work in partnership with the People Leadership & Core Management team to develop growth frameworks that balance consistency across the organization and appropriate nuance by department.
* Act as the primary point of contact for employee relations, performance management, and investigations.
* Support our current annual and mid-year performance review periods and discover ways for us to develop our processes as a growing organization.

### **This may be you**


* You must be based on the East Coast of the US for this role. This is a fully remote position with occasional travel to San Francisco and Oslo, Norway.
* 6-8 years of progressive experience working as HRBP with at least 3 years within a start-up environment; SaaS experience is a big plus.
* Experience working within a global environment - we have employees across 12 different countries!
* Direct experience leading employee relations conversations, conducting and documenting investigations.
* Hands-on experience supporting and coaching Manager, Sr. Manager, and Director level employees with a wide range of management experience (first-time managers, etc.).
* Experience facilitating Performance Evaluations; hands-on experience using CultureAmp, Lattice, or similar platform.
* Experience building and implementing growth frameworks in partnership with Function Heads & Sr. Leaders.


*Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications? Have an untraditional background? Do apply anyway!*


### **What we can offer**


* A highly skilled, inspiring, and supportive team where long-term personal growth is encouraged and supported.
* Positive, flexible, and trust-based work environment.
* A very global, multi-culturally diverse group of colleagues and customers.
* Location: **Remote in the United States (East Coast/ET)**.
* Comprehensive health plans and perks.
* A healthy work-life balance that accommodates individual and family needs.
* Competitive salary and stock options program.


*Sanity.io pledges to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our product serves. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas, and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.*

title: Recruiter (Temporary)
description:
We are a fast-paced business with ambitious growth plans; so if you are dedicated, enthusiastic and always seeking ways to improve, you'll enjoy a career with us!
Ontic offers a new lease on life for the aerospace and defense industry. We’re dedicated to providing a safe, diverse, and evolving work environment. We work with integrity, responsibility, safety, and accountability through inspiring, engaging and collaborating to achieve a common goal — whether that’s serving our customers, helping each other, or volunteering in our local community.
Our team is looking for a Temporary Recruiter to join them for approximately 12 months. You will report to the US Recruitment Manager and will have a remote work schedule.
To be considered for the Recruiter role, here’s what you’ll need to bring with you:* A bachelor’s degree in a related field.
* 2+ years of experience in full lifecycle recruitment, preferably in a manufacturing environment.
* Experience with HRIS/ATS, such as Workday.

  

As a Recruiter, you will:* Own and manage full lifecycle recruitment for roles at various levels across the US.
* Hold recruitment strategy intake sessions with hiring leaders to gather relevant details about the positions.
* Prepare job advertisements, inclusive of marketing material for other job boards (i.e., LinkedIn, Indeed).
* Conduct resume reviews to ensure candidates meet the basic minimum requirements.
* Define and execute effective candidate sourcing strategies/techniques.
* Develop and maintain strong partnerships with hiring leaders and HR professionals globally.
* Ensure accuracy and completion of candidate records/statuses within Workday.
* Partner with Recruitment Coordinator on the interview scheduling and pre-employment onboarding processes.
* Participate in process improvement initiatives or other projects as required.


Our Benefits:* Comprehensive medical insurance
* Competitive PTO, holiday pay, and sick leave
* Company 401K plan with up to 4% matched contribution
* Annual bonus program (varies by level and discretionary based on company and individual performance)
* Flexible working arrangements
* Paid volunteering opportunities
* Access to mental health champions across our sites
* Commitment to development

Salary Range:* $80,000- $100,000/year, based on experience

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
**\\*\\*\\*This is a remote position\\*\\*\\***  

  

Who is Fusion Technology?


Fusion Technology is a performance-driven HUBZone Small Business concern residing in the heart of the beautiful mountainsides of West Virginia, steps away from the Federal Bureau of Investigation's Criminal Justice Information Services Division's Headquarters. Founded in 2007 by an Engineer-by-trade, Fusion Technology dedicates our valuable resources to providing comprehensive IT services and solutions to mission-critical US Government programs and the Intel Community.


Who are you?

* You have a minimum of 5-years GovCon HR management experience.
* You have a minimum of 2 years managing a cleared workforce.
* You have a minimum of 2 years managing a remote/telework workforce.
* *Seasoned HR Professional:* You have received your Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. You also have 5+ years of experience in Human Resource Management. A SHRM certification is a plus, but not required.
* *People Person:* The Human Resource Manager will run the daily functions of the Human Resource (HR) department including hiring and interviewing staff, administering pay, benefits, and leave, and establishing and enforcing company policies and practices.


What you'll do:

* Reviews, tracks, and documents compliance with mandatory and non-mandatory training, continuing education, and work assessments. This may include safety training, anti-harassment training, professional licensure, and aptitude exams and certifications
* Creating, improving or expanding on process where needed
* Recruits, interviews, and facilitates the hiring of qualified job applicants for open positions; collaborates with departmental managers to understand skills and competencies required for openings
* Conducts or acquires background checks and employee eligibility verifications
* Implements new hire orientation and employee recognition programs
* Performs routine tasks required to administer and execute human resource programs including but not limited to compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; occupational health and safety; and training and development
* Handles employment-related inquiries from applicants, employees, and supervisors, referring complex and/or sensitive matters to the appropriate staff
* Attends and participates in employee disciplinary meetings, terminations, and investigations
* Maintains compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; reviews policies and practices to maintain compliance. Also understands government contracting compliance with OFCCP, required EEO-1 reporting and VETS reporting
* Maintains knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law
* Performs other duties as assigned


Preferred Skills/Abilities:

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills. Will be the face of HR in a growing organization and will be expected to interact with employees and management frequently
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
* Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate
* Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality
* Thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software
* Proficiency with or the ability to quickly learn the organization’s HRIS and talent management systems


What matters to you matters to us.


Fusion Technology values its employees and works hard to ensure proper care for them and their families. We desire to compensate employees in a competitive, motivational, fair, and equitable way with other employers in the marketplace. Salary is only one component of employee compensation but an integral part of recruiting and retaining qualified employees. However, at Fusion Technology, we take a comprehensive approach and consider each employee's needs to tailor a compensation plan that provides financial security and peace of mind. Our completive package includes a best-in-class matching 401K program, comprehensive Meritain healthcare plan, a competitive employer contribution to a health savings account, vision and dental plans, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and personal leave, in addition to paid certifications and training.


Fusion Technology LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Federal HR Staffing Specialist (DEU Certified)
description:
**Cameo Consulting Group, LLC** a management consulting practice based out of Alexandria, VA, is seeking a qualified and available *HR Staffing Specialist* to support a Federal client. This position is full-time, long-term in nature.

**DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES**

· Drafting Job Analyses and Developing Vacancy Announcement using USA Staffing.

· Coding Personnel.

· Prepares draft vacancy announcements by reviewing duties outlined in position descriptions and qualification requirements for the position using USA Staffing.

· Assists in the development of job analyses and crediting plans (i.e. Questionnaire) for the agency positions

· Requests the selecting official’s review and approval of current crediting plans as accurate and complete prior to use.

· Assists in preparing classified ads for posting in various publications

· Coordinates approval with selecting officials of vacancy announcements

· Drafts and posts approved announcements on the agencies and USAJOBS websites

· Evaluating and Documenting Time-in-Grade and Retirement Eligibility

· Reviewing employees official record to document time spent in federal positions

· Evaluating private sector experience to make a determination of federal grade level equivalency

· Documenting total federal and private sector experience to create a combined relevant experience service-computation-date

· Review the federal employment history of all employees hired on or after 1/1/2013 to determine the appropriate retirement code (FERS, FERS-RAE, FERS-FRAE)

· Conducting Qualification Reviews and Issuing Selection Certificate

· Reviews applications received for Veterans Preference, Time in Grade Requirements, and required attachments

· Researches the Code of Federal regulations, agency policies and procedures, and other guidance concerning issues related to merit promotion, competitive recruitment, priority placement, veterans’ preference, citizenship requirements, noncompetitive appointment eligibility, etc.

· Documents the Qualification determinations accordingly

· Conducts basic qualification reviews for a variety of positions

· Communicates hiring process and decisions with applicants by sending notifications

· Provides follow-up responses and status updates to applicant inquiries.

· Issues selection certificates

· Review resumes received from other systems for agency-specific hiring authorities

· Maintain Case File and Selection

· Closes out case files

· Issues notifications to applicants

· Prepares and reviews certificates to ensure proper selection

· Audits files for conformance to FHFA’s Merit Promotion Policy and OPM regulations

· Provides case file documents for audits and/or complaints

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* At least 7 years of Federal Experience

**OTHER QUALIFICATIONS**

* 401K Plan with Matching
* Tuition Reimbursement

* Medical Insurance - Multiple Nation-Wide Coverage Options
* Dental Insurance - 100% Employer covered for Employee
* Vision Insurance - 100% Employer covered for Employee

* Corporate Shopping Perks from TicketsatWork.com
* Employee Referral Bonus for Tough-to-Fill posts

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $100,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount

* Flexible spending account

* Paid time off

title: Compensation Analyst
description:
***Company Overview:***



The next generation of ADT Commercial is here. At Everon, we truly believe that our people are the difference – for our organization, the customers we serve and the communities we protect. When you’re a part of Everon, you’ll have the opportunity to be a part of that difference every day. With more than 100 locations, a deep national presence, and comprehensive portfolio of solutions and services, our employees are always poised for career advancement and growth. For more information, visit www.everonsolutions.com or follow us on LinkedIn.


**Summary of Position:**



Compensation Analyst is responsible for supporting the administration of general compensation and sales compensation programs. This Analyst will use data analytics to develop and administer compensation programs that support strategic objectives. This role works closely with the HR team and is also a general point of contact for employees of all levels for compensation matters.  

  

**Duties and Responsibilities:**  



**Compensation**


* Assists with benchmarking positions to market using survey data and other market intelligence to determine competitive strategic ranges that align with data and are cohesive to the organization.
* Ensures compliance within compensation guidelines, budgets, pay equity, FLSA classifications, etc., and tracks regulatory changes and trends.
* Effectively communicates with stakeholders regarding the results of analyses and provides consultation regarding compensation best practices.
* Assists with the merit and annual incentive compensation (bonus) programs including system configurations.
* Participates in compensation surveys to collect and analyze information on organizational competitive position.
* Coordinates with Accounting to submit accruals and perform reconciliations.
* Assists in other HR Department objectives.


**Sales Compensation**


* Create predictive detailed financial models to capture proposed sales compensation plan designs.
* Support financial analysis measuring sales plan effectiveness including, but not limited to, review of total cash achievement by sales position/tenure/geographic market, and the relationship between quota achievement and earnings.
* Perform manual commission and bonus calculations as needed and partner closely with the Finance department ensuring accuracy of remittances processed externally from the sales commission software.
* Prepare updates on sales compensation plan document changes, FAQ and roll-out communication documentation.
* Serve as primary interface with payroll regarding all payroll issues and commission adjustments.
* Assist in the development of all sales compensation plans and related documentation such as training wage guidance, chargeback and guarantee policy documents.
* Develop process documentation for departmental standard operating procedures.
* Primary interface with Finance regarding bonus and commission calculations for all sales plans not directly processed through Varicent.
* Assists in the administration of sales commission process within Varicent.


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in human resources, business administration or related field required, but experience and/or other training/certification may be substituted for education
* 3-5 years experience in compensation or related field
* Advanced knowledge of MS Excel with an emphasis on financial modeling and analysis
* Varicent system and/or other Compensation Incentive Management system experience preferred
* Ability to act with integrity and maintain high levels of confidentiality
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Strong analytical, organizational and time-management skills and the ability to rapidly shift tasks
* Ability to create and deliver presentations to small and large groups at all levels of the organization

Compensation certification a plus  
*
