title: Trainer
description:
Trainer


Be the spark that brightens days and ignite your career with TTEC’s award-winning employment experience. As a Learning and Development Trainer working (remotely OR onsite OR hybrid) in (INSERT CITY, STATE/COUNTRY), you’ll be a part of bringing humanity to business. #experienceTTEC


**What You’ll be Doing**


Do you have a passion to train and guide others towards best practices? Do you love helping set someone up for success? In this role, you’ll support and actively engage new hires in a training environment to develop their knowledge of our values, employee workspaces, time keeping apps, and training on client products and procedures. You’ll work to make sure each employee is set up for success as they start their new role by teaching, testing, and monitoring absence and attendance throughout the training process.


You’ll report to the Manager, Learning and Development.


We’re looking for a Trainer to welcome and excite new hires as they start their new careers.


**During a Typical Day, You’ll**

* Inspire and motivate learners to reach for amazing
* Mentor and coach new hires within client training goals and time frames
* Bring your interest in helping others to start their career journeys successful
* Deliver high quality client product training

**What You Bring to the Ro**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Work onsite in Oklahoma City, OK
* 6 months or more in training and adult learning or call center experience
* Team building and nurturing an inclusive learning environment
* Engage and support your trainees in making sure they have the proper tools and systems knowledge to accomplish day-to-day tasks
* Computer experience

**What You Can Expect**


* Supportive of your career and professional development
* An inclusive culture and community minded organization where giving back is encouraged
* A global team of curious lifelong learners guided by our company values
* Ask us about our paid time off (PTO) and wellness and healthcare benefits
* And yes... a great compensation package and performance bonus opportunities, benefits you'd expect and maybe a few that would pleasantly surprise you (like tuition reimbursement)

**Pay and Benefits**

* **The salary range for this role is $45,000-47,000**
* **Visit https://mybenefits.ttec.com/?manual for more information.**


About TTEC Our business is about making customers happy. That's all we do. Since 1982, we've helped companies build engaged, pleased, profitable customer experiences powered by our combination of humanity and technology. On behalf of many of the world's leading iconic and hypergrowth brands, we talk, message, text, and video chat with millions of customers every day. These exceptional customer experiences start with you.


TTEC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer where all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. TTEC embraces and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce that respects and empowers the cultures and perspectives within our global teams. We aim to reflect the communities we serve, by not only delivering amazing service and technology, but also humanity. We make it a point to make sure all our employees feel valued, belonging, and comfortable being their authentic selves at work. As a global company, we know diversity is our strength because it enables us to view things from different vantage points and for you to bring value to the table in your own unique way.


**Notice to external Recruiters and Recruitment Agencies**: TTEC does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this web site or directly to any employee. TTEC , and any of our subsidiaries, will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with TTEC .

  


**Employment Requirements**: TTEC requires all employees hired in the United States to successfully pass a background check and depending on location and client program a drug test, as a condition of employment. TTEC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

### **Primary Location**


: US-Oklahoma-Oklahoma City

title: Area College Scout
description:
National Scouting Report (NSR) is looking for a dynamic, driven individual to join our team as a College Scout. This role is not just a job—it's a mission to discover and nurture the next generation of collegiate sports talent.

**Role Mission**:  
As an NSR College Scout, your daily activities will revolve around scouting, evaluating, educating, enrolling, and promoting these athletes, ensuring they have the best chance to reach their goals.

**Key Responsibilities**:

* Establish and maintain daily communication with NSR contacts, keeping your AXIS Dashboard and prospect funnel up to date.
* Attend games, practices, and significant events to scout potential talent, and conduct regular athlete interviews.
* Be the embodiment of NSR in the field, promoting athletes' achievements and representing the NSR brand with integrity.
* Schedule, organize, and manage the athlete's journey with NSR, all while maintaining rigorous standards and adhering to the NSR Code of Conduct.

**Compensation**:

* Earn what you deserve with a compensation structure that values your hard work and dedication, including salary with generous commission and bonus rewards.

**Who We Are Looking For**:

The role of NSR Scout is suited for an individual looking for a full-time career in the sports industry. The candidate must have excellent interpersonal skills, a keen eye for potential talent, and an understanding of the collegiate sports recruitment process.

* A strong work ethic and a willingness to absorb and duplicate what one learns from NSR training and experience on the ground
* A flexible schedule to accommodate afternoon, early evening, and weekend work
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Strong analytical and organizational skills
* Ability to work independently and remotely
* Bachelor's degree preferred
* 2+ experience in sales, coaching or scouting

**Ready to Step Up to the Plate?**  
If you're looking for a fulfilling career that combines your love of sports with the opportunity to guide young athletes towards their dreams, we want to hear from you. Apply today and help us find the champions of tomorrow!

Get to know NSR at www.nsr-inc.com

**NSR is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.**

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: Remote

title: Learning and Organizational Quality Senior Trainer
description:
The salary range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs.
At WGU, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role, and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is:  

Pay Range: $58,000.00 - $87,000.00  

If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.
Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.
Learning and Organizational Quality Senior Trainer
The Learning and Organizational Quality Senior Trainer is a strong and motivated individual who develops and delivers competent and engaging training across all departments in WGU Academy. They must be a self-directed and innovative training architect who develops training materials, activities, information retention strategies, and evaluations that support effective adult learning. This role requires strong attention to detail, solid critical thinking skills, and collaborative teamwork skills. This role will include establishing training QA processes for learning, organization-wide, monitoring the completion of QA feedback action items, and collating data to support learner engagement.  

The Senior Trainer is responsible for providing data-driven results to management and works closely to calibrate and collaborate on diverse training needs to ensure all policies, procedures, and changes are communicated in a timely and well-constructed manner. The Senior Trainer is a resource for development and an advocate for success; requiring the ability to develop and maintain strong professional relationships with managers, trainers, and specialists.
Job Profile Summary:
Do you enjoy developing innovative training materials that support adult learning (support employees in their success)? Are you looking for an opportunity to develop an organization-wide QA process for learning and producing data-driven results? At WGU Academy, we work collaboratively to dramatically impact college readiness efforts on a large scale. Our primary mission is to develop and deliver new solutions for college and career readiness to tens of thousands, even hundreds of thousands, of individuals who otherwise would not be prepared for regular enrollment at WGU or at other institutions.
As the LOQ Senior Trainer, you will have the autonomy to use your training architect skills to develop innovative training materials, activities, information retention strategies, and evaluations that support effective employee learning. You will establish organization-wide training QA processes for learning, monitor the completion of QA feedback action items, and collate data to support learner engagement. Working directly with management, you will provide data-driven results and work closely to calibrate and collaborate on diverse training needs. The Senior Trainer is a resource for development and an advocate for success; requiring the ability to develop and maintain strong professional relationships with managers, trainers, and specialists.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities:* Facilitate effective and engaging instruction and discussion specific to adult learning in both the in-person and virtual environments.
* Develop and maintain training and reference materials.
* Develop evaluation methods that identify and measure retention and training impact.
* Conduct training needs analysis for new training requests.
* Track the QA process throughout the development cycle for all new learning resources and significant resource redevelopment.
* Communicates step-by-step QA requirements to multilevel stakeholders, including providing detailed access instructions and credentials.
* Acts as the point of contact for reviewers and stakeholders during the QA process, providing training and support as needed.
* Facilitates the development team’s review and implementation of QA feedback and maintains a record of QA feedback history, including actions taken and resolutions, in an accessible database.
* This individual cultivates the following essential skills: professionalism, quality control, adaptability, positive attitude, dependability, courteous and timely communication.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.


Knowledge, Skill and Abilities:* Superior interpersonal skills.
* Strong oral/written communication skills.
* Ability to organize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to execute multiple projects and meet deadlines on time with high quality.
* Proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, OneNote).
* Ability to manage diverse groups and personalities with effective coaching and teaching skills.
* High attention to detail in keeping training materials updated and effective in order, flow, and learning curve.
* Strong critical thinking and process improvement skills.
* Ability to learn and retain large amounts of information that encompass the entire university.
* A willingness to be innovative and take risks that promote successful learning outcomes.
* Ability to present topics and information in a dynamic, engaging, and effective way.
* Ability to work independently without supervision, and as part of a team.


Competencies:
Organizational Impact:* Works to achieve operational targets with significant to major impact on department, Function, or Office results. May be responsible for managing large projects or processes within the department, function, or office results.
* Work is performed independently on moderately complex projects and assignments with some guidance required for direction and complex tasks. Sets objectives for oneself to meet the goals of projects or assignments.


Interpersonal Skills:* Deals with others in a considerate, respectful, and unbiased manner; approaches conflict proactively; solicits and shares feedback openly; listens with empathy and maintains composure.


Attitude:* Displays commitment to the organization and to personal growth; self-motivated and able to motivate and inspire others; asserts self appropriately to champion ideas; tells the truth in a direct and constructive manner.


Initiative:* Self-directs with a strong bias for action; leads the way in improvement of performance or processes; displays keen interest in students and organization.


Problem Solving & Decision Making:* Responsible for employing adjustments or recommended enhancements to systems and processes to solve problems or improve the job area’s effectiveness while leveraging a systems-thinking approach.
* Problems faced may require understanding of broader issues and job areas.


Communication & Influence:* Collaborates with contacts typically within the job area to obtain or provide information requiring some explanation or interpretation.


Leadership & Talent Management:* May provide guidance and assistance to entry-level professionals and or support employees.
* Demonstrates the WGU leadership principles in all aspects of service to students, employees, and partners of WGU Academy.


Minimum Qualifications:* Master’s degree (Education, Leadership, Instructional Design, Communications, or Psychology preferred).
* 3-5 years training experience.
* Knowledge of, and experience applying distance-learning and adult-learning principles.
* Experience in course and curriculum development.
* 2 years of experience in training quality assurance.
* Training sessions may require on-site attendance, either locally or regionally. Some business travel is expected.


Preferred Qualifications:* Change management experience preferred.
* Experience with SharePoint, Confluence, and learning management systems.
* Experience with learning and course authoring software (e.g., Rise, Camtasia).
* Possess a broad knowledge of project management.


Working Conditions* Ability to travel as required for the position. Travel should not exceed 25%.

  

As an equal opportunity employer, WGU recognizes that our strength lies in our people. We are committed to diversity.

title: Staffing Specialist - Organizational Developm
description:
**Title:** Federal Staffing Specialist - Organizational Development Expert

**Location:** Remote; Metro DC; Atlanta, GA


We are seeking driven and experienced Staffing Specialists who excel in dynamic, collaborative environments.


At GovStrive, we are committed and passionate about helping our federal clients better understand the needs of their workforce and support their critical operational priorities for HR. We help them transform their processes, data, and systems to make better decisions for their organization - all while supporting agency missions.


Join our expanding team of committed professionals who will inspire you to achieve your best work.


As a member of the Managed Services team, the Federal HR Staffing Specialist will provide expert support and technical assistance in the development and delivery of organizational change packages, ensuring adherence to designated organizational policies and relevant regulations.

 **Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:**

* Schedule Information Gathering Sessions:
* Arrange and conduct sessions with appropriate personnel to identify necessary changes.
* Document changes for reorganization packages, encompassing assessments, competency gaps, training needs, budget, staffing plans, and employee feedback.
* Schedule follow-up sessions as required.
* Draft Reorganizational Change Packages:
* Prepare and submit draft packages for review, ensuring compliance with applicable regulations.
* Create Reorganizational Change Packages:
* Develop and deliver finalized reorganizational change packages, aligning with the designated organization's policies.
* Adhere meticulously to relevant agency reorganization regulations throughout the package creation process.
* Complete Reorganizational Change Package:
* Finalize the packages, readying them for submission.

 **Required Experience:**

* 5 years of experience as a Federal Staffing Specialist, with experience in creating and delivering organizational change packages following designated organizational policies and relevant regulations.
  

GovStrive fosters a culture that promotes work-life balance and invests in employee development and personal growth. We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including PTO, healthcare, matching 401K, flexible hours, and a collaborative work environment.

 **EEO Statement**


GovStrive is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All aspects of employment, including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. GovStrive does not discriminate in employment on the basis of age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion, sexual orientation, or protected veteran status.

title: ES Benefits Specialist 3 - Lead: Olympia/Telework
company: State of Washington Employment Security Department
description:
**Description**
---------------

  

  

**The ideal candidate will have experience and knowledge of the Paid Family and Medical Leave laws, rules, and business processes. They will have exceptional customer service skills and experience relating to planning, administering, developing, or delivering social, financial or health program services**. **They will have a strong willingness to learn, be self-motivated, pay close attention to details and be a great communicator.**  

As the ES Benefit Specialist 3, Lead, you are assigned to the Customer Care Team unit and report to a Leave and Care Supervisor. You will be the designated lead worker for an assigned team of Leave and Care Specialists who provide excellent customer service, process all claims and premium collections and provide leadership to accomplish the agency’s mission, performance standards and objectives. As a leader within the team, you will mentor, coach and train Leave and Care specialists. You are responsible to review the work of Specialists, make necessary corrections, or refer to another appropriate resource for corrections. Additionally, you will also perform work of a Leave and Care Specialist 2, performing assignments that require-in-depth knowledge to address complicated issues. This full-time/permanent position is primarily telework but may require occasional in-office work for meetings or special events.
**Duties**
----------


In this role you will provide coaching and mentoring for an assigned team of Paid Family and Medical Leave Specialists. Adjusting workload assignments to ensure timely delivery of service, reviewing work of assigned Specialists to ensure accuracy and conformance to laws, regulations, policies and procedures.  

  

**Some of what you'll be doing:**

* Assign work to Leave and Care Specialists.
* Monitor queues to ensure efficient resource deployment that is responsive to inbound customer contact volumes.
* Monitor and maintain processes and procedures for efficient workflow and update as appropriate and in accordance with team Operations guidelines.
* Ensure the work of Leave and Care Specialists meet the timeframes and deadlines set by program requirements.
* Provide guidance to Leave and Care Specialists on difficult, complex or unusual cases.
* Analyze written and oral information to guide Leave and Care Specialists in eligibility determinations, collection of premiums from employers and adjudication of Paid Family and Medical Leave benefits.
* Collaborate with training to serve as a subject matter expert for new hire groups during the Customer Care Academy.
* Respond to inquiries from claimants or employers.
* Provides policy and procedure clarification and consultation.

  

For a full description of duties - please click here to request from recruiter: PDF Request .
**Qualifications**
------------------


**Required:**

* Completion of the Paid Family and Medical Leave Specialist 2 in-training plan.

  

**Additional Requirement of Employment:*** Must be able to pass an Unemployment Insurance (UI) Claim & Benefit Information Review.

**Please submit only the required documents as noted below and ensure all Personal Identifying Information (PII) such as Social Security numbers etc. are edited out of your materials for privacy.**  

  

**Attach your Resume and Cover Letter with your** **Online Application** through the *"Add Attachments"* field. A resume will not substitute for the "work experience" section of the application or vice versa. Applications with blank fields, or supplemental question responses with comments such as "see attachments" may be considered incomplete.


**Supplemental Information**
----------------------------


Our**agency's mission and values**drive every decision that we make, determine how we interact with others, and are at the core of who we are. We value Access, Love, Belonging, Equity, and Stewardship. We understand that a work environment that respects your work/life balance is key; that's why many of our positions are eligible for flexible work schedules and teleworking opportunities. Through support, value, and trust, our employees are empowered to grow and develop into their best self.  

  

**Opportunity for All**  

We strive to create a working environment that includes and respects cultural, ethnic, racial, religious, sexual orientation, and gender identity diversity. Women, racial and ethnic minorities, people with disabilities, people over 40 years of age, people with religious beliefs, veterans or people with military status, and people of all sexual orientations and gender identities are encouraged to apply.  

  

The Employment Security Department is an equal opportunity employer/program. Auxiliary aids and services are available upon request to individuals with disabilities.  

  

If you are a person needing assistance in the application process, if you need this job announcement in an alternate format, or if you have general questions about this opportunity, please contact **Jeanette Nelson** **564-200-2475** or the**Talent Acquisition Team**,or **Washington Relay Service 711**. If you are having technical difficulties creating, accessing, or completing your application, please contact careershelp@des.wa.gov or (360) 664-1960 or toll free (877) 664-1960, Washington Relay 711.

title: Manager, Global Operations (Enterprise Onboarding)
description:
### **About Feedonomics - A Remote-First Company**


Have you ever wondered how companies list their products on Amazon? Or how Google knows which products are in stock in a store near you? How about how your order gets to your door when you buy from a third-party merchant on Amazon? That’s where Feedonomics comes in!


As a leading product feed management platform, Feedonomics works with agencies, brands, and retailers to optimize and list products on the top e-commerce shopping destinations around the world.


What makes us different from other SaaS companies in the space?


We manage everything from onboarding to ongoing feed maintenance for our clients, enabling them to expand their e-commerce business more efficiently.


Since its inception in 2014, Feedonomics has developed an incredible reputation for our full-service approach to feed management, our inclusive culture, and our industry-leading technology. With principles that go beyond optics, Feedonomics looks to deliver the same people-first strategy internally as we do externally.

### **The Global Operations team at Feedonomics**


The Global Operations team at Feedonomics is an incredible group of Feedos who work to ensure our clients have THE best possible experience at Feedonomics. The support side of the team handles both inbound reactive customer support and outbound proactive client success with a focus on quality. Our Global Operations for Marketplaces team is an outstanding team supporting clients listing their products on top shopping destinations like Amazon, eBay, Walmart, and Target Plus! Just listing on these shopping destinations doesn’t translate to immediate success and it is our Marketplace Operations team who is there to support each client along their marketplace journey. Our stellar global operations team and support specialists are available 24/7, enabling Feedonomics to create a full-service feed management experience for advertisers.

### **The Role**


The Marketplaces Manager, Global Operations trains and coaches the Enterprise Feedonomics Onboarding and Feed Build teams, ensures successful client implementation and promotes our Feedonomics culture. In addition, you will be providing guidance regarding the Feedonomics platform, FeedAMP, and the many Marketplace channels we support. This managerial role requires you to work closely with our Leadership Team to provide updates on the Marketplace Ops team. This position will manage our Feedonomics Marketplace Channel business with the goal of “best in class”; this includes, management of client relationships, partnerships and escalation management, client retention, and solving operational problems. The ability to build partnerships with all stakeholders in Operations is essential to ensuring alignment in how we fulfill our clients’ needs. You will be required to have strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills. This role reports directly to the Director of Marketplaces.

### **The Responsibilities**

* Provide people and process leadership for the Marketplace Ops team by being accountable for monitoring KPIs and performance to ensure the team is meeting operational goals and client expectations
* Partner with team Supervisors and Solutionists to troubleshoot complex problems and provide sustainable solutions for our clients
* Ensure team processes and platform best practices are followed and are most efficient
* Create root cause analysis documentation to perform root-cause analysis on client escalations, then extract learning opportunities to improve the quality of service, partnering with the Director of Marketplaces to bring client concerns to a resolution
* Familiarize and stay up to date with relative technical components and concepts utilized within the Feedonomic platform (CSV, XML, Scripts, API, etc.) in order to appropriately service each client’s unique setup, including Marketplace taxonomies
* Suggest new improvements to technology that will directly enhance user and client experience
* Day-to-day cross-collaboration with Product as an Ops liaison that can communicate project needs back to the broader Operations team and disseminate work appropriately
* Ensure client support is continuously available by managing a portion of on-call weekend shifts and taking on urgent requests when needed
* Facilitate team meetings and conduct one-on-one sessions with employees, fostering a supportive team environment. Ensure the overall well-being and cohesion of the team
* Communicate effectively internally and externally, ensuring accurate and timely response

### **The Requirements**

* 3+ years direct people management experience in Operations
* 3+ years of eCommerce data feed management experience
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Experience in identifying and improving processes and procedures
* Ability to build, motivate, and develop strong technical teams by motivating others to meet and exceed job expectations
* Strong relationship management, organizational, and project management skills
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment, and to manage multiple priorities
* Accountability, ability to own responsibilities and produce desired outcome
* Bachelor's degree

### **What's in it for you?**

* Remote work set-up
* Competitive pay
* Unlimited PTO for salaried positions and up to three weeks for hourly employees
* Medical, dental, vision (VSP) insurance, HSA, FSA, life insurance, and more
* Monthly half-day Fridays (yes, really!)
* 401K retirement plans
* Family benefits, such as parental leave, transition benefits for new parents, newborn sick leave, adoption assistance, pet insurance, and more
* Educational assistance as well as Feedonomics certifications
* Virtual and in-person team events
* FeedoFUNds, a dedicated budget to foster and build relationships across the company for team events
* Referral bonus program


Here at Feedonomics, we believe in giving back to our employees as well as the community by engaging in philanthropic events and providing days off to volunteer. We are also committed to our employees' well-being by offering employee assistance programs, access to a wellness app, and diversity and inclusion resource groups.

title: Human Resources Operations Administrator
description:
Why You Should Work With Us::

Arizona College of Nursing is a rapidly growing, nursing school that transforms people’s lives by preparing them for careers in nursing and improving communities through the care its graduates provide. As a leading nurse educator, Arizona College of Nursing offers students the opportunity to earn a bachelor’s in nursing in 3 years or less with qualified transfer credits. Our quality nursing curriculum prepares students for an in-demand career to help communities overcome the chronic, well-known, and increasing nursing shortage. Through the execution of a targeted growth strategy, the college plans to meet the growing demand for nurses by launching campuses in markets where bachelor’s prepared nurses are needed.
  

  

Putting students first, we are dedicated to providing students with an exceptional education in growing healthcare fields; teaching them relevant, required skills for today and the future. Our culture is positive, supportive, and collaborative. As a team, we continually embrace our core values:

 **Passion:** We love helping others succeed.  

**Excellence:** We strive to be the best.  

**Adaptability:** We learn, in part by trying new ideas.  

**Accountability:** We own our results.  

**Integrity:** We do the right thing.


What You'll Do::

The Human Resources Administrator works under the supervision of the HR Operations Manager, The Human Resources Administrator resolves issues, performs benefits admin tasks, processes new hires, and fosters positive relationships throughout the organization. This role provides administrative support to the human resource function as needed, including record keeping, file maintenance, and data entry. They are the first point of contact for employee questions related to Human Resources.  

* HR Operations Support
	+ Maintain employee records and ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
	+ Participate in the formation of HR policies, procedures, and employee communications as needed.
	+ Process onboarding for all new hires.
	+ Update systems, including adding new positions, configuration updates, and other customizations.
	+ Create and manage employee files electronically.
	+ Assist in creation of faculty files electronically.
	+ Own projects through completion as assigned.
* Administer Benefits and Wellness Programs
	+ Process benefits enrollments, changes, and terminations in a timely manner
	+ Serve as the primary point of contact for employee inquiries regarding benefits and wellness programs and assist in resolving any issues.
	+ Coordinate with benefits broker to ensure accurate and timely delivery of services.
	+ Communicate benefits and wellness information to employees through various channels.
	+ Manage information file feeds to benefits carriers.
* Data Management:
	+ Compile and analyze data related to employee benefits utilization, costs, and trends.
	+ Generate reports and presentations for management review.
	+ Ensure the accuracy and integrity of HR data in the HRIS (Human Resources Information System).
	+ Create ad hoc reports for business needs as they arise.
* Compliance
	+ Stay up-to-date on federal, state, and local regulations related to employee benefits and human resources and ensure compliance with them.
	+ Assist in the preparation of required government reports and filings related to benefits and other compliance programs.
	+ Complete year-end tasks.


At Arizona College of Nursing, we believe in a collaborative approach where all colleagues work together towards our shared goals. It's important to note that this list doesn't cover everything you'll be asked to do or need to do. We value adaptability and flexibility as we grow and evolve as an organization.  


What We Need From You::

To perform this job successfully, an applicant must have professional demeanor, understand goals and deadlines and possess excellent communication, customer service and organizational skills.  

Must have:* Bachelor’s degree in human resources, business, a related discipline or equivalent skills and experience.
* 1-2 years of experience in Human Resources (benefits, compensation, and operations preferred).
* Demonstrated success with highly detailed and deadline driven work.
* Demonstrated success with customer service focused work.


Nice to have* Master’s degree in human resources or a related discipline.
* SHRM-CP or HRCI-PHR
* Proficiency in Excel

title: Human Resources Generalist - Tampa/Remote
description:
**Healthesystems offers workplace flexibility with our Work-From-Home model, and a competitive compensation and benefits package including healthcare coverage, PTO, paid holidays, 401(k), company-provided life insurance/disability coverage, wellness options, and more.***Note: This role is remote/work from home, but applicants must live in the Tampa Bay area due to occasional in-office requirements.*


**Summary:** Performs human resources-related duties at the professional level and carries out responsibilities in some or all of the following functional areas as required: employee relations, employee development, performance management, employment law and compliance, benefits programs, payroll, and employee engagement and DEI programs. Supports and collaborates with Human Resources Business Partner(s) by serving as a consultant to management while acting as an employee champion and change agent.



**Key Responsibilities: "To simplify complexities for each customer."**



* Partners with management and department to communicate and implement various human resource policies, procedures, laws, standards, and government regulations. Facilitates record keeping of these policies and procedures.


* Maintains up-to-date records of all employees and manages the retention of employment data within HRIS and other systems.


* Ensures multi-jurisdictional legal compliance by monitoring and implementing applicable HR requirements.


* Collaborates with cross-functional teams to champion and accelerate our culture in which people feel engaged and inspired to deliver top business results through teamwork.


* Collaborates with Talent Acquisition and Learning & Development teams to ensure exceptional and seamless onboarding experience for new hires.


* Handles leave administration, accommodation requests, and work-related injuries.


* Handles offboarding of employees by ensuring the return of all company property, conducting exit interviews, and analyzing data to make recommendations to the management team for corrective action and continuous improvement. May participate in required investigations with the assistance of the HR Business Partner.


* Under the guidance of the HR Business Partner, educates, coaches and partners with managers on performance management and employee development programs (coaching, counseling, career development, and/or corrective actions).


* Under the guidance of HR Business Partner, handles employee relations issues such as employee complaints, harassment allegations, civil rights complaints, and unemployment hearings.


* Acts as back-up to Manager, Talent Acquisition which may involve interviewing, screening, and recruiting job applicants to fill entry level, professional, and technical job openings.


* Acts as back-up to Payroll and HRIS functions.


* Other duties as assigned.
  


**Qualifications/Education/Certifications:**



Bachelor's degree preferably in human resources management or a related field from four-year college or university plus two to four years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. HR certification or willingness to obtain one is highly preferred.


**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**



Highly prefer experience in all of the following areas: employee relations (including handling difficult disciplinary scenarios); employee retention-related activities (i.e. performance feedback, stay conversation, exit interviews, etc.); unemployment, workers' compensation and disability claims; FMLA administration; ADA accommodation; DEI (Diversity, Equity and Inclusion) programs, federal and state employment laws. Knowledge and experience in multi-jurisdictional compliance is a strong plus.



Must be proficient in O365 MS Office products, strong Excel and Word skills, familiarity with PowerPoint. Requires prior HRIS experience (ADP is a plus).



Competencies required: attention to detail, highly organized, strong written and verbal communication skills, adaptable to change, comfortable with minimal supervision/self-starter, the ability to listen and understand the needs of employees while also understanding the needs of the company. Requires the ability to speak in front of a group with ease and professionalism.



**Physical Demands/Working Conditions:**



Duties are performed primarily in a home office setting utilizing computer equipment. *This position may occasionally require the employee to work in the Tampa, FL office with short or no notice.* Travel to attend meetings and visit locations throughout the country may be required. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to use hands. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. *\\*\\*\\* Job descriptions will be reviewed and are subject to changes of business necessity. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*


Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographical cost of labor, etc. In addition to base pay, Healthesystems offers a comprehensive benefits package including, health, dental, vision, disability and life insurance, wellness resources, recognition programs, 401k contribution, and PTO & Holiday pay (all subject to eligibility requirements). Applicable statutory benefits also provided. https://healthesystems.com/careers/

**Anticipated Starting Pay Range**


$58,000—$72,500 USD
To facilitate working from home, and as a requirement for this role, candidates must provide their own reliable, high speed internet access with sufficient bandwidth to execute all job functions. Company laptop will be provided.

description:

title: HR Project Specialist
description:
Overview:

Are you someone with developing leadership and technical capabilities? Do you enjoy building relationships and working collaboratively in a team environment with both internal and external stakeholders? Are you a trusted partner and a problem solver? If you enjoy entrepreneurship and innovation, this opportunity is for you! As someone with excellent communication skills and business acumen, you will thrive in our fast-paced and agile environment. **Your opportunity**
We are currently seeking candidates for the position of **HR Project Specialist** to join Dillon’s HR team in any of our Dillon offices across Canada.  

We offer **flexible work hours** and **remote work opportunities**, to help balance the competing demands of work and personal life.  

Your role involves a combination of technical expertise, project management, and collaboration with various stakeholders to enhance HR processes and systems. Regular communication, staying informed about industry trends, and a proactive approach to problem-solving will be key to success in this role.


Responsibilities:

As an HR Project Specialist with a focus on system administration, documentation, reporting, analytics, compensation, and project management, your role is critical in ensuring the smooth functioning of HR systems and processes. Here is an overview of key responsibilities and tasks associated with your role:

**System Administration and Documentation:**

* Point of Contact for HR System Requests:
+ Handle inquiries and requests related to HR systems, seeking to understand business needs and search for solutions with a continuous improvement mindset.
+ Configure new functionalities and improvements in collaboration with stakeholders.

* Subject Matter Expert:
+ Serve as the go-to person for HR Information System (HRIS) and integrated tools (UKG Pro, UKG Onboarding, HRSoft COMPview).
+ Stay informed about the latest offerings in HRIS to enhance the overall experience.

* Guides and Documentation:
+ Create and maintain comprehensive guides for HR systems, ensuring they are up-to-date.

* Administration Oversight:
+ Work with HR Coordinators to ensure accurate and timely administration of transactions in HRIS and related tools.

**Reporting and Analytics:**

* Report Creation and Editing:
+ Utilize UKG Business Intelligence (BI) to develop and edit reports based on business needs.
+ Ensure the accuracy and relevance of reports.

* Scheduled Reports:
+ Set up and manage scheduled reports to support decision-making processes.

**Compensation:**

* Annual Salary Review Process:
+ Contribute to the annual salary review process, including the setup and maintenance of the compensation system, COMPview.
+ Coordinate the submission of multiple compensation surveys.

### **Project Management:**

* Assist in the submission of the FCP, including NOC matching review, report development, configuration and maintenance of self-ID survey.
* Partner with HR Project Manager on the configuration and rollout of UKG employee self-service
* Ensure compliance with provincial accessibility and pay transparency requirements.
* Lead and manage HR projects tied to annual business plan, as needed.
* Create and maintain HR processes, seeking opportunities for process automation and improvement.
* Collaborate with other internal departments to resolve issues and streamline processes.


Qualifications:
**What you will need to succeed**

**Qualifications*** Post –secondary degree in a human resources program, or related field
* CHRL designation (completed or in progress) is considered an asset
* A minimum of three (3) to five (5) years’ recent experience ideally in a human resources generalist function
* Highly proficient in MS Office software (e.g., PowerPoint, Word, Excel)


Experience: **Experience*** Demonstrated experience working effectively within a collaborative, professional, and dynamic human resources team environment
* Experience leading and/or supporting HR programs and initiatives
* Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and be well-organized, detail-oriented and results-focused
* Demonstrated ability to distill, analyze and report on a range of HR and business data
* A proven track record of handling sensitive and confidential information with discretion and professionalism
* Effective written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills

 **Why choose Dillon**
Dillon is powered by people who are technically proficient, passionate about socially important projects, and motivated to deliver superior, tangible results. We strive to remain at the forefront of technology and innovation, and are empowered to continually grow and develop.  

We live our core values:* Reliability: words result in actions that build trust;
* Achievement: do the work to hit the target;
* Continuous development: always learning; always adapting; always growing;
* Creativity: discover new possibilities;
* Courage: do the things that matter, especially when it’s hard;
* Inclusiveness: enabling belonging to draw strength from our differences.


**In addition, we offer:**

* Employee share purchase plan
+ Dillon is 100% employee owned and share ownership is open to all employees.

* A competitive compensation package
+ Comprehensive health benefits
+ Generous retirement savings plan
+ Student loan repayment assistance with matching employer contributions

* Flexible work hours and remote working options
+ Dillon values its staff and the contributions that are made each day and understands that work arrangements can differ based on personal needs and business needs. We are taking a trust-based approach to oﬀer a variety of ﬂexible work options to help balance the competing demands of work and personal life.

* Learning and Development opportunities
+ As a knowledge-based business, the organic growth of our knowledge and skills occur through our work performance and roles. The creation and sharing of knowledge allows us to take local knowledge to scale, capture lessons learned through experience, and continuously improve service delivery. The development of self and others is an evident and measured core behaviour within our organization.
+ We use a composite approach to development including coaching to build the how, mentoring to share lessons, advising to round out perspectives, and co-creation of knowledge through internal, and learning opportunities.
* Focus on Innovation
+ The ability to anticipate, examine, and adopt new and innovative solutions is a crucial driver for the continual and progressive advancement of our business performance. In our culture, people are empowered to reflect and question current practices and seek forward looking solutions to today’s problems and tomorrow’s opportunities.

* Employee and Family Assistance program
+ A variety of EFAP tools and online resources to support well-being are available to all employees.

* Wellness Subsidy
+ Our employees can take advantage of wellness subsidy that can be put towards expenses for a variety of health and/or wellness related activities such as gym membership, purchase of home fitness equipment, yoga classes and dance classes

 **About Dillon**
Dillon is a proudly Canadian, employee-owned, professional consulting firm specializing in planning, engineering, environmental science and management. We partner with clients to provide committed, collaborative, and inventive solutions to complex, multi-faceted projects. With over 20 offices and more than 1000 employees across Canada, Dillon offers a wide range of services related to building and improving facilities and infrastructure, protecting the environment, and developing communities.  

Now operating for over 75 years, we continue to strive for excellence in everything we do. Dillon has been listed as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies for the past 17 years and has the distinction of having achieved Platinum Club member status in this program. **Employment Equity, Diversity & Inclusion at Dillon:**
Dillon is committed to the principles of employment equity, inclusiveness, and diversity within our organization. We strive to achieve a workplace where opportunities are based on skills and abilities and that respects and values differences.


 Inclusion is more than a word to us, it is the way we choose to run our business.


Please connect with us if you require accommodation in the interview process. We would love to hear from you!

title: HR Generalist
company: PA State System of Higher Education - System Office
description:
The HR Generalist position coordinates and performs a variety of HR functions as a member of the Human Resources team. Works with a diverse population of administrators, staff, faculty, students and the public, and responds to HR inquiries and/or operational questions.

This hybrid position will provide HR Generalist support to System Office employees and managers for approximately 60% of their time (3 days/week). The position will provide HR Generalist support to Kutztown University employees and managers for approximately 40% of their time (2 days/week). The System Office is a primarily remote workforce, and this position will work remotely for 60% of the time (3 days/week). The remaining 2 days/week the position will work on the Kutztown University campus. This position will manage a diverse array of HR responsibilities, including, but not limited to, policy administration, classification and compensation, employee and labor relations, performance management, and recruitment. Assigned work may be completed either independently, or in coordination with System Office and Kutztown University HR subject matter experts. Responsibilities require a highly responsive approach to work, providing excellent customer service, and addressing confidential and highly sensitive matters.

This position will perform duties in the following functional areas, either independently or in coordination with HR subject matter experts:

* Employee / Labor Relations and Employee Performance Management
* Classification and Compensation / Payroll
* Staffing / Recruitment for the System Office
* Organizational Management
* Training and Development
* Time and Attendance
* FMLA and Leaves of Absence
* Employee Benefits & ADA
* System Office HR web page administration
* Other duties as assigned

Minimum Qualifications

A bachelor’s degree and three years of progressively responsible human resources experience, or an equivalent combination of experience and education.

Essential Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

* Knowledge and understanding of the general principles and practices related to human resources management.
* Ability to manage work to meet deadlines in a fast-paced, team-based environment.
* Excellent verbal and written skills.
* Excellent technical skills, utilizing Microsoft Office products.
* Strong behavioral competencies related to results orientation, customer service, continuous improvement, teamwork and collaboration, and valuing diversity.
* Ability to handle sensitive issues and correspondence with confidentiality and discretion.

Preferred Qualifications

Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

* Knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques of classification and compensation administration.
* Knowledge of recruitment and selection practices.
* Experience working with a unionized workforce.
* Familiarity with extracting and analyzing data from human resource information systems

Supplemental Information

The anticipated starting salary range is $55,300 - $71,000, commensurate with experience and skills.

Applications & Resumes will be accepted until position is filled, however; to ensure full consideration, Application materials should be received no later than close of day March 17, 2024

All applications for this position must be submitted via our online application/resume system ONLY. Please do not fax, mail, or e-mail any documentation.

Successful interview, reference checks, background clearances (PA Criminal, Child Abuse Clearance & FBI Clearance), and demonstration of ability are requisite qualifications for all positions.

PASSHE is very interested in hiring employees who have had extensive experience with diverse populations.

We are an AA/EOE/member of the PA State System of Higher Education and actively solicits applications from women and minority candidates.

**Non-Discrimination Statement**  
PASSHE does not discriminate in employment or educational opportunities on the basis of sex, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, or veteran status. To discuss a complaint of discrimination, please contact the University's Title IX Coordinator located in the Office of Social Equity, Old Main A-Wing, Room 02, by phone at 610-683-4700

Pay: $53,500.00 - $71,000.00 per year

* Employee assistance program

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

title: Recruiting Coordinator
description:
**Custard Insurance Adjusters, Inc.**

Recruiting Coordinator

We are growing our company and looking for highly skilled team members to grow with us! We are looking for motivated individuals who are passionate about quality work and providing superior customer service.

**Job purpose**

The Recruiting Coordinator, under the supervision of the Property division, provides administrative support to the recruitment department.

**Duties and responsibilities**

The candidate needs to have a minimum of 1 year of experience in a similar field. The job responsibilities include creating and maintaining employee files, reaching out new potential 1099 and Catastrophe adjusters who have submitted their resumes, receiving inbound calls from adjusters candidates and staff, providing administrative support to the office team, and conducting clerical duties.

**Recruiting Coordinator Responsibilities and Duties:**

· Screen and interview new 1099 and Catastrophe adjuster prospects to include reviewing resumes, licenses, certifications, training, and experience.

· Build relationships with candidates and ensure that candidate profile databases are up-to-date and accurately reflect skillsets.

· Work with recruiting team to communicate adjusters considered eligible for field and contract assignments based on their initial contact and screening.

· Assist with continuous updating of 1099 status based on compliance and contacts.

· Assist with email contact campaigns for onboarded adjusters on a regular basis.

· Manage department inbox.

· Prepare manage and store paperwork for in regards to policies and procedures.

· Maintain schedule and coordinate calendar activities if needed.

· Support with special projects and additional tasks as assigned within the recruitment department.

**Skills and Qualifications:**

· Bachelor degree or relatable job experience.

· Basic understanding of adjustment and insurance terminology a plus.

· Able to use various computer software.

· Punctual, reliable and must have strong communication skill.

· Strong verbal and oral communication skills.

· Self-motivated and strong analytical skills.

· Attention to detail, prioritization skill and time management.

· Maintain a strong relationship with key groups.

· Motivational and communication skill.

· Act as a reliable and supportive team member.

· Able to complete a complex administrative task with less supervision.

As with all positions, this function will be performed by a qualified person. No form of improper discrimination will be used as a job qualification.

For more information about Custard Insurance Adjusters please visit our website at www.custard.com

* Weekends as needed

title: DIRECTOR OF LABOR RELATIONS (REMOTE-BOSTON, PHILADELPHIA, DC)
description:
Compass Corporate
**Salary:** $150-170k base to commensurate with experience


**Other Forms of Compensation:** Bonus eligible


**Pay Grade:** 17


**A family of companies and experiences**


As the leading foodservice and support services company, Compass Group USA is known for our great people, great service and our great results. If you’ve been hungry and away from home, chances are you’ve tasted Compass Group’s delicious food and experienced our outstanding service. Our 225,000 associates work in award-winning restaurants, corporate cafes, hospitals, schools, arenas, museums, and more in all 50 states. Our reach is constantly expanding to shape the industry and create new opportunities for innovation. Join the Compass family today!

**great people. great services. great results.**


Each and every individual plays a key role in the growth and legacy of our company. We know the next big idea can come from anyone. We encourage developing and attracting expertise that differentiates us as a company as we continue to raise the bar.

**Job Summary**
---------------



Compass Group, the world’s leading contract foodservice company, has a Great Opportunity for career development and growth as a Labor Relations Director. This position requires the successful candidate to be based in the New York City metropolitan area.


We seek a candidate with strong 1st Chair experience negotiating collective bargaining agreements. Candidates will have expertise in negotiating agreements, handling grievances, preparing for negotiations, arbitrations, and discipline hearings.


This position is accountable for assisting operational management in achieving labor relations environments that are efficient, cost competitive, consistent with Company policies, procedures, work rules, and free of unnecessary litigation. Position negotiates and administers collective bargaining agreements and provides internal consultation and training to operational management.  



**Responsibilities:**
---------------------


* Assist in identifying and implementing strategic labor objectives.
* Partners with HR and Operations in educating employees on all organized labor issues; review, interpret and make recommendations on company policies and procedures with respect to labor issues; serve as an organizational resource in raising issues that may result in a gap between stated organizational goals and actual practice.
* Aid in the adherence of Compass Group Labor Relations Policy & Philosophy.
* Analyze regional and nationwide bid opportunities and attend proposal meetings with potential clients, as assigned by the VP Labor Relations.
* Provide support, advice, and counsel, as necessary.

**Labor Negotiations**

* Acts as chief spokesperson for multiple labor agreements.
* Plans, sets objectives, and develops appropriate strategies and tactics with operational management.
* Strive to achieve cost effective, cost competitive labor agreements.

**Labor Agreement Administration**

* Administers multiple labor agreements.
* Oversees fact-finding process and provide input when necessary to investigations for site grievances and employee disciplinary issues.
* Advises operational management on disciplinary and contract interpretation issues.
* Train operational management and others to comply with labor agreements and company rules; works actively to avoid unnecessary litigation; recommends resolutions to effectuate the same.

**Employee Relations**

* Provides employee relations training for supervision/management

**Arbitration**

* Acts as company advocate in mediation, arbitration and other government proceedings.
* Prepares for and may present Company’s position; prepares briefs and other documents for proceedings.
* To uphold the integrity of Company’s labor agreements and management actions.
**Qualifications:**
-------------------


* Bachelor’s degree is required; Labor Relations, Business, or Human Resources focus is preferred; advanced degree preferred (e.g., JD)
* 7+ years of Labor Relations experience in a multi-location environment, where at least 25% of the locations are unionized
* Experience conducting effective & objective investigations and recommending the advisability of corrective action
* Experience in grievance handling and arbitration preparation
* Extensive experience in negotiations with excellent communications skills, including being Chief Spokesperson
* Experienced with Union organizing campaigns and awareness training with operators preferred
* Willing and able to travel 60%+ by air and automobile; driver's license required
* Experience can be either from a management or labor perspective
* Experience in food, vending services, and support services a plus
* Current knowledge of National Labor Relations Act rules and precedent
* Bilingual (e.g., Spanish) strongly preferred
* Strong ability to use advanced technology for remote meetings, trainings, and negotiations
* Self-started, personally manages all documentation and processes in a timely manner without administrative support
**Apply to Compass Group today!**

**Click here to Learn More about the Compass Story**

 **Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.**

Disclaimer: this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity. We encourage applicants with a criminal history (and driving history) to apply.**

Applications are accepted on an ongoing basis.

title: PEOPLE & CULTURE GENERALIST
description:
TCM Bank is in Tampa, FL. This is a remote opportunity. If living outside of the area, travel expectations would be at least 4 times (over-night travel) per year. Qualified candidates located in the states where we do business will be considered: AL, AZ, DC, FL, GA, IA, KY, MD, MA, MO, NE, NC, OH, OR, PA, SC, TX, & VA.
  
  

**SUMMARY:**  

The People & Culture Generalist provides support for day-to-day People Office operations as it relates to human resources. This includes responding to employee inquiries, supporting Talent Acquisition, processing HRIS workflow, and coordinating benefit & payroll support, etc. The individual will play a role in projects for continuous improvement of HR processes and the employee experience which provides general support to the People Office’s strategic goals and TCM’s Guiding Principles. A successful People & Culture Generalist will build sustainable service-focused relationships with employees, highlighting employee engagement and fostering the TCM culture.
  
  

**DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Acts as the first level of response and interaction for the department while balancing urgency and timeliness of duties.
* Serve as a consultant to employees in areas of process, policy and resource guidance, general benefit and leave inquiries and training.
* Answer questions pertaining to the interpretation of HR policies, including employee handbook, HR, or Payroll related questions.
* Contribute, create, and publish employee communications for TCM People Office SharePoint site.
* Build strong professional relationships with employees and teams to deliver value-added services.
* Assist People Office leaders with HR-related metrics: ad-hoc reporting, local market research, and analysis, as needed.
* Collaborates and supports HR in areas such as talent acquisition, engagement, and leave of absence.
* Responsible for the recruitment process for entry to mid-level positions. Includes managing the requisition process, identifying appropriate sourcing strategies, & supporting the hiring manager on the candidate selection process.
* Collaborate with Managers to onboard new hires, conduct orientation, and partner with the People Office for the overall new employee experience.
* Assist the Manager, People & Culture on employee relation matters.
* Assist the department in planning, budgeting, events, or training.
* Conduct exit interviews and be responsible for the employee exit/separation process.
* Stay current on developments in federal and state laws, and employee/employer relations.
* Is a point of contact for data collection in compliance with bank-specific audits, EEO, and payroll; includes running reports and submitting data.
* Coordinates culture and celebration initiatives surrounding employee life events.
* Promote inclusion, engagement, and continuous improvement.
* Build and maintain relationships with the parent organization, industry contacts, and vendors.
* Other duties as assigned.


**IDEAL CANDIDATE:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or related field (preferred).
* Must have at least 3 years of HR experience in roles such as HR Generalist or Sr. HR Coordinator, in lieu of degree. This should include supporting a non-exempt employee population.
* SHRM-CP or PHR certification required or must be able to obtain within 1 year of employment. Maintenance of certification is required.
* Multi-state experience and knowledge of employment law and compliance are preferred.
* Solid understanding of Wage and Hour laws, including FLSA and timesheet payroll practices.
* Requires solid knowledge of principles and practices of human resource administration.
* Proven experience and demonstration of utilizing resources and tools available that provide guidance or cultivate solutions that encompass the company culture.
* Demonstrates strong communication, guidance techniques, and principles to guide employees to the best resolution and outcome.
* Demonstrated experience and knowledge of EEO and governmental compliance laws, including file submission of EEO1 reporting.
* Desire and ability to grow and develop skillsets for future growth and advancement.
* Knowledge of laws affecting human resources administration.
* Knowledge and understanding of leave administration (FMLA, ADA, etc.).
* Will have demonstrated ability to understand, interpret, and apply policies and procedures and provide guidance on all HR issues.
* Collects and analyzes information to synthesize and problem solve.
* Demonstrated team player with the ability to work independently and remotely.
* Thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Balance shifting competing priorities and tasks while meeting deadlines and urgency.
* Demonstrated ability to prioritize and execution of duties.
* High degree of confidentiality.
* Intermediate-level skills in Microsoft Office Suite.
* Experience with Dayforce a plus.


TCM Bank, N.A. embraces the diversity of its applicants and employees and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
  
  

Actual compensation offered to candidate will be finalized at offer and may be above or below the posted range due to skill level, experience, industry specific knowledge, education/certifications, etc. The offer rate represents one component of TCM Bank's total compensation package. Employees will also receive several benefits as listed below. Other compensation for this position may include bonus eligibility in the TCM Annual Bonus Incentive Program.
  
  

**BENEFITS OFFERED:**  

* Competitive medical, dental and vision benefits
* 401(k) and Roth 401(k) retirement plans with company match
* Flexible spending accounts (medical and dependent care)
* Company-paid parental leave
* Educational assistance
* Company paid continuing education credits
* Paid employee assistance program
* 12 paid holidays, including discretionary early closures before holidays and company events. (More than your average company!)
* Multiple time-off options for vacation, volunteering, or care for yourself or loved ones


TCM Bank is in Tampa, FL. This is a remote opportunity. If living outside of the area, travel expectations would be at least 4 times (over-night travel) per year. Qualified candidates located in the states where we do business will be considered: AL, AZ, DC, FL, GA, IA, KY, MD, MA, MO, NE, NC, OH, OR, PA, SC, TX, & VA or will be willing to relocate (TCM does not provide relocation).
  
  

No sponsorships available for this position.
  
  

Principals Only. No Agencies Please.

title: HR Generalist
description:
\\*\\* This role is open to remote employees in select US states: Colorado, Utah, Texas, Missouri, Michigan, and Georgia.

**About AVL Growth Partners**


AVL Growth Partners is a fractional services firm supporting rapidly growing small and medium-sized enterprises. We step in as our clients’ dedicated team of experts to provide the right level of support while they grow and scale with our expert guidance. While our services originated in Finance and Accounting, we have recently branched beyond that niche and now offer clients expert HR services. This role will work fractionally with clients, specifically in a Human Resources capacity.

 **Position Overview**


As a Human Resources Generalist, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the overall HR function of our client’s organization. You will work closely with our clients’ employees and leadership as well as AVL HR leaders to provide guidance and support on various HR-related matters, fostering a positive work environment and ensuring compliance with company policies and applicable labor laws. Your responsibilities will be guided by senior AVL HR leaders and could encompass compliance, employee relations, performance management, benefits administration, and other HR-related tasks.

 **Key Responsibilities**

**Onboarding:**+ Assist in facilitating the onboarding process for new employees, ensuring a smooth integration into the company.
**Employee Relations:**+ Act as a point of contact for employees, addressing and providing direction on their inquiries, concerns, and HR-related matters.
+ Mediate and resolve level one employee conflicts and grievances, fostering a positive work environment.
+ Monitor and promote employee morale and engagement, suggesting initiatives for improvement.
**Performance Management:**+ Assist in the implementation and management of performance appraisal processes.
+ Collaborate with client management and AVL HR leaders to provide guidance on performance improvement plans and employee development strategies.
**Payroll & Benefits Administration:**+ Oversee and administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other company offerings.
+ Educate employees on available benefits and support them in resolving benefits-related issues.
**Compliance and Policy Adherence:**+ Ensure compliance with relevant labor laws and regulations, updating policies and documents as needed.
+ Assist in maintaining HR policies and procedures, ensuring their effective implementation.
**Training and Development:**+ Identify potential client training needs within the client organization and work with AVL HR leaders to develop plans to address identified gaps. coordinate employee development programs.
+ Assist and coordinate delivery of HR-related training sessions for employees and management.
**HR Reporting and Data Management:**+ Maintain accurate HR records and employee databases.
+ Generate HR reports and analytics to support decision-making processes.
**HR Projects and Initiatives:**+ Participate in HR-related projects, such as employee engagement surveys, talent acquisition strategies, and diversity and inclusion initiatives.

 **Requirements & Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
* 4+ years of proven experience as an HR Generalist or similar role, with a comprehensive understanding of HR best practices and employment laws.
* PHR certification highly preferred
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships and effectively communicate with diverse audiences.
* Problem-solving and conflict-resolution skills, coupled with high empathy and professionalism.
* Detail-oriented and highly organized, capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Proficiency in various HRIS (Human Resources Information Systems) and applications.
* Knowledge of HR metrics and reporting.
* Familiarity with recruitment processes, onboarding procedures, and performance management techniques.

**Traits that support being successful in our environment**

* Quickly being able to migrate from one task to another efficiently and effectively.
* Strong proactive communication skills with a variety of stakeholders.
* Ability to effectively manage time with tasks, due dates, and expectations.
* Self-starter with the ability to work independently without issue
* Agile in the way work is completed to meet competing client needs
* Ability to understand your audience and adjust accordingly

**Compensation**

* Compensation for this position is based on experience and technical proficiency.
* AVL offers optionality with the number of hours worked weekly (Looking for desired hours between 10-20 hours/week to start)
* The hourly base pay rate is between $35-$45 per hour


The HR Generalist role is essential in ensuring a smooth and efficient HR operation within the organization. As a team player passionate about employee well-being and development, you will contribute significantly to maintaining a productive and engaging work environment for all employees.
