title: Operations HR & Customer Success Coordinator
description:
**Tired of working in a soulless culture where you're underappreciated? Then don't. Join the experts on PLAY.**

**You know what we like about you?**

* You've got hustle, good instincts and a compulsive urge for organization
* You have true caring for people and a passion for bringing fun to others
* You're detail-oriented. You dot the "I"s and cross the "T"s in your work
* You believe that a team of extraordinary people, in the right culture, can change the world
* You like getting your hands dirty, tackling challenges and solving problems that help the company grow. (It also doesn't hurt that you enjoy sports.)


So why use your talents where you're not appreciated or where the company cares more about the bottom line than the customer? Meanwhile, we're out here bringing people together, organizing sports leagues and fun team building events for individuals, groups and companies that want to bring their employees together.


At ZogLife, we believe life is better with real personal connections, caring communities and a sense of play. With that as our guiding light, we've built ZogSports, the nation's leading adult recreational sports company, serving six markets and tens of thousands of players every year. And now, we're looking for a **full-time Operations HR & Customer Success Coordinator** to join the ZogSports team to help us grow our leagues nationwide.

**What's the role?**


ZogSports is America's most popular adult social sports community, with operations in New York, New Jersey, DC, Los Angeles, San Francisco and San Jose. As many people return to the office or as our customers look for reasons to leave their apartments, ZogSports leagues have been relaunching at a fast pace in all of our markets. To support the growth and scaling of the business, we are hiring an **Operations HR & Customer Success Coordinator** to report to our Vice President & ZogSports General Manager.


The **Operations HR & Customer Success Coordinator** will have the ability to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment and work with a dynamic team. You will be well-supported, much appreciated, and an integrated team member from day one.


**What you'll be doing:**

* ***Field Team Hiring***- Source, hire, onboard and train field team, working directly with human resources and legal teams.
* ***Training Curriculum C******reation*** - Create a new training curriculum for field team including sports-specific and other skill training
* ***Field Team Training & Development*** - Implement the new training curriculum through a series of in-person and online trainings, which may be individual or in groups
* ***Field Team Management*** - Work closely with Field Team members, especially the Field Manager staff to focus on customer satisfaction and quality of product through ongoing training
* ***Operations*** - Work with field team and operations staff to organize equipment and logistics for league play
* ***Customer Service*** - Support customer service team with answering emails and tickets and occasionally interacting with customers to reach resolution as needed

**What else is important?**

* Ability to work from home with a typical M-F 10am-6pm schedule and occasional work from shared workspace with other team members. Also, frequent on-site visits including evenings and/or weekends

**Requirements, Skills, Knowledge and Experience**

* BA or BS degree or a minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience
* Experience with hiring and onboarding at significant volume
* Experience with indirect and/or direct people management
* Excellent organization skills and attention to detail
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
* Ability to function efficiently in fast-paced environment
* Creative and effective problem-solving skills
* Confidence to make decisions of importance
* Exercise sound judgment
* Ability to handle multiple projects at one time and work both independently as well as within a team
* Comfortable with technology, especially Microsoft Office Suite (mainly Excel, Outlook and Word) and videoconferencing platforms (e.g., Zoom)
* Live within commuting distance of New York City

**How you will grow and learn:**


Running a business * - Learn about operating profit and making decisions in order to scale the business
* Managing people - Learn how to interview and hire A-level players, be a coach, ask great questions and give objective feedback.
Taking risks * - Learn to take calculated risks without a fear of failure

**Why should you apply to ZogLife?**

* **We care about our employees.** ZogSports makes Crain's *Best Places To Work* list for a reason. Caring is a ZogSports core value and as a result every ZogLife full-time employee currently receives:
	+ Medical insurance coverage (with possible contribution from the employee; coverage starts on 1st day of employment)
	+ Participation rights (as dictated by the plan) in ZogLife retirement plan during employment with employer profit-share contribution
	+ Unlimited Paid Time Off
	+ Paid holidays when the office is closed (11 in calendar year 2023)
	+ 2-week winter break when the office is closed
	+ Early Fridays (office closes at 2pm)
	+ Work from home stipend
	+ Learning stipend
	+ Paid parental leave
	+ Free play in ZogSports leagues

*Please note: These benefits are subject to change at any time.*

* Our culture is fun, energetic, and encourages you to be yourself and explore your potential
* This is a great gig where you'll have a ton of responsibility, flex your creativity, grow your sales and business skillsets, and have fun coming to work every day

**ZogLife Core Values:**


We expect all team members to internalize and adhere to our core values of:

**Fun:** We facilitate other people's fun and have fun making it happen

**Team Player:** Through the spirit of camaraderie, we share ideas, efforts and resources to accomplish our goals

**Caring:** We care about the company, each other and the work we do. We care about our customers, their experience and the communities in which we play

**Reliable:** We do what we say, meet our commitments and provide a consistent customer experience with relentless organization

**Own It:** We take ownership and do whatever it takes. We are go-getters who identify and creatively solve problems

**Continuous Improvement:** We are committed to getting better every day in everything we do as individuals and as a company

 **TO APPLY:**

**Please include your resume** **and** **cover letter with your application**

* Compensation for this job an annual salary of $60,000 - $65,000
* Due to the great number of resumes we receive daily, we regret that we are unable to respond individually to each person interested in our company, or answer inquiries regarding the status of a particular resume. If there is interest in interviewing you, a representative from ZogSports will contact you in the near future. Thank you for submitting your resume to ZogSports.


ZogSports is an Equal Opportunity Employer

 **More About ZogLife**


ZogLife is a family of brands including ZogSports and ZogCulture that all believe in the same WHY:

 **We believe that life is better with real personal connections, caring communities and a sense of play.**

 **We're about community**. ZogLife organizes recreational sports leagues and corporate programming to bring our WHY to participants throughout the U.S. Charity is an integral part of ZogSports' leagues, and we've donated over $3.4MM to charities selected by winning teams.

title: HR Generalist
description:
**Gastro Health is seeking a Full-Time HR Generalist to join our team!**
------------------------------------------------------------------------


Gastro Health is a great place to work and advance in your career. You'll find a collaborative team of coworkers and providers, as well as consistent hours.


**This role offers:**
---------------------

* A great work/life balance
* No weekends or evenings – Monday thru Friday
* Paid holidays and paid time off
* Rapidity growing team with opportunities for advancement
* Competitive compensation
* Benefits package

**Duties you will be responsible for:**
---------------------------------------


* Implement and administer HR programs and policies, including but not limited to recruitment, onboarding,  

performance management, employee relations, and compliance.
* Coordinate the recruitment process, including posting job openings, screening resumes, conducting interviews,  

and facilitating the hiring decision.
* Manage the onboarding process for new hires, including orientation, paperwork completion, and introduction to  

company policies and procedures.
* Provide guidance and support to employees and management on HR-related issues, including but not limited to  

employee relations, performance management, and disciplinary actions.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, including personnel files, HRIS data, and timekeeping  

records.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant labor laws and regulations, including EEO, FMLA, ADA, and OSHA.
* Conduct investigations into employee complaints or concerns, and recommend appropriate actions to resolve  

issues.
* Assist with the development and implementation of employee training and development programs.
* Coordinate employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other employee perks.
* Participate in HR projects and initiatives as assigned by management.

**Minimum Requirements:**


* Proficiency in MS systems and PDF software such as Adobe Acrobat
* Time management and organizational skills
* Proficient in Smartsheet's
* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
* Master's degree or HR certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is a plus.
* Proven experience as an HR Generalist or similar role, with a minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience.
* In-depth knowledge of HR principles, practices, and procedures.
* Strong understanding of employment laws and regulations.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with employees at all levels of the  

organization.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.
* Strong organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
* Proficiency in MS Office and HRIS software.
* Experience working in a fast-paced environment and managing multiple priorities simultaneously.
* Demonstrated problem-solving and decision-making abilities.

**We offer a comprehensive benefits package to our eligible employees:**

  

* 401(k) retirement plans with employer
* Safe Harbored Contributions of 3%
* Discretionary profit-sharing contributions of up to 4%
* Health insurance
* Employer contributions to HSAs and HRAs
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* Flexible spending accounts
* Voluntary life insurance
* Voluntary disability insurance
* Accident insurance
* Hospital indemnity insurance
* Critical illness insurance
* Identity theft insurance
* Legal insurance
* Pet insurance
* Paid time off
* Discounts at local fitness clubs
* Discounts at AT&T

Additionally, Gastro Health participates in a program called Tickets at Work that provides discounts on concerts, travel, movies, and more.

  

  

Gastro Health is the one of the largest gastroenterology multi-specialty groups in the United States, with over 130+ locations throughout the country. Our team is composed of the finest gastroenterologists, pediatric gastroenterologists, colorectal surgeons, and allied health professionals. We are always looking for individuals that share our mission to provide outstanding medical care and an exceptional healthcare experience. We offer a comprehensive benefits package to our eligible employees.


Gastro Health is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, gender, disability, protected veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law.


We thank you for your interest in joining our growing Gastro Health team!

title: Talent Acquisition Partner
description:
**Now Hiring! Talent Acquisition Partner**
------------------------------------------

  

Research Triangle Park, NC (Remote)


Pay Range: $83,200 - $114,000

 **The world needs creative solutions. We need YOU!**

 **Where the chemistry happens…**


As a Talent Acquisition Partner, you will be responsible for consultative recruitment of outstanding talent. You will partner with site leadership and hiring managers to understand their business and talent needs in order to ensure the highest quality candidates are presented in the most time effective manner. You will collaborate across sourcing, candidate care and diversity strategy, leveraging critical thinking and influencing skills to resolve complex and challenging situations.

**As a Talent Acquisition Partner, You Create Chemistry By...**
---------------------------------------------------------------

* Developing and executing a staffing strategy for assigned businesses focused on creative sourcing methods to identify high-potential, diverse talent.
* Proactively identifing and developing solutions to talent pipeline challenges and partner with talent attraction, candidate care, and diversity strategy resources as needed.
* Being responsible for building and implementing creative sourcing partnerships with external solution providers.
* Being responsible for leading regional strategic projects to provide sustainable Talent Acquisition solutions.
* Anticipating changing needs of hiring managers and the businesses he/she supports and adjusts strategy accordingly.
* Being adept at building and maintaining a strong internal network with key stakeholders.
* Effectively balancing process excellence and strategic effectiveness.
* Being accountable for performance targets (i.e. conversion ratio, recruiting effectiveness, hiring manager and candidate satisfaction).
* Enabling optimization of hiring decisions in the context of the broader talent strategy.
* Challenging and educating hiring managers on talent assessment, business/talent risks of hiring certain candidates, and talent assumptions.
**If you have...**
------------------

* Comprehensive behavioral based interviewing and candidate assessment skills.
* Demonstrated experience building relationships, consulting and influencing hiring managers in regard to candidate sourcing and selection, market demographics, and broadening search parameters to improve quality of talent pool.
* Experience developing and executing recruitment strategies in varied regional markets, preferably in a high volume, fast paced environment, with ownership over the candidate and hiring manager experience.
* Knowledge of current networking and sourcing trends including extensive use of LinkedIn and social media channels.
* Current knowledge of state and federal employment/labor laws and practices.
**Then...**
-----------

 **Click below to Belong@BASF!**

 **Create Your Own Chemistry when taking advantage of our Total Rewards.**


At BASF you get more than just compensation, Medical & Dental. Our total offer includes a wide range of elements you need to be your best in every stage of your life. That’s what we call you@BASF. Our Periodic Table of Benefits includes some additional perks below for starters…

* Flexible Work Arrangements whenever possible
* Retirement Benefits
* Maternity/Paternity Leave, Infertility & Adoption reimbursement
* Mentoring & Development Programs
* Employee Discounts
* Pet insurance
* Matching Donations to your favorite cause
* Access to our BASF Wine Cellar and much more!
**Privacy Statement**
---------------------

  

BASF takes security & data privacy very seriously. We will never request financial information of any kind via email, private text message or direct message on any social medial platform or job board. Furthermore, we will never send a candidate a check for equipment or request any type of payment during the job application process. If you have experienced any of the above, please contact myhr@basf.com to report fraud.

**Pay Transparency**
--------------------

  

BASF is committed to pay transparency practices. The competitive Pay Range for this role is $83,200 - $114,000. Actual pay will be determined based on education, certifications, experience, and other job-related factors permitted by law.

**Equal Employment Opportunities**
----------------------------------

  

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

  

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

title: Director Knowledge Management
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY**



We are looking for a Director of Knowledge Management with deep expertise in formulating and executing knowledge management strategies grounded in first-principles thinking within regulated industries. Your role will involve simplifying and transforming our existing approach to knowledge management in collaboration with Legal, Sales, Product, and Engineering teams. This key strategic role involves leading a small but mighty team and operating at the exciting intersection of technology and knowledge management. This role will champion efforts to productize our intellectual property with the potential to power our proprietary platform.



You will help us establish parameters for how Velocity Global knowledge is created, organized, verified, shared, and updated. You will work cross-functionally with departments and teams to establish and document organizational knowledge as well as build a customer-facing resource center, improve the overall functionality, establish metrics for use, and support the access of company knowledge via a knowledge base.



As part of the Business Operations team and reporting to the VP, Strategy & Planning, you will help shape and ruthlessly execute on a shared vision that everyone can drive towards. The team this role is a part of is primarily based out of the United States.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**



Operationalize Knowledge Management Strategy (25%)


* Establish a framework and strategy for codifying explicit, implicit, tacit, compliance, and procedural knowledge throughout the organization.
* Conduct a knowledge audit to determine what knowledge gaps exist and develop a game plan to address these.
* Set strategic goals and look at key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of Velocity Global's knowledge management efforts.
* Roll out the strategy to the entire organization, ensuring all teams recognize and apply best knowledge management practices.


Knowledge Project Management (25%)


* Partner with internal subject matter experts across key teams (Legal & Compliance, HR Experience, Customer Education, etc.) to codify knowledge needed to execute Velocity Global programming (e.g., processes, SOPs, country-specific compliance, policies, guides).
* Partner with subject matter experts and managers to identify org-wide and team-specific knowledge gaps and co-create documentation accordingly.
* Partner closely with Product and Engineering to build out in-house knowledge management capabilities and productize our compliance data and information.
* Identify and designate internal knowledge champions who can effectively craft and update concise documentation within the knowledge base.


Implement Knowledge Base Management System (50%)


* Identify, implement, and manage a new knowledge base (KB) or knowledge management system (KMS) and transfer existing documentation from current internal sources to the new system.
* Establish the information architecture (content hierarchy) and overall structure of Velocity Global's knowledge base, ensuring navigation, content, and brand guidelines are followed.
* Create guidelines and standards for how content should be written and created (e.g., compliance policies, technical documentation, instructional manuals, how-to guides, and process maps).
* Support teams by creating content (e.g., writing a how-to page) as needs arise (e.g., when an expert isn't needed).
* Provide ongoing analysis of existing knowledge management processes to define, document, and drive changes (e.g., supporting or rolling out new features such as help center, chatbots, Support integrations, etc.),
* Troubleshoot user issues in our Knowledge Base.


**QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS**


* Bachelor's degree in Knowledge Management, Information Science, Business Administration, or a related field.
* Minimum 8 years' experience in knowledge management, information management, or a related field, including experience in a leadership role.


Preferred Qualifications


* Minimum 5 years of intimate experience creating and curating content in Knowledge Bases or Knowledge Management Systems (e.g., Zendesk, Confluence, Guru, Notion, Airtable).
* Experience in identifying and assessing knowledge gaps and opportunities for improvement, including authoring robust technical and functional documentation.
* Previous relevant experience in full lifecycle project management /leadership experience - planning, prioritization, project/team management, and delivery.
* Proven track record of building, implementing, and maintaining knowledge management systems and processes.
* Ability to build trust-based relationships, influence effectively, communicate clearly, and work in cross-functional team structures.
* Prior experience building a knowledge management function.

  


GO FARTHER WITH VELOCITY



At Velocity Global, we're building a dream team made up of the world's best talent. We're looking for people like you to join us as we make opportunity borderless for people everywhere.



ABOUT VELOCITY GLOBAL



At Velocity Global, our values represent who we are and the company we want to be. We harness the power of unity, diversity, and collaboration, drive for impact, and win as a team - bringing our unique talents together to achieve our common goals. In partnership with our customers and ourselves, we are better together, and together, we win.



Please refer to our present benefits offering here.

title: HR Support Center Representative (Remote)
description:
**General Overview**

The HR Support Center Rep 1 will resolve inquiries from employees, managers, retirees, and other customers and external parties. They will also help resolve concerns and issues regarding processes and policies through phone, email, case management, and chat. This person will strive to meet all expected service levels and business performance goals, performing a range of services and fully documenting all cases in the case management system.

**Principle Responsibilities and Duties**

* Respond to requests / inquiries from customers (prioritizing as appropriate) and execute on the key tasks and activities in accordance with defined procedures and guidelines
* Ensure delivery of business results by meeting or exceeding all service level agreements and delivering high quality services that meet or exceed customer expectations
* Investigate issue areas and determine methods of mitigation to resolve problems within acceptable timeframes, routing or escalating complex transactions to supervisor, manager, customer service specialists or tier two for resolution as appropriate
* Receive inbound inquiries via multiple channels (phone, email, case management, chat, etc.), clarify the need and assist in the resolution of concerns
* Fully document all cases in case management application, establish / update processes as necessary
* Partner with HR counterparts (in Shared Services and across institutions) to ensure all escalated issues are resolved and service levels met
* Assist and encourage users to make effective use of self-service options, empower them to solve inquiries
* Educate and inform customers of the full range of shared service support available to them

**Qualifications** 

· A combination of education and experience may be substituted for requirements

· Bachelor’s degree or relevant professional experience

· Proficiency with Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint, and familiarity with ServiceNow for case / knowledge management

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $24.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: HR Generalist
description:
English version

Embark on an exciting opportunity as a People Generalist at our Laval-based subsidiary of Riedel Communications. Be at the heart of shaping our company culture, ensuring compliance with Canadian and Quebec employment regulations, and nurturing the growth of our diverse team. If you're passionate about People and seeking to make an impact in a global leader in communication solutions, we encourage you to apply today and become part of our journey!

  


**What we do at Riedel Canada**



Riedel Canada is a pioneer in the use of small form-factor pluggable (SFP) modules for digital signal processing. Our Engineering Hub develops miniaturized IP gateways, signal processors and converters for broadcast video applications, whilst our Operations team makes it all come to life. We work with passionate talents and our company culture fosters diversity, inclusion and… real fun!

  


**Your role**



As our Quebec based People Generalist, you will be reporting to the Head of People Operations. Alongside the R&D and Operations directors, you will be at the forefront of all the People Operations for Riedel Canada and you will act as the go to person to provide support and guidance to employees and management, and ensure a smooth run of the Laval site.



Please note this is an ***hybrid position*** and your presence is required at the office at least ***3 days per week***. The more you are in touch with our people, the better you can support them!

  


**Generous and attractive benefits**


* Company funded group insurance as of day 1 including short term disability coverage, telemedecine and EAP
* Group RRSP matching plan
* Generous paid leave plan
* Additional week during the holiday season
* 10 personal days per year
* Flexible working hours and option to work from home (max 2 days per week)
* Weekly fruit baskets
* Seasonal hockey tickets
* Social events throughout the year led by a dynamic social committee
* Free charging stations for electric cars

  


**What you will mostly be doing**


* Promote a positive work environment, including driving the spirit of the social committee, coordinating onboarding and orientation programs for new hires, ensuring a smooth transition into the company.
* Manage employee relations issues, including investigations, conflict resolution, and disciplinary actions.
* Run the recruitment process, including drafting, reviewing and posting job openings, manage job fairs, screening resumes, scheduling interviews, and conducting reference checks.
* Administer HR policies and procedures, ensuring compliance with legal requirements and company standards.
* Oversee payroll administration, including timekeeping, benefits enrolment, and liaising with external payroll and benefits providers.
* Support performance management processes, including goal setting, performance evaluations, and development planning.
* Coordinate training and development initiatives to enhance employee skills and capabilities.
* Maintain accurate employee records, including personnel files, HRIS data, and other HR-related documentation.
* Stay updated on changes in employment laws and regulations at the federal and provincial levels.
* Collaboration on interesting projects on various HR topics.

  


**You will inspire us with...**


* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management or a related field.
* Minimum of 3 to 5 years of HR experience, preferably in a global tech company.
* Strong knowledge of Canadian federal and Quebec provincial employment laws and regulations.
* Experience in recruitment, onboarding, employee relations, and payroll and benefits administration.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with self-starter competence and the ability to build positive relationships at all levels of the organization.
* Self sufficiency with HRIS (Success Factors an asset).
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills.
* Ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and to maintain confidentiality.
* Proficiency in both French and English.
* HR certification (e.g., CHRP, CPHR) is an asset.

  



We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.



We look forward to receiving your application. We thank all the applicants and only those selected will be contacted.


French version

Embarquez pour une opportunité passionnante en tant que Généraliste des Ressources Humaines au sein de notre filiale basée à Laval de Riedel Communications. Soyez au cœur de notre culture d'entreprise, tout en veillant à la conformité des normes et en soutenant la croissance de notre équipe polyvalente.



Si vous êtes passionné.e par les Ressources Humaines et souhaitez avoir un impact au sein d'un joueur mondial de l'audiovisuel, nous vous invitons à postuler dès aujourd'hui pour rejoindre notre aventure !

  


**Ce que nous faisons chez Riedel Canada**



Riedel Canada est un pionnier dans la production de SFP (small form-factor pluggable) pour le traitement numérique des signaux. Notre centre d'ingénierie développe des passerelles IP miniaturisées, des processeurs de signaux et des convertisseurs pour les applications vidéo de diffusion, tandis que notre équipe des opérations est en charge de donner vie à toute cette technologie. Nous travaillons avec des talents passionnés et notre culture d'entreprise favorise la diversité, l'inclusion et... du fun !

  


**Votre rôle**



Vous travaillerez sous la supervision du Responsable des Opérations des Ressources Humaines. Aux côtés des directeurs de site (R&D et Opérations), vous serez en première ligne des ressources humaines pour le site manufacturier de Laval. Vous vous positionnerez comme la personne de référence pour apporter un soutien aux employé.e.s et à la direction, co-garantissant ainsi le bon fonctionnement du site.



Veuillez noter qu'il s'agit d'une ***position hybride*** et qu'***au moins 3 jours par semaine*** doivent être effectués en personne au bureau.

  


**Une panoplie d'avantages dynamiques et attractifs!**


* À partir de 3 semaines de congés annuels
* 10 jours flexible par année
* Semaine de congé additionnelle en fin d'année
* Horaires de travail flexibles
* Assurance collective dès le premier jour d'emploi, incluant une assurance salaire de courte durée, de la télémedecine et un programme d'aide aux employé.e.s
* Généreuse contribution employeur au REER
* Formation continue
* Des évènements sociaux tout au long de l'année, guidés par un comité social dynamique
* Des bornes de recharges gratuites pour véhicules électriques
* Paniers de fruits frais
* Billets de saison des Canadiens!

  


**Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?**


* Promouvoir un environnement de travail positif, en soutenant le comité social, en coordonnant les programmes d'intégration pour les nouveaux employés, et en assurant un démarrage inclusif.
* Gérer les relations employé.e.s, y compris les enquêtes, la résolution des conflits et les actions disciplinaires.
* Mener le processus de recrutement, incluant la rédaction, la révision, la publication des offres d'emploi, la gestion des salons de l'emploi, la sélection des CV, la planification des entretiens et les prises de références.
* Administrer les politiques et procédures des ressources humaines, en conformité avec les exigences légales et lesstandards corporatifs.
* Superviser l'administration de la paie et des avantages sociaux et faire le lien avec les différents prestataires de services externes.
* Soutenir les processus de gestion des performances (définition des objectifs, les évaluations de performance et planification du développement).
* Coordonner les initiatives de formation et de développement pour améliorer les compétences et les capacités des employés.
* Maintenir à jour les dossiers des employé.e.s, y compris les dossiers du personnel, les données du SIRH et d'autres documents liés aux Ressources Humaines.
* Faire de la veille au niveau des changements de lois et de réglementations dans les normes du travail provinciales et fédérales.
* Collaborer sur divers projets RH porteurs.

  


**Ce qui nous inspire chez vous**


* Diplôme de premier cycle en Gestion des Ressources Humaines ou dans un domaine connexe.
* Minimum de 3 à 5 ans d'expérience en Ressources Humaines, de préférence dans une entreprise technologique mondiale.
* Solide connaissance des lois et réglementations en matière d'emploi aux niveaux fédéral et provincial au Canada et au Québec.
* Expérience en recrutement, intégration, relations avec les employés, administration de la paie et des avantages sociaux.
* Excellentes compétences en communication et en relations interpersonnelles, avec une compétence d'auto-démarrage et la capacité de construire des relations positives à tous les niveaux de l'organisation.
* Souci du détail avec de solides compétences en organisation et en gestion du temps.
* Capacité à traiter des informations sensibles avec discrétion et à maintenir la confidentialité.
* La maîtrise du français et de l'anglais est requise.
* Une certification en Ressources Humaines (par exemple, CRHA, CPHR) est un atout.

  



Nous sommes un employeur offrant l'égalité des chances, et tou.te.s les candidat.e.s qualifié.e.s seront pris en considération sans distinction de race, de couleur, de religion, de sexe, d'orientation sexuelle, d'origine, de condition physique, de statut de vétéran protégé, ou de toute autre caractéristique protégée par la loi.



Nous attendons votre candidature avec impatience ! Nous remercions tou.te.s les candidat.e.s, et seul.e.s ceux.celles sélectionné.e.s seront contacté.e.s.

title: HR Generalist - Team Lead
description:
**Position:** HR Generalist - Team Lead

**Location**: Virtual: Full-time

Are you a results driven HR Professional with a passion for making a difference and exceeding expectations within a fast-paced environment? Do you consider yourself to have a strong work ethic?

Do you have the initiative to take on challenges and create positive change? Are you known for your meticulous attention to detail? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Vergara Miller Law Firm is seeking a HR Generalist - Team Lead who embodies these three essential qualities and shares our passion for the advocacy for immigrant rights. Join our dynamic and fast-paced team, where you will thrive in a high-energy environment, and become part of an organization that is dedicated to changing people's lives.

About Us: At Vergara Miller Law Firm we believe in the transformative power of changing people’s lives. We are a passionate team dedicated to making a positive impact in the lives of individuals by helping our clients with their immigration status.

Below are the roles and responsibilities needed in order to comply with performance expectations, company vision and continuous improvement.

**The HR Generalist - Team Lead position requires you to take initiative, have a strong work ethic, and to have keen attention to detail. The HR Generalist position plays a crucial role in managing various human resources functions and processes to support the firm's legal professionals and staff. The HR generalists ensure that the firm's workforce is effectively managed, engaged, and compliant with relevant laws and regulations. The position requires leadership, cross-functional teamwork, and exemplary dedication towards the Vergara Miller Law Firm’s mission of “changing people’s lives''.**

**Skills**

* Leadership and Professionalism
* Prompt, reliable and highly organized.
* ATS (Applicant Tracking System) preferred
* Google Platform (G-Drive, G-Chat, G-docs, G-meet, G-sheet)
* Zoom
* IT (Information Technology) /Digital skills
* Drop Box
* Ability to maintain focus in a remote and in office work setting.
* Handles calls, messages, emails, meetings & speaking with people within/out of the company in the HR setting
* Handles multiple matters simultaneously.
* Communicates in detail of goals, tasks and challenges in order to support the company hiring and HR needs.

**Role**

* **Strong Work Ethic** - You show up every day going above and beyond with hard-work and effort, being punctual, upbeat and having a positive attitude until the job is done
* **Take Initiative** - Being proactive and actively seek out opportunities and take actions to make things happen
* **Attention to detail** - You are dedicated to having attention to detail with the ability to follow directions and operational, compliance and accuracy systems
* **Four Principles of a Culture of Performance**
* **Enrollment -** you actively choose every day when you wake up that you want to be a part of what we're doing here at Vergara Miller Law Firm
* **Agreements** - I will never tell you what to do. We will create agreements and then you will tell me;
* What are you going to do?
* When it's going to be done, i.e. date, time, and timezone?
* That you are going to make sure that it gets done
* **100 x 100** - Everybody cares. You are 100% responsible 100% of the time for everything in the organization. you will look out for the firm and raise conversations about other things that you see as being off
* **Unoffendability** - We prioritize performance over ego and feelings at no point should anybody in this organization ever again hesitate or think for a second about how somebody is going to take feedback that will be given to them. Feedback will never be given with an intent to hurt and it will never be taken as if somebody gave it even if they did give it to be hurt

**Task and Responsibilities**

Manage HR team - provide strategic leadership and guidance to the HR team while managing various human resources functions to support the needs of our legal professionals and staff.

Employee Communications: facilitate effective communication within the firm, disseminating important information and updates to employees. This could include announcements about firm-wide initiatives, policy changes, and other relevant matters.

Weekly updates to management on description of goals and focuses for the week

Backup to in-office Office Manager

Organizes and maintains the HR Folder on Google Drive:

Onboarding and offboarding responsibilities such as:

Organizes and attends recruiting, and other community and HR events in and out of regular work schedule

Checks for schedule and shift discrepancies for hourly and contract employees in Gusto

Performance Management: HR generalists assist in setting performance goals, conducting performance evaluations, and providing feedback to employees. They may collaborate with supervisors and partners to ensure that performance reviews are conducted regularly and fairly.

Training and Development: They coordinate training and professional development programs to enhance employees' skills and knowledge. This can involve organizing legal training sessions, workshops, and other learning opportunities tailored to the needs of legal professionals.

Benefits Administration: HR generalists manage employee benefits programs such as health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks. They ensure that employees understand their benefits, manage enrollments, and assist with resolving any issues related to benefits.

Coordinate w/ HR team confidential human resources claims, reports and documentation information for the company

**Application Process**

To fulfill our commitment to deliver the highest quality of service, we aim to identify individuals who share our passion through a comprehensive hiring process that begins with the submission of your resume and cover letter (*please include your favorite color so we know you're not a bot*), is supplemented by personality assessments and job-specific skills tests, and involves two to three rounds of interviews.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: AI Training for Human Resources
description:
### **Responsibilities:**


* You will train AI models by crafting and answering questions related to your field.
* You will evaluate and rank responses generated by AI systems.
* You will use your domain expertise to assess the factuality and relevance of text produced by AI models

### **Qualifications:**


* Completion of a Bachelor's degree or higher in Human Resources management, business, industrial-organizational psychology, or a related field
* PHR, SPHR, or other human resources professional certifications
* Excellent attention to detail and ability to maintain consistency in writing and spot errors or inconsistencies
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

### **Compensation:**


* **Hourly rate:** Up to USD$32.00 per hour, depending on your level of expertise.

***PLEASE NOTE***: *We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of job opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants' needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.*

title: Engagement Manager, Human Capital Management (HCM) (Remote)
description:
**About Bryant Park Consulting:**



Bryant Park Consulting (BPC) is a modern consulting firm focused on strategy, technology, and business transformation. We partner with leading technology firms like Oracle NetSuite, Boomi, Celigo, and more to bring leading capabilities to our clients across industries. BPC was founded in early 2021 and has grown quickly to become a leader in technology consulting.

**What you will do**



As an Engagement Manager within the Human Capital Management (HCM) practice with Bryant Park Consulting, you will be responsible for developing and managing a team of up to 10 direct reports to successfully deliver end-to-end Oracle Fusion Cloud HCM and NetSuite SuitePeople implementations for a portfolio of clients. This is a role that carries a utilization target and is hands-on in client engagements serving in project management, solution architect and sponsor capacities. The HCM Engagement Manager will collaborate with other Engagement Managers across internal teams to grow the portfolio of BPC service offerings. Be proactive and serve as the Client's advocate during engagements.


* Lead discovery and requirements gathering workshops
* Lead process mapping/reengineering and future state process design
* Advise client on HCM leading practices
* Perform fit/gap analysis on business requirements en route to system design and execution
* Translate complex business requirements and processes into technical designs
* Collaborate with technical counterparts to deliver custom solutions to meet client requirements
* Develop wireframe and schematic diagrams to support customer requirements gathering and overall business process discovery
* Manage scope and requirements with tight budget/allocation considerations
* Data migration strategy and definition Lead full-cycle HCM implementation projects, including all project phases: Plan, Design, Build, Verify, Deploy, Transition Support
* Lead project management activities such as status meetings, planning, work breakdown, and change control
* Support efforts to attract new clients into the firm and scope new projects
* Contribute to internal company initiatives including go-to-market efforts, knowledge management, and enablement
* Manage a total team size of up to 10 direct reports working across multiple simultaneous engagements


**Qualifications**


* Bachelor's degree in business, finance, information technology, or a related field (Master's degree preferred)
* 6+ years of hands-on implementation experience in Oracle HCM and recently has been leading a team, building a practice and/or company that delivers HCM implementation services
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
* Peoplesoft, Workday, UKG, Avanti, SAP SuccessFactors, ADP Workforce Now, Kronos Workforce Ready and/or other HCM software experience a plus
* NetSuite certifications (SuiteFoundation, Administrator, ERP Consultant) a plus


**Work From Home & Travel Requirements**


* Willingness to travel up to 30% to be on-site with clients as needed (note: this role is fully remote)

**Salary Range**: $180,000 to $220,000
  

In accordance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the approximate annual base compensation range is listed above. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package and benefits, will be determined by a number of factors including the applicant's experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity among our team.**Putting Our People First From Day One**



From the founding of Bryant Park Consulting, we committed to putting people first and offering variety, fulfillment, and balance. You will have the opportunity to work with the world's top companies and business leaders, keep up with the latest technology, and flex your skills across industries and disciplines. You will also be encouraged to engage with your community and nature. We attract and retain the best in the business - people from industry, consulting, agencies, startups, nonprofits, and the public sector - all drawn to building a career that's both exciting and sustainable.


* **Feed Your Curiosity -** Foster technical and industry expertise, and grow as a leader. Knowledge management and professional development are held in highest regard, we offer and sponsor flexible learning options on topics from Project Management to Web Development, and we pay for certifications with top programs.
* **Cultivate Well Being -** Thrive holistically with a robust and personalized set of benefits and company resources to support your emotional, mental, financial, physical, and social well-being. Celebrate with your team or explore interests with other team members, from book clubs to speaking events and annual retreats.
* **Choose Your Career -** There is no pressure to go 'up-or-out' and welcome you to build a career that gets you excited about coming to work every day - whether that's as an individual contributor or a team manager. Performance is evaluated fairly and regularly and as the organization grows we expect you and your career to grow with us.
* **Comprehensive Benefits -** We provide best-in-class benefits for employees including 401k with Company match up to 6%, United Health Plan, as well as Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Accidental Death and Dismemberment, and more. We also encourage and reimburse for costs of approved training, continuing education, skills development, and professional certification programs and exams to help further your career development.


-



Bryant Park Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Region HR Generalist - Remote w/ Travel (Florida)
description:
Our Regional Human Resource Generalists are subject matter experts that act as business partners to their regional teams. They lead the employee relations efforts for their regions while maximizing associate productivity through the optimization of talent. Our Human Resources Generalists plan and prioritize to provide optimal support to their portfolio of stores. They thrive on maintaining a work environment that is representative of our core principles and that allows our high performance teams to execute with excellence.  

  

**Responsibilities**  

  

*Profit Maximization** Mitigate risk and maximize productivity through collaboration with business partners
* Compile and analyze reports and data to identify trends and make recommendations
* Identify opportunities and collaborate with business partners to drive continuous improvement Operational Execution
* Support the effective rollout of Human Resources initiatives.
* Act as a subject matter expert in company policies, programs and operational processes and their impact on the business
* Lead employee relations efforts
* Conduct investigations and provide objective, quality guidance and resolution
* Ensure compliance with Federal, State and Local employment laws
* Address and resolve employee issues and/or concerns across all levels

*Talent Optimization** Support recruiting strategies in effort to attract top talent
* Support the development, retention and promotion of high performing teams.
* Support the performance management process
* Promote organizational initiatives and align team with vision and purpose

*Customer Experience** Build relationships with field and corporate partners
* Provide quality decision-making that adheres to our core principles
* Support regional engagement strategy
* Promote a culture of safe and secure stores
* Conducts targeted and purposeful store visits

**Success Drivers**  

  

*Drive for Results** Uses data to set priorities and translates goals into action plans
* Consistently pushes self and others for results; eliminates roadblocks
* Manages internal and external communications

*Building High Performance Teams** Supports the acquisition and retention of the right talent
* Trains, coaches and provides feedback
* Supports the Development of teams and positioning them for growth

*Customer Focus** Acts with customers in mind
* Understands and teaches how operational execution directly affects the customer experience
* Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers

*Managing Vision and Purpose** Makes the company vision sharable by everyone
* Can inspire and motivate entire units
* Is forward-looking and talks beyond today

*Interpersonal Savvy** Relates well to all kinds of people inside and outside of the organization
* Builds constructive and effective relationships
* Builds appropriate rapport

*Planning and Priority Setting** Quickly zeros in on the critical few and puts the trivial many aside
* Spends time and the time of others on what is important
* Sets objectives and goals and translates into concrete steps for action

**Requirements**


**Qualifications**  

  

*Experience** Minimum of five years’ experience in Human Resources and multi-unit leadership

*Education** Bachelors/Associates Degree preferred or High School graduate/Equivalent, HR certification preferred.

*Physical Requirements** Ability to communicate with customers and associates. Requires up to 40% travel over a large geographical area and standing and moving for an entire shift.

*Availability** Ability to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, overnight shifts and weekends as necessary to meet the needs of the business. Regular travel is required. Regular attendance is an essential function of the job.

*Additional Requirement** Ensures compliance with all policies, procedures and laws


The anticipated salary range for this position is $72,900 – $109,300 depending on location, knowledge, skills, education and experience. This position is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition, we offer comprehensive and competitive benefits to Associates (and their families) such as medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term, long-term disability and car allowance. Eligible Associates are able to enroll in our company’s 401k plan. Associates will accrue paid time off up to 200 hours per year (inclusive of PTO, floating holidays, and paid holidays). Paid sick time up to 80 hours per year unless otherwise required by law.
**About Harbor Freight Tools**


We’re a family-owned business with over 45 years as a national tool retailer, and with the energy, enthusiasm, and growth potential of a start-up. We are a $7 billion company with over 1,450 stores in 48 states, 27,000+ Associates, and one of the fastest-growing retailers in the country.

title: HR Business Partner (100% Remote)
description:
**Who We Are:**  

Since our founding in 2011, our mission has been to improve the lives of seniors and their caregivers. We are deeply passionate about communication and committed to becoming the foremost provider of services and solutions that enable seniors to lead more meaningful and independent lives. We also understand the power of connection and the profound impact it has on the lives of individuals who are hard-of-hearing. By utilizing enhanced automatic speech recognition, human captioning, and innovative product development, we deliver easy-to-use, cutting-edge technology to our primarily senior customer base. Our near real-time phone captioning technology allows individuals with hearing loss to see what callers are saying, enabling them to regain their connection to the world.
  
  

ClearCaptions is a Federal Communications Commission (FCC)-certified telephone captioning provider, adhering to the highest industry standards of privacy, security, and professionalism. We recognize the importance of maintaining the trust and confidence of our customers, and we continually strive to exceed their expectations.
  
  

For more information about our services please visit clearcaptions.com.
  
  

**Position Summary:**  

The Human Resource Business Partner (HRBP) is a strategic advisor to leaders, providing guidance and support on a variety of HR-related matters. The HRBP’s primary responsibility is to strengthen leadership capability and next level bench by placing a qualitative eye on key people strategies within their designated business area(s) or groups. In collaboration with leadership, the HRBP optimizes the workforce into sustainable results by attracting, training & developing, rewarding, and retaining critical leadership and employee capability, under an overall umbrella of active engagement. HRBP adds value by providing a unique and powerful perspective of HR principles and practices, to help the company fuel growth, build leadership capability, and drive a Great Place to Work® environment.
  
  

This is a Remote/Work from Home position reporting to Director, Employee Experience.
  
  

**What You Will Do:**  

* Partner with senior leadership and management to strengthen capability of talent by coaching, guiding, and challenging assessment of leaders and employees to identify strengths and opportunities.
* Facilitates Employee Relations processes and practices, provides expert consultant and guidance leadership, collaboration, coaching, and support on all types of employee relations matters including but not limited to employee engagement, promotions, transfers, performance issues, and separations.
* Provides information, interpretation, advice, training, and counsel to leadership, management, and employees regarding employee relations matters; Serves as facilitator when appropriate.
* Works promptly and strategically with key partners to resolve conflict, mitigate organizational risk, and maintain high levels of performance and retention.
* Investigates and resolves complex or critical employee relations issues, ensuring investigations of complaints or performance concerns are conducted and coordinated with other stakeholders in an objective, thorough and timely manner; documents all findings and recommendations.
* Tracks and manages employee relations case cycle - from initial discussions to formal/informal resolution.
* Maximize management’s use of company goal setting, performance evaluations, and performance management programs.
* Works closely with management and employees to improve working relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention.
* Establishes, collects, and reports appropriate metrics to drive improvements and ensure efficiency and effectiveness of employee relations and talent management responsibilities.
* Creates reports and analyzes data to be used by HR and the management team to measure key people metrics, to support business goals.
* Analyzes trends and metrics in partnership with the HR group to develop solutions, programs, and policies.
* Ensures that fair and equitable treatment of all employees is consistent with the company's core values and objectives, commitment to diversity and inclusion.
* Manages exit interview process in their business area; analyzes causes of turnover and suggests approaches to drive improvements in employee retention.
* Provides information, interpretation, advice, training, and counsel to managers and employees on developing and setting performance standards and conducting quality evaluations that drive performance and employees' career potential.
* Collaborates with respective HR centers of excellence on compensation, benefits, talent acquisition, and learning and development business needs.
* Understands business priorities and translates them into HR agendas to support rapid business growth.
* Drives HR standardizations, policies, and processes. Contributes to the continued improvement of scalable and simplified HR programs and processes within the company.
* Leads HR programs, projects, and initiatives within business area.
* Stays current with changing federal, state, and local legislation that impacts the HR function; Ensures compliance with internal policies, regulations, and legislation.
* Addresses unemployment claims and attends unemployment hearings when necessary.
* Other duties as assigned.


**The Kind of People We Look for:**  

* Versatile people who thrive on variety and challenge
* Excited about working in a fast-paced environment.
* Innate problem solvers who want to grow in a flexible, collaborative culture.
* Takes initiative, pushes boundaries, motivated to innovate.
* Talented individuals with a growth mindset who want to use their learning and relationship-building skills.
* Align with our company core values: Integrity, Accountability, Collaboration, Service and Quality.


**Qualifications:**  

* High-school diploma or GED; BS/BA degree or equivalent experience is preferred.
* Minimum 5-7 years of relevant experience in an HR Business Partner generalist role
* Prior experience working in a remote environment with an hourly non-exempt population required, contact or service centers required.
* Experience building and leading HR programs, projects, and teams.
* Proficiency working with various HRIS systems; Dayforce a plus.
* PHR or SPHR or SHRM-SCP certification a plus.
* Working and practical knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines including employee relations, performance management, compensation practices, organizational development, and federal and state employment law.
* Must have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment; adjust readily to multiple demands, shifting priorities and rapid change.
* Ability to coach, mentor and advise where appropriate to help employees grow and develop in alignment with business and personal goals.
* Must be willing to challenge point-of-views when necessary and offer alternative, constructive suggestions.
* Proven ability to understand strategic organizational issues and influence change.
* Utilizes strategic and critical thinking and analytical skills regularly to identify issues and trends, develop solutions and/or recommendations to address root cause and solve problems.
* Strong attention to detail and on-time completion of deliverables.
* Sound judgement in handling confidential or sensitive information. Maintain strict confidentiality, establish trust and credibility, act with complete integrity.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal and presentation skills.
* Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes.
* Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment.
* Willingness and ability to work flexible hours and travel (up to 10%); will include some overnight travel.
* Proficient in MS Office, modern communication tools for virtual teams (i.e., MS Teams, Slack)


**Physical Demands:**  

Employees may experience the following physical demands for extended periods of time:
  
* Sitting and standing (90%)
* Keyboarding (60%-80%)
* Viewing computer monitor, tablet and cell phone screen requiring close vision (90%)
* May lift or move boxes up to 10lbs.


**Work Environment:**  

100% remote. Work is performed in a home office/remote environment.
  
  

**Compensation:**  

$92,000 – $100,000 plus 5% bonus with consideration to experience and geographical location. Please see www.clearcaptions.com/careers for an overview of our generous benefits program.”
  
  

Intrigued to learn more?
  
  

When you apply for this role, your information will be personally reviewed by our talent acquisition team (not by a robot). You can expect to hear back from us if we think there could be a fit and what next steps look like.
  
  

ClearCaptions is an equal opportunity employer committed to inclusion and diversity. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.
  
  

**Disclaimer:**  

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees to do this job.

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
**HUMAN RESOURCES GENERALIST - REMOTE**

**American Health Connection** has an immediate opportunity for a **Human Resources Generalist (Remote)**. The Human Resources Generalist responsibilities include employee relations, new hire onboarding, performance management, benefits, policies/procedures, metric reporting, vendor relations, and payroll. Must be able to work in a collaborative team environment with the ability to multi-task, a high degree of integrity, an ability to maintain strict confidentiality and exercise sound judgement. Strong communication, time management, analytical skills, attention to detail and problem-solving skills to compile and analyze data is crucial for success.

American Health Connection (https://americanhealthconnection.com), is a national virtual healthcare call center. In 2009, American Health Connection was established to provide medical patients with full-service, virtual central scheduling and support services. Our healthcare professionals provide these services remotely from home nationwide. We offer medical, dental, 401(k) with company match, life insurance, and team oriented work environment. Hourly Range: $20.00-25.00 per hour DOE

**Principal Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Perform administrative tasks and services to support effective and efficient operations of the Human Resources department.
* This role will be expected to provide guidance and ensure consistent implementation of HR programs, policies, procedures and guidelines.
* Support the day-to-day employment life cycle from hire to termination, including but not limited to new hire orientation, compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance management; employee handbook; and responding to general HR queries from employees, managers and company leadership.
* Maintains compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; reviews policies and practices to maintain compliance.
* Current knowledge of best practices related to employee leave administration (to include FMLA, ADA, Maternity, Paternity and Military), compliance reviews and updates.
* Collaborates with Leadership on completion of specific projects as directed.
* Partner with department leadership regarding payroll functions.
* Compile reports, auditing and reconciling reports, providing recommendations for process improvements, and implementing quick resolutions.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Job Requirements:**

* 2-3 years of human resources generalist experience required, healthcare or call center industry preferred.
* Experience in the following HR functional areas preferred: Leave Management, Employee Relations and Compliance.
* Associate degree in a related field or equivalent combination of education and/or experience. BA / BS in Human Resources or related field preferred
* Strong oral and written communication skills to effectively relay and obtain information, explain policies and procedures, and establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with diverse workforce.
* Ability to work independently or with a team and complete projects within specified deadlines.
* Skilled in handling sensitive information and / or situations and maintaining strict confidentiality.

**COMPUTER REQUIREMENTS - In order to work remote and adhere to HIPPA compliance, you must agree to meet these requirements after signing our offer letter and before start date:**  
**\\*\\*Computer Requirements:** \\*\\*Must be on a static location or address; devices such as laptops and chrome books are not acceptable due to security concerns\\*\\*  
**Computer Type**: Mini, Full Tower, All-in-One

title: Client Onboarding Specialist
description:
**Company:** Jitasa

**Job Title:** Onboarding Specialist

**Location:** Boise, ID

**Employment Status:** Full Time

**Onboarding Specialist**

**About Us**

Jitasa is the first and largest international accounting and bookkeeping services provider dedicated solely to the nonprofit sector. Our name, Jitasa (ji-tah-suh), means “The Spirit of Serving Others.” It’s who we are and why we love playing a small role in the great work of our clients. We're accountants with two passions, numbers and helping the non-profit community.

**Why Join Our Team?**

We know that you have many employment opportunities, however few can match the unique and rewarding career that Jitasa offers. Join our team and we are committed to providing you the following:

**Clear Career Development & Opportunity** – We love to promote from within.

**Culture, Comradery, & Community** – We believe that work can and should be fun. We also share the same passion to help nonprofits do what they do best and that is what unites us.

**Mission-Driven Values, Meaningful Work** – We truly believe in our core values – Conscientious, Gracious, and Discipline – and they are what guide us as a company.

**Work/Life Harmony** – We are proud to offer flexible work schedules when needed.

**Global Team Experience** – We work closely with our international team members who all share our same passion for helping nonprofits.

**Job Description**

We're now hiring an Onboarding Specialist to help support our growing team. The primary role of this position is to lead and direct the onboarding of new clients into the Jitasa delivery system. The responsibilities of this role include:

Effectively communicate onboarding expectations and timelines with clients and co-workers

Implement best practice policies, procedures, and processes to be executed by the delivery teams

Configure internal and external systems as necessary

Support and train new clients on the adoption of Jitasa systems and processes

Analyze and architect the accounting structure of new clients to conform to the unified chart of accounts

Ensure all new clients are seamlessly transitioned to the delivery teams

Above all, provide a superior client experience to new organizations that join Jitasa!

If you're hard-working, have a proven ability to work independently, and passionate about serving non-profits, Jitasa is a perfect match that offers a career with both purpose and opportunity.

**Skills / Qualifications**

1. **Education:** A Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance is required.

2. **Work Experience:** Typically 2-3 years of relevant, hands-on accounting experience.

Candidates should have experience:

Managing multiple projects with competing priorities and deadlines

Setting clear expectations and timelines

Navigating and understanding ambiguous situations

Adapting to multiple scenarios

Independently solving complex situations

Directing and delegating tasks to others

**3. Skills:**

Candidates must possess a high level of general accounting knowledge and bookkeeping skills

Candidates must possess a high level of knowledge of NFP accounting principles

Candidates must possess excellent client communication skills and the ability to maintain a positive client relationship

Candidates must possess excellent communication skills internally with team members and demonstrate the ability to explain

complex things simply

Candidates must have a high proficiency in client management as well as project management. They must demonstrate the ability to manage multiple clients and projects to successful completion on time

Candidates must demonstrate good leadership skills and the ability to achieve results

Candidates must possess proficient conflict resolution skills

Candidates should be willing to collaborate and work effectively with others, both internally and externally in order to achieve goals.

Candidates should show initiative and follow through; and demonstrate that they’re highly motivated, a self-learner, and able to work independently

**4. Technical Competencies:**

Highly Skilled in Microsoft Excel

Highly Skilled in Mavenlink

Highly Skilled at email management via Microsoft Outlook

* Highly Skilled at learning and supporting new technologies and systems
* Highly Skilled at time management and coordinating schedules

**Compensation and Benefits**

**1. Compensation**

$65,000 - $75,000 base salary DOE

Quarterly bonus of up to $12,000 based on team and company performance

**2. Benefits & Perks**

Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance

Paid Sabbatical after 5 years of service

Generous Paid Time Off policy based on years of tenure

40 hours of Paid VTO (Volunteer Time Off) per year

401k plan with employer contribution match

Casual dress code and a fun and relaxed office culture

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Accounting: 1 year (Required)
* Client Onboarding: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Sr. Sales Operations Business Partner
description:
Zoom is looking for a Sr. Sales Operations Business Partner (*SSBP*) to lead our strategy and operations efforts for our Global Small Business Segment. The SSBP will run the business in tandem with our Global Small Business Sales Leader and its day to day operations. This includes headcount planning, territory design, quota setting and forecasting support. This person plays a key role in defining strategy around account segmentation, go-to-market coverage, and sales organization structure. This role is expected to partner with executives across the whole company, including Insights + Analytics, Finance, Legal, Enablement, Channel, & Marketing as they evaluate business problems, design and then implement actionable recommendations that support the sales teams ability to achieve their goals. Success in this role is helping us both grow the top line revenue of the business and increasing its profitability. This person will have a heavy influence in how we deploy our assets to maximize our return on investment.


The SSBP must be a proactive, analytical thinker that has the ability to work in a structured manner to drive growth and operational excellence across the whole sales organization. They need to excel at balancing strategic thinking with pragmatic independent execution and enjoy solving complex problems.


This role reports to the Head of Global Business Partners within the Global Sales Operations and Enablement function


Responsibilities:

* Structure and evaluate business problems, design and implement actionable recommendations, and track success metrics
* Partner extensively with the Go to Market Insights team to understand the quantified view of the market opportunity. This understanding will help you to make recommendations on optimizing sales resource planning and quota planning accordingly
* Define, manage, and provide insights on key performance indicators (KPIs) that drive consistency in pipeline hygiene and sales methodology execution
* Become a subject matter expert on Sales Policies which include Sales Segmentation definitions, Sales Commission Terms and Conditions and the Global Rules of Engagement. This may include weighing in to help resolve any disputes over policy that may arise
* Understand the impact of Privacy and Security issues as the impact Zoom across the business
* Quickly synthesize information, structure a concise, clear presentation of findings to an executive audience and prioritize issues as appropriate (to be shared in Executive Presentations, QBRs, etc.)
* Lead cross functional initiatives to transform and streamline processes to drive improved sales productivity and velocity
* Working in partnership with Sale Enablement and GTM Insights. Deliver a unified and connected planning and best practice environment around quota management, territory management, pipeline management, forecasting, quarterly business reviews and GTM Planning, in collaboration Financial Planning & Analysis, Data Management, Enterprise Systems teams, Marketing, Marketing Operations, Human Resources and Sales Support, all of which support a world class sales organization
* Drive operational efficiencies by partnering with Global Operations extended team to automate and improve processes, tools, and dashboards that scale as the business expands globally


Requirements:

* 10+ years of work experience in Global Sales Strategy, Sales Operations, or Business Operations
* 5 years experience with SaaS, B2B, multi-product and technical sales business models, with a preference to high growth companies.
* Must be highly proficient in Salesforce.com, Google docs, Excel, and technically savvy for other key sales applications; will consider another CRM proficiency
* Direct or indirect management experience with global sales leaders in worldwide regions
* Comfort with C-level presentations, meetings, strategy discussions, yet possesses the ability to connect with field sales reps
* Outcomes-oriented approach to sales and sales operations with corresponding experience managing key metrics for success
* Strong business acumen, strong reporting and analytics, troubleshooting, problem-solving, and project management skills

  

Educational Requirements

* BS Degree in business, economics, communications or other disciplines is preferred but not required
* MBA degree preferred but not required, will also consider an MA with a specific discipline
* Certificates in global strategy or business analytics from credentialed universities also preferred

**Salary Range or On Target Earnings:**


Minimum:


$105,600.00
Maximum:


$195,400.00
At Zoom, we offer a window of at least 5 days for you to apply because we believe in giving you every opportunity. Below is the potential closing date, just in case you want to mark it on your calendar. We look forward to receiving your application!


Anticipated Position Close Date:


03/29/24
In addition to the base salary and/or OTE listed Zoom has a Total Direct Compensation philosophy that takes into consideration; base salary, bonus and equity value.

  

Note: Starting pay will be based on a number of factors and commensurate with qualifications & experience.


We also have a location based compensation structure; there may be a different range for candidates in this and other locations.

**Ways of Working**  

Our structured hybrid approach is centered around our offices and remote work environments. The work style of each role, Hybrid, Remote, or In-Person is indicated in the job description/posting.

**Benefits**  

As part of our award-winning workplace culture and commitment to delivering happiness, our benefits program offers a variety of perks, benefits, and options to help employees maintain their physical, mental, emotional, and financial health; support work-life balance; and contribute to their community in meaningful ways. Click Learn for more information.

**About Us**  

Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best collaboration platform for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinars.  

We’re problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.

 **Our Commitment**

We believe that the unique contributions of all Zoomies is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. Zoom is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives including qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records and any qualified applicants requiring reasonable accommodations in accordance with the law. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a medical condition, or if you need assistance accessing our website or completing the application process, please let us know by emailing us at careers@zoom.us.
