title: SVP Total Rewards
description:
**Overview**  

CommonSpirit Health is a nonprofit, Catholic health system dedicated to advancing health for all people. It was created in February 2019 by Catholic Health Initiatives and Dignity Health. With its national office in Chicago and a team of over 175,000 employees and 25,000 physicians and advanced practice clinicians, CommonSpirit operates more than 2,000 care sites from clinics and hospitals to home-based care and virtual care services.  

Our world needs compassion like never before. Our communities need caring and our families need protection. With our combined resources CommonSpirit is committed to building healthy communities, advocating for those who are poor and vulnerable, and innovating how and where healing can happen - both inside our hospitals and out in the community.  

This is an exciting time to join our CommonSpirit Health’s People Leadership Team. With new executive leadership and celebrating five years, CSH is more than ever poised to become One CommonSpirit while advancing our mission. More specifically, we are focused on elevating our people. Dr. Lilicia Bailey, Senior Executive Vice President, Chief People Officer (SEVP/CPO), joined our Executive Leadership Team in August, 2023. She is committed to taking care of our people, deepening our employee experience, and delivering value that enhances organizational and people development. In a few short months, Dr. Bailey identified our people team’s strategy relying on our strong values alignment and recognizing this is a multi-year journey where we move from foundational HR capabilities to innovative people practices and talent strategies.  

To that end, the SVP, Total Rewards will play an instrumental role in ensuring that CSH delivers on our employee promise. More specifically, the leader will develop and implement a comprehensive total rewards strategy that is aligned with the company's business objectives, culture, and competitive market dynamics. This includes driving the overall strategies and processes for total rewards to include contemporary holistic compensation and incentive design and delivery, oversee integrated benefits and wellness recognition offerings that align these with the overarching company strategic and growth objectives. This role will partner closely with Dr. Bailey, executive leadership team, and our Human Resources and Compensation Committee of the Board of Trustees, to reimagine the holistic Total Rewards strategy given the rapid transformation of the competitive marketplace for talent. This role will also work to grow and develop a team of global total reward experts while creating and fostering a culture of collaboration, engagement, and innovation.  

This is a remote opportunity and the role leads a total team of 67 total rewards members. **Responsibilities** **Key Initiatives:**  

The talent challenge continues across the nation and the healthcare industry is not exempt. With that business challenge as a backdrop, the SVP, Total Rewards will:* Design a world-class compensation program including executive compensation.
* Transform our benefits program and achieve full-suite benefits harmonization (i.e medical, dental, vision, retirement, time off, and disability, etc.).
* Identify and recommend transformation alignment of all total rewards (compensation, benefits, recognition, wellness) to attract and retain talent and contribute to actualizing the strategy.
* Engage and educate key stakeholders in a comprehensive pay for performance strategy which includes the Board HR & Compensation Committee.
* Develop and provide senior leadership on innovative total rewards, incorporating technology enablers.
* Provide leadership and oversight for change management related to new total rewards offerings.

**Essential Functions:*** **Total Rewards Strategies:** Develop and execute a total reward strategy that aligns with the company’s overall business goals, values, and competitive positioning in the market.
* **Governance Support:** Play a key role in the creation of Human Resources and Compensation Committee (HRCC) meetings, collaborating with the SEVP/CPO, CEO, consultant, and Committee Chair.
* **Benefits and Well-being:** Ensure integration of employee benefits programs, including health, wellness, retirement, and other well-being initiatives are embedded in the People Strategic Plan; liaison with the sub-committee to the HRCC.
* **Executive Compensation:** Manage executive compensation programs and support the SEVP/CPO with HRCC on executive pay matters.
* **Compensation Management:** Oversee the design, implementation, and administration of compensation programs, including base salary, incentives, bonuses, and equity plans, to ensure they are competitive, equitable, and compliant with legal and regulatory requirements.
* **Compliance and Governance:** Ensure that all total rewards programs adhere to relevant legal and regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions.
* **Employee Communication:** Develop effective communication strategies to educate and engage employees about the total reward programs, highlighting the value of the offerings.
* **Vendor Management:** Oversee relationships with external partners, consultants, and vendors to optimize the delivery of total reward services.
* **Team Leadership:** Build and lead a high-performing Total Reward team, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, development, and continuous improvement.

  

**Qualifications** **Required Education and Experience*** Minimum of ten (10) years of executive/senior total rewards leadership experience in large-scale, multi-billion-dollar companies, preferably in a complex diverse business or health care organization. Experience working with top compensation consulting firms is a plus.
* Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree (or an equivalent combination of education and/or additional job-related experience) is highly preferred.
* Demonstrated experience in developing, leading and cogently presenting content to C-Suite level and Board/Compensation Committee.
* Ability to develop and adjust rewards strategy to address movements in the market and business needs.
* Thorough knowledge and passion for building new, competitive and highly engaging compensation and benefits programs, (including extensive knowledge of compensation plan design merit and incentive), benefit plan design and executive compensation process and programs, wellness/wellbeing and health, and employee recognition. Bring expertise across compensation focus areas, including market analytics, job architecture, career mapping, and program design based on a sound set of leveling criteria.
* Proven ability to work collaboratively across a large complex organization to increase effectiveness, efficiencies, and outcomes. Experience building and maintaining strong cross-functional partnerships. Able to partner closely with business leaders in legal, finance, IT, and communications. Track record of being able to influence stakeholders with competing priorities, and differing opinions, toward a common goal while understanding what is right for the business. Provide ongoing direction and guidance on the general application of policy or on the design, development and management of new initiatives or programs.
* Strong analytical, verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with internal and external constituencies at all levels, including senior leadership and governance committees. Highly analytical and proactive, capable of building a culture of continuous analytics designed to monitor competitiveness in industry competition and react quickly and flexibly as the market shifts. Pay Equity analysis experience is critical.
* Strong decision-making skills and judgment with the ability to handle multiple complex and multidimensional issues at one time.
* Ability to think and process information as a strategic thought partner, while translating strategic vision into action.


#LI-CSH
#LI-REMOTE **Pay Range**  

$177.92 - $249.09 /hour

title: HR and People Operations Specialist
description:
**WHO WE ARE**  

Come grow with us! If you are a passionate change agent who thrives in a collaborative, entrepreneurial and inclusive, culture committed to operational excellence, we would like to meet you.  

  

At Resonance, immediate hands-on experience alongside our clients as we work to build sustainable, positive impact. Our teams are autonomous and self-sufficient. You get to weigh in with founders and leaders on how to drive change and grow the movement while growing the company.  

  

Resonance is an award-winning, Certified B Corporation consultancy that delivers market-based solutions to address the world's toughest challenges. We enable a variety of donor, commercial, and investor clients around the world to catalyze lasting impact. Resonance seeks to catalyze large-scale social, environmental, and economic change by fostering new and dynamic forms of collaboration. We do this by fostering public-private partnerships, facilitating sustainable investment, and providing deep analytical insights in frontier markets.
**POSITION MANDATE**
As a highly visible member of the Human Resources & Talent team, you will partner with HR & Talent team colleagues to help build and execute the company’s people operations and operational excellence agenda and optimize people operations and processes across the full talent spectrum. You will be a strong operational partner to cross-functional stakeholders to enable their business capability and capacity. You can expect all the challenges and benefits of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment – high ambiguity, wide-open space for agile strategy and execution, and optimal opportunity to impact the company's success directly.
This is a full-time position, and hours of work and days are Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET.

**OUTCOMES / ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**
* Support the coordination, analyses, discussions and resolutions for various human resource and people operations conditions, strategies, plans, and procedures for all staff, including the full lifecycle of the employee experience (onboarding, hiring, development, promotion, and offboarding).
* Under the guidance of the HR & People Operations Manager, administer benefits plans, including claims resolution, change reporting, and communicating benefits information to employees; manage the variety of Leave policies and requests (FFCRA, STD & LTD, Parental Leave, FMLA, state specific PFL). Responsible for the integrity of employee data.
* Administers the HRIS human resource information system (Paycor), records and compiles and distributes reports from the database.
* Restructure and optimize SharePoint's HR and TA sections to ensure all documents and materials are appropriately housed, maintained, and accessed, including labor law posters, and updating links.
* Assist payroll processing, new state registration and tax application processes. Manages employee change processes.
* Collaborate and coordinate with the appropriate stakeholders to support operational excellence across the enterprise by:
	+ Partnering with HR and other stakeholders to investigate, strategize and establish people operations policies and programs to support them
	+ Coordinating, communicating, and delivering people-focused SOPs and policies to the other departments, particularly ECCO
* Execute tasks relating to the employee life cycle including offer and change communications, orientation and exit interviews, ensuring they are duly stored and accessible and maintaining their integrity and privacy according to employee data laws and regulations.
* Support the Talent Acquisition by activities and tasks such as candidate and interviewer scheduling, stakeholder follow-up and communications, etc.
* Maintain employee files and ensure changes to benefits and other important programs and initiatives are communicated in a concise and timely manner. Helps implement policies aligning with core principles while recommending changes to current plans and policies to stay abreast with trends and best practices.
* Maintain the organizational chart in SharePoint and contribute to policy updates.
* Remains knowledgeable about and communicates human resources trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and employment law at a regular cadence and applies this knowledge to communicate policy, practice, and resource changes.
* Other duties as needed.

**REQUIRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE**
* 3+ years of experience in progressively responsible human resource and/or talent management roles, preferably within a management consulting/professional services context.
* 3+ years supporting people and talent operations, leveraging project management approaches practices, and methodologies.
* 2+ years of hands-on experience resulting in proficiency with technology tools (e.g., HRIS, ATS, LMS, Microsoft Office, including Excel) and willingness to adapt to new technology.
* 3+ years of benefits administration experience
* Demonstrated knowledge of labor legislation, human resource laws, and best practices


  

**PREFERRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE**
* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources of Business Administration
* SHRM-CP or PHR certification
* 1+ years of experience managing the payroll process.


  

**TRAVEL EXPECTATIONS**  

Limited travel is expected in this role.
**WORK ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL DEMANDS**  

This position operates in a professional office environment, and routinely requires the use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers, photocopiers, and filing cabinets.  

  

The physical requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
As a part of the responsibilities for this job, the employee is required to communicate, detect, converse with, discern, convey, express oneself, and exchange information orally and in writing with others. The employee must be able to remain in a stationary position, sitting at a desk for prolonged periods, move or traverse inside the office and facilities; operate, activate, use, prepare, inspect, place, detect, or position computers and other office equipment, such as a calculator, copy machine, furniture, and computer printer. The employee must be able to make substantial repetitive motions of the wrists, hands and fingers. The employee must be able to lift and move up to 15lbs at times.
**WORK AUTHORIZATION / SECURITY CLEARANCE**
US work authorization required.
**AAP/EEO STATEMENT**
The Equal Employment Opportunity Policy of Resonance is to provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all associates and job applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity or expression, and sexual orientation) parental status, genetic information (including family medical history) political affiliation, military service, age, veteran status, disability, or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. These protections extend to all management practices and decisions, including recruitment and hiring, appraisal systems, promotions, training, and career development programs. Consistent with these obligations, Resonance also provides reasonable accommodations to employees and applicants with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs, observances, and practices.
Resonance believes that employees should be provided with a working environment which enables each associate to be productive and to work to the best of his or her ability. We do not condone or tolerate an atmosphere of intimidation or harassment based on any of the above-mentioned characteristics.
We expect and require the cooperation of all employees in maintaining a discrimination and harassment-free atmosphere.
**Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No phone calls or emails please.**

title: Analyste des opÃ©rations RH / HR Operations Analyst
description:
**Job Description**

**L'analyste des opérations ressources humaines** de notre entreprise soutient les clients canadiens et répond aux questions soumises par téléphone ou par courriel en mettant l’accent sur le service à la clientèle et la satisfaction de la clientèle. Ses clients comprennent les employés, les gestionnaires, les personnes retraitées, les conjoints survivants, les généralistes des ressources humaines et d’autres intervenants en ressources humaines.


Ceux-ci peuvent générer des questions relatives aux transactions ressources humaines, aux affectations internationales, aux avantages sociaux, aux politiques, aux procédures, aux absences autorisées, aux problèmes de nouveaux employés, au rendement et aux outils de planification pour la gestion de la rémunération. L’analyste travaille dans de nombreux domaines comme la mobilité mondiale, les politiques et les avantages sociaux des ressources humaines, les outils des ressources humaines, la rémunération, la paie et l’administration des congés.


Il assumera principalement, entre autres, les fonctions suivantes :  



* Agir à titre d’expert en la matière dans le secteur fonctionnel en supervisant le processus d’administration de bout en bout et l’expérience client.
* Mettre à jour les dossiers relatifs à Workday et à la paie pour les employés en affectation internationale.
* Assurer un suivi avec les gestionnaires pour s’assurer que les approbations sont faites en temps opportun dans le système Workday.
* Répondre aux questions complexes soumises par courriel ou par téléphone auxquelles l’analyste du centre d’appels ne peut répondre lors du contact initial.
* Utiliser pleinement le système de gestion de cas et des connaissances des RH pour trouver des solutions ainsi qu’enregistrer et suivre les cas.
* Contribuer à la base de connaissances des RH pour améliorer la résolution des problèmes des clients.
* Rechercher et analyser les données et renseignements, parcourir plusieurs systèmes, ressources et outils pour enquêter sur les cas, et fournir des réponses exactes.
* Collaborer efficacement avec d’autres équipes des RH, dont le service juridique et les centres d’excellence, pour résoudre des problèmes complexes.
* Appliquer les connaissances appropriées et son jugement quand il doit donner des réponses non préparées.
* Recevoir diverses formations spécialisées pour pouvoir soutenir d’autres membres d’équipe.
* Participer aux tests de nouvelles applications et de nouveaux outils améliorés pour les RH.
* Collaborer de façon proactive avec les analystes du centre d’appels en leur offrant conseils et encadrement. Signaler les besoins de formation ou d’information supplémentaire afin d’éviter les recours hiérarchiques.
* Recommander des changements ou des améliorations en ce qui a trait aux logiciels du centre d’appels et du contenu du portail des RH afin de perfectionner le soutien aux employés et le libre-service pour les gestionnaires.
* Suivre les procédures et pratiques normalisées, les accords sur les niveaux de service, les modes opératoires normalisés et atteindre ou dépasser les objectifs opérationnels.
* Participer à des projets spéciaux ou faire partie d’équipes spéciales au besoin.

**Formation :**

* Baccalauréat ou diplôme supérieur

**Expérience et compétences requises :**

* Bilingue (français et anglais) : capacité à communiquer à l’oral et à l’écrit dans les deux langues.
* Au moins deux ans d’expérience pertinente, dans le domaine des ressources humaines, des centres d’appels du service à la clientèle, par exemple.
* Connaissances spécialisées approfondies dans un ou plusieurs domaines de spécialité : avantages sociaux, administration des congés ou service de la paie, par exemple. Systèmes Workday, Taleo, Success Factors, Case Management, Midas, SharePoint et autres applications exclusives.
* Expérience de Workday
* Expérience de l’utilisation d’un système de gestion de cas (p. ex. ServiceNow, Remedy, Salesforce, etc.)
* Expérience souhaitée de l’utilisation d’un système de gestion de documents
* Excellent jugement et professionnalisme.
* Aptitudes exceptionnelles en communication, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit.

**Expérience et compétences souhaitées :**

* Haut niveau d’intégrité et d’éthique personnelle dans la mise en place de politiques et procédures d’entreprise.
* Travaille efficacement en équipe en mettant l’accent sur la collaboration.
* Capacité à travailler dans un environnement rapide et dynamique où les changements sont continus en matière de technologie et de processus.
* Capacité à se montrer souple et à adopter de nouvelles méthodes de travail.
* Capacité à travailler de façon autonome et à se coordonner avec des groupes partenaires clés
* Nos fonctions de soutien fournissent des services et émettent des recommandations sur les façons d’améliorer notre lieu de travail et la culture de notre organisation. Nos fonctions de soutien comprennent les ressources humaines, les finances, la technologie de l’information, le service juridique, l’approvisionnement, l’administration, les installations et la sécurité.


Conformément à la Stratégie de milieu de travail hybride de notre entreprise, ce poste sera exécuté au moyen d’une combinaison de travail à distance et de travail en personne (siège social de Kirkland) en fonction de la nature du travail à effectuer.


Nous sommes fiers d'être une entreprise qui embrasse la valeur de rassembler des personnes diversifiées, talentueuses et engagées. La façon la plus rapide d’innover est de rassembler des gens de diverses opinions dans un environnement inclusif. Nous encourageons nos collègues à remettre en question avec respect les problèmes de réflexion et d’approche de l’un et de l’autre. Nous sommes un employeur souscrivant au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et nous sommes déterminés à favoriser un milieu de travail inclusif et diversifié.

**Employees working in roles that the Company determines require routine collaboration with external stakeholders, such as customer-facing commercial, or research-based roles, will be expected to comply not only with Company policy but also with policies established by such external stakeholders (for example, a requirement to be vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to access a facility or meet with stakeholders). Please understand that, as permitted by applicable law, if you have not been vaccinated against COVID-19 and an essential function of your job is to call on external stakeholders who require vaccination to enter their premises or engage in face-to-face meetings, then your employment may pose an undue burden to business operations, in which case you may not be offered employment, or your employment could be terminated. Please also note that, where permitted by applicable law, the Company reserves the right to require COVID-19 vaccinations for positions, such as in Global Employee Health, where the Company determines in its discretion that the nature of the role presents an increased risk of disease transmission.**


Current Employees apply HERE


Current Contingent Workers apply HERE

**Secondary Language(s) Job Description**


The **Human Resources Operations Analyst** will provide support to the Americas employees and resolve escalated inquiries by telephone or email with a strong focus on customer care and satisfaction.


Customers may include employees, managers, retirees/surviving spouses, human resources generalists, and other human resources stakeholders. They may generate escalated inquiries related to human resources transactions, international assignments, benefits, policies, procedures, leaves of absence, new hire issues, performance and compensation management planning tools.


The analyst will work across a broad range of areas such as Global Mobility, Human Resource Policy and Benefits, Human Resource Tools, Compensation, Payroll, and Leave Administration. More specifically, primary activities include, but are not limited to:

* Act as a functional area subject matter expert to oversee the end-to-end administration process and customer experience.
* Updating Workday and Payroll related records.
* Following up with managers to ensure approvals are made timely in the Workday system.
* Respond to complex escalated inquiries via email or phone, which a Call Center Analyst cannot resolve on the initial contact.
* Fully utilize HR case management and knowledge management system to obtain resolutions and document/track cases.
* Contribute to HR knowledge bases to improve client resolution.
* Research and analyze data and information, navigate multiple systems, resources and tools to investigate and provide accurate answers.
* Partner effectively with other HR teams including Legal and Centers of Excellence to resolve complex issues.
* Apply appropriate knowledge and judgment when non-scripted answers are required.
* Cross train in more than one specialty function to ensure back-up support for other team members.
* Participate in testing of new and enhanced HR applications and Tools.
* Partner proactively with Call Center Analysts to provide guidance and coaching. Identify when additional training or knowledge is needed to prevent escalations.
* Recommend changes or updates to call center solutions and content to enable better employee and manager self-service support.
* Follow standard procedures and practices, Service Level Agreements, Standard Operating Procedures, and meet or exceed operational goals.
* Participate on special assignments or teams as assigned.
* Strong analytical focus required for reporting and identifying data discrepancies.

**Education:**

* Bachelor's Degree

**Required Experience and Skills:**

* Bilingual in French and English - ability to speak and write fluently in both languages.
* At least two years of related work experience, e.g. Human Resources, call center, or customer care.
* High degree of integrity and personal ethics in implementing corporate policies and procedures.
* Effective team player with collaborative focus.
* Workday experience required.
* Experience using a case management system (i.e. ServiceNow, Remedy, Salesforce, etc.)
* Experience using a document management system preferred.
* Excellent applied judgment and professionalism.
* Exceptional oral and verbal communication skills.
* Strong data analytic skills.
* Experience with SOX audits.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with ongoing technology and process changes.
* Ability to demonstrate flexibility and adjusting to new ways of working.
* Ability to work independently and coordinate with key partner groups.
* Advanced specialized knowledge in one or more areas of concentration e.g. Benefits, Leave Administration, or Payroll.


In line with our Company’s Hybrid Workplace Strategy, this position will be performed through a combination of remote work and in-person (Kirkland Head Office) based on the nature of work to be done.

title: Banner HR Consultant
description:
At Ferrilli, we are committed to driving positive change in higher education through the revolutionary power of technology. Our mission is to foster student success by maximizing the potential of technology on campuses. With a comprehensive and holistic approach, we provide unwavering support in IT services and IT consulting, optimizing existing technology infrastructure, and implementing cutting-edge solutions to help our clients achieve their goals.


**POSITION SUMMARY:**


As a **Banner HR Consultant** at Ferrilli, you will collaborate with colleges and universities to address their Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) needs, with a particular focus on Ellucian Banner HR. Your role is vital in ensuring that projects stay within scope and budget, in alignment with our clients' requirements. You will be part of the Professional Services team, reporting to a director, and ultimately, to the VP of Professional Services.


**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**


* Support application design and configuration of client systems through customization and coding of screen layouts, user interfaces, printed outputs, and interfaces with other systems to enable client strategies.
* Write and maintain technical specifications/documentation to describe program development, logic, coding, testing, changes, and corrections.
* Provide technical assistance by responding to inquiries from others regarding errors, problems, or questions regarding ERP and integrated systems.
* Attend both internal and external meetings and trainings.
* Analyze, define, and document requirements for data, workflow, safety processes and standards, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks and controls, and outputs.
* Train end users or technical support staff to use programs.
* Build and apply technical, safety, industry, and functional standards to support efforts in enabling value creation for clients.
* Support the analysis and design of business processes.
* Maintain technical/professional currency and share knowledge with others.


**QUALIFICATIONS**


* A Bachelor’s degree in a related field is required.
* A minimum of 3 years of IT consulting experience and/ or hands on technical or functional experience in Ellucian Banner HR.
* Experience in implementing ERP solutions in the higher education industry will be advantageous.
* Proficient in managing and calculating scholarship-related data within the salary worksheets, ensuring accurate and compliant disbursement.
* Experienced in using salary planning tools and software to create, modify, and review salary worksheets for various staff members.
* Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and clients.
* Willingness to travel when required for client or internal business.

title: Employee Relations Specialist
description:
Based on our continued growth, we currently have an exciting opportunity for an **Employee Relations Specialist (Bilingual)** for Empowerists. We are looking for an Employee Relations Specialist to join our People & Culture team, who will report to the Director of People and Culture. While this position is 100% remote, we are looking to expand our team in Canada. Choose an item.


As a member of Empowerists the HR Generalist is a key player in handling the day-to-day HR queries such as onboarding, offboarding, payroll, benefits, global mobility, etc. The goal is to ensure the People & Culture’s operations are running smoothly and effectively to deliver maximum value to the organization.

**Primary responsibilities:**

* Conduct employee onboarding
* Provide support to employees in various HR-related topics such as leaves and compensation
* Resolve any HR-related issue that may arise
* Promote HR programs to create an efficient and conflict-free workplace
* Assist in the development and implementation of Human Resource policies
* Undertake tasks around performance management
* Gather and analyse data with useful HR metrics such as employee turnover rates
* Maintain employee files and records.
* Enhance job satisfaction by resolving issues promptly, applying new perks and benefits, and organizing team building activities.
* Ensure compliance with labour regulations.
* Maintain payroll processes, prepare employees’ compensation data.
* Administrate payroll-related policies and procedures.
* Assist in talent acquisition and recruitment processes.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor of Arts or Science in Human Resources, Business administration or any other relevant field
* Proven experience as an HR Generalist or in a related role
* Outstanding knowledge of MS Office
* **Requirements and Skills:**  

 3-5 years of experience in HR Operations or Human Resources or any other relevant field
* Must be fluent in English and French, written and spoken.
* Understanding of general Human Resources policies and procedures
* Good knowledge of employment and/or labor laws
* Excellent communication and people skills
* Aptitude in problem-solving
* Desire to work as a team with a result driven approach.

**Assets (if applicable):**

* Experience with HRIS systems
* Certifications in HR

**About Empowerists:**


Founded in 2003 by Joe Diab, Diabsolut Inc, now Empowerists, began as a ClickSoftware reseller. In 2015 with more than 70 employees the Empowerists was divided into 3 separate businesses Diabsolut FSM (ClickSoftware partner), Diabsolut Cloud Solutions (Salesforce partner) and Watershed CI our management consulting and staff augmentation business.


Seeing the need for a streamlined HRIS as our company grew in 2016, our Director of HR, Sally, saw an opportunity and launched HRWize, our HRIS solution. Today, Sally is the president of HRWize, and two new products, Earnwize (salary review tool) and Workaxle (enterprise workforce management), have been introduced under the HRWize brand.


After Salesforce acquired ClickSoftware in 2019, Diabsolut FSM and Diabsolut Cloud Solutions merged to become Diabsolut and have since gone on to become a Salesforce Summit Partner. Since 2021, we have made strategic investments to acquire Foundry52 and Emelar, also both becoming part of Diabsolut. Through these acquisitions Diabsolut strengthened their commitment to Salesforce and also entered into partnership with Certinia (was FinancialForce), becoming Certinia’s Partner of the year for delivery excellence in 2022


Today the Empowerists are more than 300 employees globally and we continue to grow by investing in our people and businesses.

title: Partenaire d'Affaires RH - Succursales / HR Business Partner - Branches
description:
*(English version below)*

***La routine, ce n’est pas pour vous? Vous aimez être dans l’action?***  
***Vous voulez faire la différence et assurer un service de qualité à vos clients internes?***  
**Première Moisson a le poste qu’il vous faut!**

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'un **Partenaire d'Affaires Ressources Humaines** pour un remplacement d'une durée indéterminée. Relevant du Directeur Ressources Humaines, la personne recherchée supportera notre réseau de boulangeries artisanales, à titre de **Généraliste RH**!

Vous serez impliqué dans toutes les sphères importantes des ressources humaines. **Le mandat nécessite des déplacements en magasin** (environ 3 jours/semaine), est **éligible à notre politique de télétravail** et **la présence à notre siège social de Vaudreuil-Dorion est minime.**

Travailler chez Première Moisson, c’est joindre une famille de professionnels et de passionnés qui œuvrent dans un milieu stimulant offrant une multitude d’avantages.

**Statu du poste :** Temps plein - Mandat temporaire

**Nous offrons :**

* Salaire évolutif;
* Formation continue et développement professionnel
* Rabais alléchants et gratuités
* Ambiance de travail conviviale et familiale

**Principales responsabilités:**

* Agit à titre de personne-ressource, de coach et d'expert RH pour les cadres et directeurs en magasins;
* Agit à titre de représentant de l'employeur auprès des divers bureaux législatifs, lorsque requis: Normes du travail, TAT, CLP, etc.;
* Agit à titre de ressource pour nos employés pour toutes questions relatives aux politiques de l'entreprise et aux avantages sociaux;
* En collaboration avec les différents départements, travaille sur l'attraction et la rétention des talents;
* Administre le programme SST et soutient la gestion de dossiers en collaboration avec notre Mutuelle de prévention;
* Évalue les besoins de formation du personnel en magasin et propose un calendrier de formations annuelles;
* Coordonne les formations obligatoires du personnel en magasin (MAPAQ, Secourisme, etc.);
* Effectue la vigie de nos bonnes pratiques RH par le biais du Sondage de satisfaction des employés et propose des plans d'actions personnalisés;
* Supporte le département des opérations lors d'ouverture de nouvelles boulangeries (recrutement et accueil);
* Organise et dirige le Comité GRH du réseau de détail et assure la mise en œuvre des décisions prises;
* Élabore les scénarios de politique salariale du réseau de détail et assure la mise en application.

**Expériences & Compétences :**

* Détenir un Baccalauréat en Ressources humaines/Relations Industrielles ou dans un domaine connexe;
* Détenir 5 à 8 ans d'expérience à titre de généraliste en ressources humaines ou dans un emploi similaire;
* Détenir de l'expérience dans le commerce du détail et/ou dans le service à la clientèle (Atout);
* **Détenir un permis de conduire valide** pour se déplacer en magasin;
* Être une personne organisée pouvant gérer plusieurs dossiers en même temps;
* Être une personne autant agile que stratégique dans la gestion des dossiers;
* Orienté client & enthousiasme;
* Créatif et en mode solution;

***À propos de Première Moisson :***

*Fondée en 1992, Première Moisson fabrique et vend des produits de boulangerie, de pâtisserie et de charcuterie élaborés selon une approche artisanale avec des ingrédients sains. Pour se démarquer, l’entreprise mise dès le début sur la fraîcheur, la qualité et l’authenticité ; des valeurs qui sont encore aujourd’hui au cœur de sa stratégie de développement. Première Moisson emploie plus de 1 200 personnes et compte 23 boulangeries au Québec et un magasin à Ottawa. Plusieurs de ses produits sont vendus en épicerie au Québec et en Ontario. L’acquisition de l’entreprise par Metro permet à Première Moisson de rayonner encore davantage grâce à la force du réseau de distribution de ce chef de file dans les domaines de l’alimentation et de la pharmacie au Québec et en Ontario.*

Notez que seules les candidatures retenues seront contactées

***\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_***

***Routine is not for you? Do you like to be part of the action?***  
***Do you want to make a difference and provide quality service to your internal customers?***  
**Première Moisson has the job for you!**

We are currently looking for a **Human Resources Business Partner** for an indeterminate temporary replacement. Reporting to the Director of Human Resources, the successful candidate will support our network of artisan bakeries as an **HR Generalist**! **The position requires in-store travel** (approximately 3 days/week), is **eligible for our telecommuting policy,** and requires **minimal presence at our Vaudreuil-Dorion head office.**

Working at Première Moisson is to become part of a family of professionals and enthusiasts who work in a stimulating environment offering a multitude of benefits.

**Status of the role:** Full time - Temporary mandate

**We offer:**

* Progressive salary
* Ongoing training and professional development
* Attractive discounts and freebies
* Friendly, family atmosphere

**Main responsibilities:**

* Acts as a resource person, coach and HR expert for store managers and directors
* Acts as employer's representative with various legislative offices, when required: Labour Standards, TAT, CLP, etc..
* Acts as a resource for our employees on all matters relating to company policies and benefits
* In collaboration with various departments, works on talent attraction and retention
* Administers the OHS program and supports file management in collaboration with our Mutuelle de prévention
* Evaluates the training needs of store personnel and proposes an annual training schedule
* Coordinates mandatory training for store personnel (MAPAQ, First Aid, etc.)
* Monitors our HR best practices through the Employee Satisfaction Survey and proposes customized action plans
* Supports the Operations Department when opening new bakeries (recruitment and welcoming)
* Organizes and leads the Retail Network HRM Committee and ensures implementation of decisions taken
* Develops salary policy scenarios for the retail network and ensures implementation

**Experience & Skills:**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources/Industrial Relations or related field
* 5 to 8 years' experience as a generalist in human resources or in a similar position
* Experience in retail and/or customer service (Asset)
* **Possess a valid driver's license**
* Organized and able to manage several files at the same time
* Be both agile and strategic in managing files
* Customer-oriented & enthusiastic
* Creative & solution-oriented

***About Première Moisson:***

*Founded in 1992, Première Moisson manufactures and sells bakery, pastry and charcuterie products made with wholesome ingredients using an artisanal approach. From the outset, the company set itself apart by focusing on freshness, quality and authenticity, values that are still at the heart of its development strategy today. Première Moisson employs over 1,200 people and has 23 bakeries in Quebec and one in Ottawa. Many of its products are sold in grocery stores in Quebec and Ontario. Metro's acquisition of Première Moisson gives the company even greater reach, thanks to the strength of this leading food and drugstore retailer's distribution network in Quebec and Ontario.*

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, Contrat à durée déterminée

Horaires de travail :

* 8 Heures
* Du Lundi au Vendredi
* Quart de jour

Question(s) de présélection:

* Possédez-vous un permis de conduire valide?

Formation:

* Baccalauréat (Souhaité)

Expérience:

* Ressources humaines: 5 ans (Souhaité)

Langue:

* Français (Obligatoire)

Lieu du poste : Télétravail hybride à Vaudreuil-Dorion, QC J7V 1Y3

title: Recruitment Manager
description:
Princeton Medspa Partners specializes in buying and launching the leading medical spas and providing the best aesthetic services in the United States.

We are industry outliers with an unprecedented team of aesthetic pioneers and thought leaders who bring decades of experience and proven track records to every partnership.

Princeton Medspa Partners is guided by core values of integrity, safety, personalized service and industry-best results.

The company size is currently 11 locations and ~170 employees. Projected growth will add +17 locations in 2024, and up to 20 new locations in 2025, 2026, and 2027.

The Recruitment Manager will support the hiring needs of the company's 11 existing locations and additional locations as they come on-line. Roles to recruit for will largely be in the medical space such as physicians (MD/DO), Nurse Practitioners, and Physician Assistants.

The Recruitment Manager will build out a recruiting team in support of the company as it grows. The company size is currently 11 locations and ~170 employees. Projected growth will add +17 locations in 2024, and up to 20 new locations in 2025, 2026, and 2027.

**Requirements:**

* 5+ years full life cycle recruiting experience
* Experience building and managing a recruiting team

**Nice to Have:**

* Experience recruiting for professional and/or medical roles

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement recruitment strategies to attract and hire qualified candidates
* Conduct full-cycle recruitment, including sourcing, screening, interviewing, and selecting candidates
* Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and create job descriptions
* Utilize various recruitment and collaboration tools and platforms such as Monday.com and JazzHR
* Build and maintain relationships with external recruitment agencies and job boards
* Collaborate with the HR team to develop hiring/planning strategies
* Utilize JazzHR to track candidate information and manage recruitment pipelines

**Skills:**

* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
* Strong knowledge of recruitment best practices and employment laws
* Ability to effectively source candidates through various channels
* Experience in conducting interviews and assessing candidate qualifications
* Knowledge of hiring/planning strategies and talent development initiatives

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: HR Generalist
description:
**ABOUT US**



OLIPOP was founded in 2017 by Ben Goodwin and David Lester. Ben and David have been working together for nearly a decade to find accessible solutions to bring the benefits of digestive health to as many consumers as possible. OLIPOP is a deliciously refreshing tonic that is crafted with prebiotics, botanicals, and natural plant fiber to support your microbiome and benefit digestive health. We're on a mission to provide an affordable, delicious alternative to soda that delivers leading-edge health benefits to mainstream consumers.


**OUR TEAM**



At Olipop our values lead the way we create our products, engage with each other, and interact with our community. While we're invested in our product, we're equally invested in personal development. We're tightly knit, we're genuine and we're always pushing the envelope to do a better job than we did the day before. Our team is also fully remote, requiring us to be resourceful, creative and collaborative to support our fast-moving business.



To best serve our diverse community of customers, we also seek to recruit and include people with a diversity of abilities, backgrounds, and cultures.


**WHAT YOU'LL NEED**



Working at a start-up can be as much a personal journey as it is a professional one. To succeed at a company like Olipop, you must be comfortable with failing, learning, and adapting. You need to be curious, optimistic, and able to find a way when it seems impossible. You must be confident enough to express your ideas but humble and open to learning from your experiences and from others. If this is the approach you take to life, then we'd love to hear from you.

**THE ROLE**



OLIPOP is searching for a People Operations Generalist to join our team. This position focuses on excellent execution of the day-to-day operations of the People Operations department while providing exceptional and timely support to our growing team of 100+ OLIPOPPERS in more than 20 states.



In this role you'll have to prioritize your time to focus on the "nuts and bolts" of People Operations, including but not limited to payroll, benefits, leaves of absence, worker's compensation, and HRIS management, all while modeling and upleveling our culture and values. You'll be a great addition to our team if you are interested in work that makes a difference, are able to think critically and creatively to solve problems, and are skilled at building efficient processes that will scale with our company.

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Processing bi-monthly payroll with absolute accuracy, ensuring all data changes are accounted for and all compliance requirements are met.
* Performing various new hire onboarding and offboarding tasks to ensure a consistent, high quality experience that exceeds employee expectations, suggesting improvements to automate where practical and ensuring compliance with the respective laws of each state where we operate (20+, currently).
* Partnering with our benefits broker to administer employee benefits, including answering employee questions and supporting annual enrollment.
* Managing our current HRIS, Gusto, ensuring 100% accurate data at all times, running routine and ad-hoc reports, and quickly learning the ins and outs of the system to understand what customization is available based on changing organizational needs.
* Supporting HRIS transition projects, having experience with a variety of popular HRIS, payroll and performance management technology and familiarity with transitioning and implementation of new systems.
* Working with our leave management vendor to support employee leaves of absence, understanding the basics of leave management and being comfortable with explaining our company leave policies and practices, following up with employees to request required forms and documenting leaves in our HRIS.
* Administering worker's compensation programs, reporting claims, liaising with employees, managers and claims adjusters to ensure employees are taken care of and claims are moved through the process in a timely manner.
* Administering the performance review cycle in our performance management software by setting up the cycle, keeping track of important dates, sending reminders, moving the cycle through the various stages and helping answer questions to ensure reviews are high-quality and completed in a timely manner.
* Administering company engagement programs, including supporting survey and action planning activities, and suggesting/executing activities that support company engagement initiatives.
* Creating and updating People Operations process documentation, standard operating procedures, help guides and various other resources to be used within the department and by OLIPOPPPERS at large.
* Creating systems to self-audit processes to ensure nothing slips through the cracks and when it does, we catch it quickly.
* Collaborating with the People Operations team as needed to deliver the best support and service to every Olipop employee.


**QUALIFICATIONS**


* Minimum 3+ years of hands-on operational experience performing the tasks that are listed above.
* Highly organized, process-oriented, excellent follow-through and reliable - nobody ever questions if you'll do what you say you're going to do. You communicate status updates regularly to build trust with colleagues and leaders.
* Ability to take initiative and work autonomously – you act as a thermostat, not a thermometer, and can run with something from beginning to end.
* Ability to work with ambiguity, think critically, make decisions and solve non-routine problems based on your experience and through solid reasoning skills. Not a rule follower for rule's sake.
* High level of discretion when dealing with confidential and sensitive matters.
* Ability to communicate clearly, empathetically and firmly in a variety of settings - verbally, in writing, 1 on 1 and in large groups.
* Competence in Google Suite and Microsoft Suite - ability to manipulate data sets in spreadsheets, perform calculations and write formulas.
* Experience with team collaboration tools such as Slack and Zoom is preferred.

  


**REPORTS TO**



People Success Manager

  


**COMPENSATION**



$80,000-$90,000 base salary + bonus

  

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Olipop does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor. Applicants and employees are protected from discrimination under Federal law. For more information, please see EEO is the Law.

title: Global Mergers, Acquisitions, Divestitures and Joint Venture (MADJV) HR Manager NA (Open to Remote)
description:
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 157 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.
  
Location
  
  

This role will be based in North America and is open to remote. Job Purpose and Impact
  
  

The North America Mergers, Acquisitions, Divestitures, and Joint Venture (“MADJV”) HR Manager will flex across MADJV assignments to support all business enterprise groups and functions. In this role, you will be accountable for leading the execution of MADJV transactions on behalf of human resources as assigned. You will establish strong working relationships with essential project team members (including HR domains, business stakeholders and functional partners)) to ensure deals realize the highest possible value, limit risks, protect company interests, values and culture to drive optimal business outcomes. Key Accountabilities
  
  

Lead and develop strategic relationships, influence, and mobilize action among business leaders, corporate development, and human resource partners related to all people components of MADJV transactions.
  
Support the long-range HR MADJV strategic roadmap to meet the company´s inorganic growth goals.
  
Ensure roadmaps and requirements for transformation execution are shaped, understood, and delivered at the right time and with the highest quality of delivery.
  
Partner with other key stakeholders to ensure cohesive alignment and to enable the overall MADJV activities, vision, and strategy.
  
Foster a strong continuous improvement culture to ensure deployment of MADJV processes and be a change leader to inject strategic and innovative thinking into initiatives and projects.
  
Flex across various enterprises and functions to ensure the demand is met with allocated resources and support MADJV efforts globally.
  
Provide expert thought leadership in your field and work with limited direction, using additional research and interpretation to identify issues or problems. Provide direction to supporting team members and be a strategic contributor.
  
Other duties as assigned. Qualifications
  
Minimum Qualifications
  
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
  
Minimum of six years of related work experience including M&A transactions
  
Ability to travel regionally and internationally up to 25% of the time Preferred Qualifications
  
Minimum of five years of experience leading MADJV projects, with knowledge of due diligence processes and procedures used within the context of MADJV, including applicable laws and regulations
  
Master's degree or other post-secondary degree
  
Experience partnering with senior business and functional executives across an organization
  
Ability to utilize data and insights to identify trends to drive process improvements and evolve the MADJV function
  
Ability to combine strategic thinking and strong operational execution with solid attention to detail
  
Demonstrated ability to effectively navigate through ambiguity
  
Excellent presentation skills. Must be able to draft and deliver compelling and informative presentations to senior leaders Additional Information
  
  

Compensation
  
The expected salary for this position is $150-165K. This position is eligible for a discretionary incentive award. The incentive award amount is dependent upon company performance and your personal performance.
  
Benefits
  
Full-Time (30+ hours) positions are eligible for a benefit package including the following (subject to certain collective bargaining agreements for Union positions): Paid time off; paid holidays; medical, vision, and dental coverage; flexible spending accounts; life insurance; disability insurance; retirement savings; employee and family assistance program (EAP)
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.
  
  

Minnesota Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 48 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law.

title: HR Generalist
description:
**Who We Are**


eAssist is the nation's leading platform for remote dental billing and patient billing services for dental offices. We were co-founded by a dentist who understands what other dentists need. eAssist currently serves close to 3000 dental practices through a unique proprietary technology platform that connects dental practices to vetted dental billing professionals, allowing practice owners to fully outsource their billing department.


eAssist was recently certified as a *2022-2023 Great Place to Work* and has been featured on the *Inc 5000* list of fastest-growing privately held companies in the U.S. for the last 7 years in a row! ***What makes us so unique? We are 100% remote. This means we are truly able to find the best of the best to join our employee team and they get to do what they love from the comfort of their home office.***

**Please check out what people love about us and our platform on Glassdoor:**


https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/eAssist-Reviews-E814561.htm

**Who You Are**


We’re looking for that one of a kind person who will stand out of the crowd of applicants. The type of person who doesn’t sit around and wait for direction, but actually begins projects independently. You feel compelled to take action without requiring additional prompting from managers. If you see a challenge you embrace it head on and you love to test your limits. You’re the first person to volunteer for a difficult task and don’t need much direction. You know how to move past difficulties and find alternative solutions to accomplish your objectives. If you are all of these things and more then we’d love to meet you!

 **JOB OVERVIEW:** The HR Generalist is responsible for assisting with the administration of all HR initiatives, including benefits and retirement programs, HRIS management, onboarding/offboarding, performance management and other HR admin duties. This is a full-time salaried (exempt) position working 40 hours per week (or more if needed). The incumbent will also provide other HR related services as needed. Preference given to someone in Utah county, though this role will be mostly remote (90%+)

 **KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Assist in ensuring the accuracy of all benefits enrollments in the HRIS (ADP) to provide vendors with accurate eligibility information.
* Assist employees via email, phone and company communication channels with their questions.
* Process and administer all leave-of-absence requests and disability paperwork: medical, personal, disability and FMLA.
* Effectively interpret FMLA and ADA implications as they relate to leaves of absence/disabilities.
* Generate reports and analyze data to support decision-making and compliance.
* Assist with employee performance management programs.
* Provide assistance in other areas of Human Resources as needed.
* Updating and entering employee information into HRIS system.
* Assisting with onboarding and offboarding duties.
* If local, mail pick up and sorting from office in American Fork.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

  

* Familiarity with HRIS (ADP preferred).
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* High level of integrity and ability to handle confidential information.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or similar software.

 **MINIMUM WORK EXPERIENCE:**

  

* 2+ years experience in Human Resources

 **PREFERRED EDUCATION:**

* Associate’s degree in HR or related field preferred.
* SHRM-CP or PHR

 **COMPENSATION: $58-62,000 DOE**

 **TRAVEL / PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**


90% Remote; If you are local to UT county then mail pick up from office will be required. must maintain a private, professional work environment, free from distractions and be available for virtual meetings during business hours (for example, Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm in your time zone).




OctSiaLrsE

title: People Operations Associate
description:
Headway’s mission is a big one - to build a new mental health care system everyone can access. We’ve built technology that helps people find great therapists with the first software-enabled national network of providers accepting insurance.



1 in 4 people in the US have a treatable mental health condition, but the majority of providers don’t accept insurance, making therapy too expensive for most people. Headway is building a new mental healthcare system that everyone can access by making it easy for therapists to take insurance and scale their practice.



Headway was founded in 2019 – since then, we’ve grown into a diverse, national network of over 25,000 mental healthcare providers across all 50 states who run their practice on our software. We’re a Series C company with over $225m in funding from a16z (Andreessen Horowitz), Accel, GV (formerly Google Ventures), Spark Capital, Thrive Capital, and Health Care Service Corporation.



We want your time here to be the most meaningful experience of your career. **Join us, and help change mental healthcare for the better.**


As Headway’s People Operations Associate, you’ll play an integral role in supporting our 500+ employees & 500+ contingent workers across the US. We’re looking for a gritty, relationship-obsessed team player to support Headway’s human hypergrowth to galvanize our progress towards our mission.



As an early member of the People Ops function, you’ll have direct exposure to all dimensions of People Operations in this high-visibility role, though initial focus will primarily be on the areas below. This is an exceptional opportunity for someone interested in developing their People Ops toolkit in a dynamic, high-growth and mission-driven environment.


**Join us, and make an impact.**



As Headway’s People Operations Associate, you’ll play an integral role in supporting our 500+ employees & 500+ contingent workers across the US. We’re looking for a gritty, relationship-obsessed team player to support Headway’s human hypergrowth to galvanize our progress towards our mission.



As an early member of the People Ops function, you’ll have direct exposure to all dimensions of People Operations in this high-visibility role, though initial focus will primarily be on the areas below. This is an exceptional opportunity for someone interested in developing their People Ops toolkit in a dynamic, high-growth and mission-driven environment.


**You will:**


* Manage onboarding and offboarding SOPs of full time employees and contingent workers, identifying ways to improve and scale

Lead our People Tickets Infrastructure * - including triage and ensuring coverage in most People ops AORs


**You’d be a great fit if:**


* You have a minimum of 2-years of experience working on an HR/people team at a high growth technology start-up in an operational capacity
* You love to build new things and are extremely passionate about building relationships
* You have a curiosity and drive to learn the ins and outs of People Ops
* You can multitask and work quickly without sacrificing attention to detail
* You are resourceful and ready to help others whenever needed


**Compensation and Benefits:**


* Salary information is based on a single salary target per role and is differentiated based on geographic location (Group A, B, or C)
	+ Group A = NYC/Tri-State Area, SF/Bay Area, LA Area, Seattle, Boston, Austin, and San Diego
	+ Group B = Chicago, Miami, Denver, Washington DC, Philadelphia, Atlanta, Minneapolis, Nashville, Sacramento, Phoenix, and Portland
	+ Group C = All remaining cities
+ Group A: $85,000
+ Group B: $76,500
+ Group C: $68,000
+ Examples of cities located in each Compensation Grouping:
* Benefits offered include:
+ Equity Compensation
+ Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage
+ HSA / FSA
+ 401K
+ Work-from-Home Stipend
+ Therapy Reimbursement
+ 16-week parental leave after you have been employed with Headway for 12 months (non-exempt employees must have worked at least 1,250 hours)
+ Carrot Fertility annual reimbursement and membership
+ 13 paid holidays each year as well as a Holiday Break during the week between December 25th and December 31st
+ Unlimited PTO
+ Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
+ Training and professional development

We believe a team's strength is in its people, and we cannot achieve this mission without a team that reflects the diversity of this problem - across race, ethnicity, gender, sexuality, age, national origin, religion, family status, disability, military status, and experience.



Headway is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Headway will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact talent@findheadway.com



Headway employees work remotely across the US, with the option to work from offices in New York City and San Francisco. Headway participates in E-Verify. To learn more, click here.

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
AJM is Canada’s leading headwear supplier! We design and supply headwear for major apparel brands, sports brands, and sports teams. We are celebrating 40 years in business this year thanks to our amazing customers!

At AJM we value family and see our employees as our family! This is why so many of our employees have been working with us for 10, 15, 20, 30 and 35+ years! Our workplace culture is casual, fun and friendly. Our head office is located in Montreal, QC and we also have offices in Toronto and Vancouver.

We have an exciting opportunity for a talented HR Business Partner r to join our AJM team based in Montreal, Quebec. The HR Business Partner will work closely with the leadership team and be the go-to person for employee-related issues. Responsibilities will include recruitment, onboarding employee relations, performance management, employee engagement, training & development and talent management. Promoting corporate values and shaping a positive culture is a vital aspect of the HR Business Partner’s role.

What will you do?

* Ability to partner, influence outcomes in a positive way
* Communicates clear and consistent messages with integrity, relying upon data and facts to advocate a position and overcome objection
* Responsible to work with leadership to identify hiring needs
* Responsible for recruitment and onboarding
* Oversee and manage a performance appraisal system
* Consults with managers on employee issues
* In-depth knowledge of labor law and HR best practices
* Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management
* Manage employee benefit programs
* Pay Equity program
* OLF (Francisation program)
* Policies and program
* Examines and integrates existing systems, programs, and practices into streamlined and effective processes
* Continuously reviews and improves processes

Skills:

* Great communication skills in English and French (English required for employees in the West of Canada)
* Bachelor’s Degree (a concentration in Human Resources preferred)
* 5-7 + plus years’ experience performing in a variety of HR roles with strong generalist experience.

Nous avons une opportunité excitante pour un Partenaire d'affaires RH talentueux de joindre notre équipe AJM basée à Montréal, Québec. Le Partenaire d'affaires RH travaillera en collaboration avec l'équipe de direction et sera la personne de référence pour les questions relatives aux employés. Les responsabilités comprennent le recrutement, l'intégration, les relations avec les employés, la gestion de la performance, l'engagement des employés, la formation et le développement ainsi que la gestion des talents. La promotion des valeurs de l'entreprise et le développement d'une culture positive sont des aspects essentiels du rôle du Partenaire d'affaires RH.

Que ferez-vous ?

* Capacité à travailler en partenariat et à influencer les résultats de manière positive
* Communiquer des messages clairs et cohérents avec intégrité
* Collaborer avec la direction pour identifier les besoins de recrutement
* Responsable du recrutement et de l'intégration
* Superviser et gérer un système d'évaluation des performances
* Consulter les gérants sur les questions relatives aux employés.
* Connaissance approfondie du droit du travail et des meilleures pratiques de ressources humaines
* Assurer la conformité à la législation dans le cadre de la gestion des ressources humaines
* Gérer les programmes d'avantages sociaux
* Programme d'équité salariale
* OLF (programme de francisation)
* Politiques et programmes
* Examiner et intégrer les systèmes, programmes et pratiques existants dans des processus optimisés et efficaces.
* Examiner et améliorer continuellement les processus.

Compétences :

* Excellentes compétences en communication en anglais et en français (l'anglais est requis pour les employés de l'Ouest du Canada).
* Baccalauréat (concentration en ressources humaines de préférence)
* 5 à 7 ans d'expérience dans une variété de rôles en ressources humaines avec une forte expérience généraliste. Par exemple :
* Expérience en recrutement
* Diriger le processus de gestion des performances et des talents
* Coaching et conseils aux dirigeants
* Influencer positivement la direction de l'entreprise
* Traitement de dossier confidentielle

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $70,000.00-$80,000.00 per year

Benefits:
