title: People Generalist, Fulfillment Operations
description:
As a member of the ShipBob Team, you will benefit from an environment where everything is achievable. We aim to be a place where you can:


* **Write Your Career Story**. Because we are solving some of the most difficult problems in global commerce, you have the opportunity to write the story that will make your career.
* **Experience Global Impact and Global Connection.** At ShipBob we benefit from diverse cultures and perspectives in service of the global community.
* **Grow With An Ownership Mindset.** We believe that great innovation comes from great transparency. We are more resilient and more creative when we have an inclusive and transparent culture where everyone knows our strengths and opportunities.


**Title:** People Generalist, Fulfillment Operations


**Shift:** M-F, 2:00 pm-11:00 pm, with overtime as needed


**Location:** Bethlehem, PA


**Role Description:**



The People Generalist, Fulfillment Operations is a hands-on role that serves as the People Team representative providing full cycle Human Resources support within our ShipBob Innovation and Fulfillment Centers. As the primary point of contact for employees and managers, you will be supporting our teams with specialized employee relations matters, conflict and performance management, career planning, and more. In addition, as a People Generalist, Fulfillment Operations you will work closely with our business leaders to execute HR initiatives and strategies to drive organizational effectiveness, employee engagement, workforce planning, and compliance within your assigned location.


**What you'll do:**


* Serve as the first point of contact for employees to resolve issues and conduct investigations partnering with People Team Leadership, HRBPs, and Legal as needed.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date human resource records and documentation, upholding compliance guidelines and regulations by performing periodic audits.
* Train, coach, and counsel managers on people matters.
* Partner with 3rd party staffing agency on-site representative to ensure proper staffing.
* Participate in recruiting events and career fairs both onsite and offsite.
* Source, schedule, coordinate and conduct new employee interviews for hourly roles.
* Facilitate new hire onboarding training and ensure new hires are processed correctly with all required paperwork and approvals being completed properly.
* Conduct new hire check-ins with all associates.
* Participate in ShipBob Culture Committee and support Employee Resource Groups (ERGs).
* Establish, plan, coordinate, and participate in employee retention efforts at assigned location in partnership with site General Manager.
* Host employee office hours / open door hours
* Facilitate the smooth exit of employees by maintaining a consistent offboarding process to include acting as the HR representation during involuntary separation meetings and conducting exit interviews with voluntary separations.
* Track employee attendance and manage disciplinary write-ups.
* Participate in the progressive discipline and PIP process for associates within assigned location.
* Provide support and communication to employees regarding new People Team initiatives and programs, including the yearly open enrollment process.
* Presents at assigned site's monthly town hall and start-up meetings.
* Monitor, address, and communicate key people metrics monthly with site leadership.
* Administer periodic employee satisfaction surveys and compile results as scheduled by the company.
* Provide training and resources to the onsite Leadership team.
* Process accident paperwork in support of workers compensation claims.
* Additional duties, projects, and responsibilities as necessary or assigned by the HRBP and the People Leadership team.


**What you'll bring to the table:**


* Bachelor's degree in Human Re sources or Business related field; or equivalent combination of education and experience; or SPHR/PHR, SHRM-CP Certified.
* Solid understanding of Labor related laws and statutes.
* Prior experience working in a fulfillment center, warehouse, or manufacturing facility.
* Ability to understand and interpret data as well as the ability to make recommendations and take action utilizing that data.
* Must be able to manage highly confidential information.
* Able to work in a fast-paced, highly energized and open environment and work with all levels of management.
* Solid presentation and speaking skills to a wide range of group sizes.
* Must have stellar interpersonal skills (written and verbal).
* Proficient in using MS Office, Excel, and data related tools.
* Ability to work independently, requiring minimal direction.
* Ability to travel required.


**Classification:** Non Exempt


**Reports to:** Manager, North America People Operations


**Perks & Benefits:**


* Medical, Dental, Vision & Basic Life Insurance
* Paid Maternity/Parental Leave Program
* Flexible Time Off Program
* Paid Sick Leave and Paid Emergency Leave
* Floating Holidays (2 days/year)
* Wellness Days (1 day/quarter)
* 401K Match
* Competitive Salary and Performance Bonus
* Variety of voluntary benefits, such as, short term disability
* Referral Bonus Program
* Fun Culture >>> Check us out on Instagram (@lifeatshipbob)


***ShipBob believes in transparency while providing a competitive total compensation package with a pay for performance approach. The expected base pay range for this position is $65,000 - $94,000.***


We recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please still consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence; therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.


**About You:**



At ShipBob, we're looking to bring on board people who embody our core values:


* Be **Mission-Driven.** We want team members that are passionate about helping entrepreneurs improve their business, and bring that passion every day.
* Be **Humble**. We have ambitious goals, and our team members understand that success or failure depends on us working together and leaving egos at the door.
* Be **Resilient.** Logistics is a complicated business. So is software. We value team members that never give up and keep iterating until a problem is solved.
* Be a **Creative Problem Solver.** As a startup, we value smart, innovative solutions to complex problems. We fall in love with the problem, not our "favorite" solution.
* **Be Safety Minded.** It's not just talk; it's the way you work.


**About Us:**



ShipBob is a cloud-based logistics platform that partners with thousands of e-commerce businesses to help make their entrepreneurial dreams a reality. We offer a full suite of fulfillment solutions for our merchants, including the ability to improve their transit times, shipping costs and deliver a best in class experience to their customers.



As one of the fastest growing tech companies in Chicago backed by blue-chip investors like Menlo Ventures, Bain Capital Ventures, Hyde Park Venture Partners and SoftBank Vision Fund 2, our goal is to continue to be the best fulfillment technology in the industry.


*ShipBob provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*


*This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.*

title: HR Generalist
description:
**Title:** Human Resources Generalist

**Department:** Human Resources

**Direct Supervisor:** Senior Director, Human Resources

**General Summary:** This position serves to support the Human Resources Department and the company. The Human Resources Generalist is responsible for the day-to-day needs of the HR Department. The HR Generalist is the first point of contact for the company and is responsible for keeping the department running.

**Essential Functions:**

* Provides direct support to the Human Resources Department.
* Facilitates employment-related processes for new and current employees.
* Regularly tracks and manages record database for all internal and field personnel (500+ employees).
* Oversees and tracks all sick, vacation and benefit accruals and usage. Works closely with third-party payroll provider (i.e., Entertainment Partners) and the Accounting Department to verify employee vacation, sick and leave days.
* Advises staff on leave policies and requests for time off.
* Administers company health benefit plans. Serves as main contact for benefits plan questions, maintains all enrollment paperwork, coordinates open enrollment, and processes all benefit changes.
* Maintains handbooks, company safety policies, and compliance materials.
* Works with payroll and health benefits providers to ensure that the providers receive appropriate employee paperwork, and that employees can enroll in appropriate plans.
* Familiarizes new and current employees with company policies, procedures, and benefits.
* Maintains relationships with key employees to ascertain necessary production and employee information including employment start dates, rates, and end dates.
* Maintains multiple tracking spreadsheets simultaneously.
* Recruits, schedules interviews, and facilitates the hiring of qualified job applicants for open positions; collaborates with department managers to understand skills and competencies required for openings.
* Coordinates, schedules, and implements new hire orientation.
* Performs routine tasks required to administer and execute human resource programs including compensation, benefits, state and federal leaves, safety, and compliance.
* Addresses employment-related inquiries from applicants, employees, and supervisors, referring complex and/or sensitive matters to the appropriate staff.
* Provides employee history, rate checks, and employment status for inquiring supervisors.
* Provides verbal phone confirmation for employee verification checks, as well as completing written verifications.
* Researches and maintains knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and recent technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law.
* Completes various tasks and projects as needed for the Senior Director, Human Resources.

**Other Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Handles highly confidential information with a high degree of professionalism and discretion.
* Ability to multi-task and manage several ongoing projects simultaneously.
* Ability to maintain a high level of organization.
* Great follow-through and the ability to anticipate upcoming work needs.
* Ability to communicate with staff at all levels.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* This position requires frequent contact with high-level executives.
* Must be extremely self-motivated and comfortable working independently and in a group setting.
* Heavy e-mail and phone correspondence.
* This position is hourly with minimal overtime as deemed necessary.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or a related field preferred.
* 1-3 years of HR Generalist experience.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
* Knowledge of the entertainment industry is not required but a plus.
* Must be comfortable with the Macintosh Operating Systems.

**Physical Demands:**

* This position is a sedentary role, must be able to sit or stand for the duration of their shift.
* While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear.
* This role would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand on a stool as necessary.

**Work Environment:**

* This position operates in a remote or hybrid environment.
* This position routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.
* This position will not require travel.
* This position does not require the use of a company or personal vehicle for work-related tasks.
* This is a full-time position. Position hours are from 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM.

**Classification:** Non-Exempt

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $27.00 - $32.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid jury duty
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Overtime

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: Remote

title: Office/HR Manager
description:
**Your Next Opportunity**



We have an exciting role open as an **Office/Human Resources Manager** in our **Montreal** office. Your focus will be providing leadership, coordination and supporting the day-to-day operations of the Montreal office. This role has a variety of responsibilities while working with professional staff and national managers/directors to foster a collegial and collaborative culture. You will play a pivotal role supporting local office operations and Human Resources (HR) service delivery, including National HR initiatives.


***Please note that this role offers a hybrid work arrangement. Each week will combine both working from your home office and working from the McMillan office.***

**What You’ll Do:**



You will oversee the day-to-day administration of the facilities and office services departments and operations of various HR functions in the Montreal office including providing leadership and coaching. You will be a key point person and liaise with the Building Property Management team for any building notices, repairs and maintenance. You will drive the health and safety team initiatives within the office and work with the health & safety team to ensure compliance. This role will also assist with the planning and execution of local office social events and local charitable initiatives. You will also liaise with the local and national IT team on day-to-day IT issues.



As an HR professional, you will collaborate with the national HR team and support the administration of various HR functions, including recruitment, performance management, compensation, and employee relations, all while adhering to the Employment Standards of Quebec. You will ensure the office and its operations are in compliance with the Office québecois de la langue française (OQLF) requirements for French language in the workplace. You will play an active role in fostering a work environment that is inclusive, collaborative, and engaging as well as focus on employee engagement and clear communication for various employee programs such as service recognition, wellness and professional development. You will support the compliance requirement for pay equity as per -The Commission for Standards, Equity, Health and Safety at Work (CNESST) as well as the 1% training obligations under the Commission des partenaires du marché du travail (CPMT). With support from the National Director HR & Business Services, you will manage a team of legal administrative assistants, including share group team coordination ensuring effective resource management, identifying efficiencies, approving vacation, lieu and overtime. You will also conduct new hire orientations and office tours as well as exit interviews for the Montreal office. Finally, you will support all local initiatives, projects, and programs all while exemplifying our firm values of teamwork, professional excellence, commitment, respect, and client-service.


**What You Bring:**


* Minimum of 5 years experience in a Human Resources Generalist role; legal or professional services environment is an asset
* Experience working (verbal and written) in both official languages- French and English.
* Bachelor’s Degree and/or completion of a post graduate Human Resources Program
* An HRPA designation is considered an asset
* Previous supervisory and/or management experience is required
* Demonstrated enthusiasm, strategic leadership, coaching, facilitation, and relationship management skills
* Proven ability to partner with a variety of stakeholders, an ability to listen and to build confidence, interacting with people at all levels of the organizational with tact, diplomacy and in a professional manner
* Develop, coach and motivate people and foster a positive work environment
* Effective organizational, problem-solving, planning and analytical skills; demonstrated use of sound judgment and reliable decision making
* Ability to perform well under time constraints to meet deadlines
* Ability to resolve problems effectively exercising creative and analytical thinking
* Ability to work with minimal supervision and enjoy working in a fast-paced, team based environment
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and generally able to embrace new technology/information systems.


**McMillan Offers You**



Growth



Mentorship and Support



Training as Software Evolves



Commensurate Compensation and Benefits Package



Fun Work Environment


**McMillan = You**



At the heart of our commitment to being a first-mover on important issues, McMillan believes that equity, diversity and inclusion are catalysts for success. By embracing our differences, we create an inclusive culture that enriches our collective knowledge, broadens our perspectives, and propels us forward. We are dedicated to fostering an environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their whole selves to work, knowing it is through our individual experiences that we can all come together to truly make a positive impact in our firm, for our clients, within our communities, and beyond.



At McMillan, we know we will achieve the most success by attracting and retaining the best talent, and by representing and supporting communities from which we draw our members, the communities in which we live and work and the communities to which we provide legal services.



We are a law firm that prides itself in sustained quality and excellence in service while fostering a positive and collegial work environment which nurtures mentoring inspires enthusiasm and professional excellence. We commit to putting our best efforts forward in achieving our goals, and the goals of our clients. You can help us in that journey!



Need another reason to consider McMillan? Let’s work together to help you achieve your professional goals and career development.


**Let’s get started**


*If this position is for you, and you reside in or around the* ***Montreal*** *area, we look forward to hearing from you. We like cover letters too so don’t forget to include one along with your resume when you*



**McMillan is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities in its recruitment processes. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please email us or contact us at 1.888.622.4624 to submit your accommodation request.**


**McMillan LLP is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and diversity. We respect and embrace the unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences of individuals at all levels of the firm. This enables us to provide innovative client service, contribute fully to our communities and advance our firm’s values.**

title: Human Resources Specialist
description:
We are seeking a HR Executive with a comprehensive background in both the automobile industry and general HR functions to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing various HR activities, including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training, compliance, and policy development.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and execute recruitment strategies to attract top talent for diverse roles within the organization.

Conduct interviews, assess candidates, and make recommendations for hiring decisions.

Collaborate with department heads to understand staffing needs and ensure timely fulfillment of vacancies.

Serve as a trusted advisor to employees and management on HR-related matters.

Performance Management:

Oversee the performance appraisal process, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives.

Provide guidance to managers and employees on goal setting, performance feedback, and development opportunities.

Identify performance issues and collaborate with stakeholders to implement improvement plans.

Ensure compliance with relevant employment laws, regulations, and company policies.

Develop, review, and update HR policies and procedures to reflect best practices and legal requirements.

Provide guidance and training to employees and managers on HR policies, procedures, and compliance matters.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.

3+ years of progressive HR experience, including significant exposure to the automobile industry.

Solid understanding of HR principles, practices, and employment laws.

Strong interpersonal, communication, and problem-solving skills.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: ₹15,000.00 - ₹30,000.00 per month

Experience:

* HR: 3 years (Preferred)
* generalist: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

* English (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Chandigarh, Chandigarh (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
**Job Title: HR Generalist**

**Job Summary:**  
The HR Generalist plays a crucial role in supporting the overall HR functions and contributing to the development and implementation of HR policies and procedures. This position involves working closely with employees and management to address human resources needs, promote a positive workplace culture, and ensure compliance with relevant regulations.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Recruitment and Onboarding:**
* Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including job postings, screening resumes, conducting interviews, and making job offers.
* Facilitate new employee onboarding, orientation, and training programs.
* **Employee Relations:**
* Address employee inquiries and concerns, providing guidance on HR policies and procedures.
* Mediate and resolve employee relations issues, fostering a positive and inclusive workplace.
* **Performance Management:**
* Assist in the implementation and management of performance appraisal processes.
* Provide guidance on goal setting, feedback, and performance improvement plans.
* **Benefits Administration:**
* Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks.
* Coordinate open enrollment processes and answer employee questions about benefits.
* **HR Compliance:**
* Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal employment laws and regulations.
* Keep abreast of changes in legislation and update policies and procedures accordingly.
* **Training and Development:**
* Identify training needs within the organization and coordinate training programs.
* Support employee development initiatives to enhance skills and knowledge.
* **HR Data Management:**
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date HR records and databases.
* Generate reports on HR metrics and analyze trends.
* **Policy Development:**
* Contribute to the development and updating of HR policies and procedures.
* Communicate changes in policies to employees and ensure understanding.
* **HR Projects:**
* Participate in special HR projects and initiatives as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
* Proven experience as an HR Generalist or in a similar role.
* Knowledge of HR laws, regulations, and best practices.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.
* Proficient in HRIS (Human Resources Information System) and MS Office.

This is a broad overview, and the specific JD may be tailored to the unique needs of the organization. Additionally, as HR is a dynamic field, the responsibilities may evolve with changing business needs and industry trends.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: ₹50,000.00 - ₹60,000.00 per month

Schedule:

* Day shift

Education:

* Master's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Payroll: 10 years (Preferred)
* HR: 10 years (Preferred)
* total work: 10 years (Preferred)

* Professional in Human Resources® (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Chennai, Tamil Nadu (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Instagram.  

Business Unit:
Human Resources, Mumbai
Job Title: Associate  

Job Description:  

The Human Resources Associate will work in support of the India HR Business Partner to enhance operations and effectiveness across a broad variety of HR strategies and cyclical processes. This role will help prepare, track and monitor work and projects across all activities of the HR Business Partner team.  

This role will provide an excellent opportunity for broad-based learning of best-in-class strategic approaches to engaging, managing, and developing our human capital. Areas of responsibility include, but are not limited to:  

* Tactical support to India HRBP to execute HR processes including recruitment, talent management, engagement surveys, performance management, diversity, mobility.
* Play a key role in driving campus engagement and recruitment across businesses in India.
* Play a key role in extracting and organizing data for insights in support of a variety of initiatives, including but not limited to, headcount management, diversity & inclusion, talent and performance management, and ongoing audit and management of team data.
* Partner with HRBPs and Global Talent Development team to discover and implement talent development initiatives, including executive coaching assignments
* Be the custodian of all HR labor laws to ensure compliance; oversee regulatory filings.
* Support new hire integration process; including new hire check-in’s, onboarding plans.
* Work across business to identify and drive employee engagement initiatives for India employees.
* Partner closely with Regional Benefits team to implement employee benefits in India.
* Project manage or support ad hoc projects in the country and the region as needed.
  

Qualifications:  

Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who are highly motivated, intelligent, and have demonstrated excellence and sound judgment in prior endeavors. In addition to exceptionally strong organizational skills, the successful candidate should have:* Minimum 4-5 years of overall HR experience in a fast-paced environment
* Generalist knowledge of human resources processes, concepts and practices
* Good judgment, demonstrated ability to make sound decisions and be creative in developing alternative solutions in a dynamic environment
* Ability to apply critical thinking and analytical skills to identify issues and trends, develop solutions and/or recommendations to address root cause
* Strong analytical and quantitative skills to leverage data to create insights and strategies that support and drive business decisions
* Ability to navigate a global matrix organization and collaborate on issues across HR and the business
* Technically proficient in MS Office Suite – including advanced Excel and PowerPoint
  

The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position. Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion.  

Blackstone is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, marital or partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, genetic predisposition, veteran or military status, status as a victim of domestic violence, a sex offense or stalking, or any other class or status in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to hiring, placement, promotion, termination, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, and training. All Blackstone employees, including but not limited to recruiting personnel and hiring managers, are required to abide by this policy.
If you need a reasonable accommodation to complete your application, please contact Human Resources at 212-583-5000 (US), +44 (0)20 7451 4000 (EMEA) or +852 3656 8600 (APAC).
Depending on the position, you may be required to obtain certain securities licenses if you are in a client facing role and/or if you are engaged in the following:* Attending client meetings where you are discussing Blackstone products and/or and client questions;
* Marketing Blackstone funds to new or existing clients;
* Supervising or training securities licensed employees;
* Structuring or creating Blackstone funds/products; and
* Advising on marketing plans prepared by a sales team or developing and/or contributing information for marketing materials.

  

Note: The above list is not the exhaustive list of activities requiring securities licenses and there may be roles that require review on a case-by-case basis. Please speak with your Blackstone Recruiting contact with any questions.  

  

To submit your application please complete the form below. Fields marked with a red asterisk \\* must be completed to be considered for employment (although some can be answered "prefer not to say"). Failure to provide this information may compromise the follow-up of your application. When you have finished click Submit at the bottom of this form.

### **Description & Requirements**

**Job Description**

**Position Summary:**


To support the HR department to achieve the team’s strategic objectives, as set out in the HR Strategic Action Plan by acting as the HR lead on a range of different projects and responsibilities

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**

 **Job Responsibilities\\*:**

* Support the HRBP Manager in Talent Management activities
* Active participation, involvement and delivery as part of HR Projects
* Production of accurate and timely HR reporting on attrition, diversity etc.by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends
* Supporting the HRBP Manager in conceptualizing and delivering people management initiatives
* Coordinate exit process - ensuring appropriate documentation, conducting/coordinating exit interviews, and address any resulting issues
* Manage confirmation process as per org defined guidelines
* Facilitate employee engagement survey activities
* Drive cultural and sports activities by identifying and creating groups amongst employees
* Manage relocation process of existing employees - communication to internal stakeholders, letters, expense reimbursement
* Vendor management (specific to the role) – timely processing of invoices, keep track of expense outflow, maintain and update list of vendors
* Accurate collation and timely submission of Payroll inputs to the HR Ops. Team
* Conduct HR session during new hire induction programs
* Assist HRBP Mgr. on policy review and roll out
* Conduct FGD, track outstanding issues and customer pain points take it logical closure
* Administration of benefits like new born gift, wedding gift, Salary advance etc.
* Manage Employee Relations including handling of grievances and resolution of issues arising from them

* The particular duties and responsibilities of the role may vary from time to time without changing the general character of the duties or the level of responsibility entailed

 **Basic Qualifications:**

  

* MBA in Human Resources from a reputed university/institution
* 5 to 8 years of experience in a global, multicultural, multi-location organization
* Excellent Communication (verbal and written) & analytical skills and ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders and senior leadership
* A global perspective with the ability to understand and work effectively in a culturally diverse organization.
* Ability to organize and work effectively with project teams of staff from various departments.
* Ability to understand and articulate cross-regional/cross-functional activity and the business requirements on a global scale.

 **Preferred Qualifications & Desired Competencies:**

 **Results-Driven**: Having a proactive, goal-oriented approach to decision making.

* Clear and strategic thinker; proven experience in translating strategies into actionable plans

 **Team Player**: Having respect for colleagues; leading teams with clarity and accountability.

* Proven team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills who can effectively work with all levels of a global matrixed organization

 **Change Orientation**: Able to adapt to changing demands and conditions.

* Act as a Change Management expert and enabler on various projects and programs across the business
* Continues to perform in a changing environment, with appropriate support
* Risk Management & Decision making ability.

 **Customer Focus**: Providing exceptional service and quality to external and internal customer.

* Understanding and working in past organizations that have centralized and de-centralized structures as business requirements change
* Establishes and maintains effective relationships with internal and external customers and gains their trust and respect

 **Self-Awareness**: Accepting responsibility for personal development and actions.

* Have clear objectives and strives to exceed them
* Takes ownership for personal career and skill development

 **Other:**

* Willingness to work in an office in Bangalore

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
Provide support & advice in all areas of people management & development & be responsible for HR operation activities. The role will be responsible for supporting & coordinating a wide variety of HR activities including recruitment, onboarding, employee relations, disciplinary action,, legal matters of the site, performance management, policy procedure interpretation, and employee recognition


**Duties & Responsibilities**

What you'll do -


* Work with functional manager/s: manage the delivery and administration of HR processes such as Employee relations, Compensation, Wage & Benefit and performance management
* Ensure assistance is available to counsel employees and managers to resolve grievance issues such as policy and procedure interpretation, performance expectations, absenteeism, discipline, and workplace harassment and discrimination.
* Provide consultation, resources and training assistance to department and division management to assess and address ongoing training and development needs. Provide support and oversight to talent partner to ensure equitable access to training opportunities
* Responsible for computation of Financial Provisions relating to Leave Salary, Bonus, Superannuation, Gratuity, Incentives, etc.
* Delivers site/functional communications in accordance with group/divisional/functional communication strategies. Collects and analyses feedback from communications and works with constituents to develop recommended actions.
* Partner with HR Operation to provide HR System support, process standardization and centralization, implementation of global or regional project initiatives.
* Manage recruitment process and ensure compliance with prevailing regulations. Conduct new employee orientations.
* Assure company compliance with all applicable regulations and respond to questions regarding regulations, consulting legal counsel when necessary
* Develop and maintain employee policies and job descriptions for all
* Promote positive employee relations practices in the work environment.
* Responsible for computation of Financial Provisions relating to Leave Salary, Bonus, Superannuation, Gratuity, Incentives, etc.
* Ensures timely publication/distribution of MIS Reports/Information
* Employee communication & management of newsletter
* On time submission of Payroll inputs to payroll vendor & ensure on-time disbursement of salaries
* Provide strategic and tactical support in decisions regarding personnel changes, including hiring, promotion, suspension, and discharge. Prepare termination and/or severance agreements and benefits termination letters to be in compliance with plan contracts and company policies
* Respond to daily policy and practices questions from management, line supervisors, and employees.
* HR compliance to Smiths quality standards and adherence to division/group policies/procedures/ code of ethics.
* Liaise with the People Operations team to ensure that employee or organizational transactional activities are completed efficiently and accurately within the HR master data system
* Coordinate the implementation of various employee programs & employee welfare activities
* Responsible for supporting all HR activities for respective business unit(s), providing generalist human resource guidance, support and service to business, advice and guidance on company Programmes and initiatives; employee relations; organizational design and effectiveness; recruitment, retention, performance management and grievance management.
* Works closely with line management and employees to provide support, planning and problem solving; fosters open communication with business partners and employee population. Resolves ongoing, complex Human Resources related issues and tracks employee data utilizing HRIS and other systems and tools deployed
* Support and develop human resources initiatives and the delivery of HR Services in coordination with HR Operations team and reflecting the business needs in the respective division(s)/region(s), liaising as needed with Business Partners and CoEs (taking global initiatives and delivering locally into the region(s)
**The Individual**

What you'll definitely need -


* Masters’ Degree in Human Resources or related field with 6-8years of experience of which at least 4 years in HR Generalist role Manufacturing or Engineering Services environment preferred but not essential
* Ability to shape and lead human resource programs to maximize support for company strategic business goals.
* Ability to build relationship as trusted advisor to management, proactively managing the stakeholders within Smiths organization.
* Excellent influencing, communication and people management skills with the ability to interact with all levels of staff.
* Highly motivated with initiative and drive; results-oriented and customer-focused.
* Very good verbal and written English communications skills.
* Local language proficiency is important & travelling required for site at Pune at least once a month.
* Interpersonal Relationship Development Skill.
* Problem solving and decision-making skill.
* Planning and organizing skill.


We believe that different perspectives and backgrounds are what make a company flourish. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, economic status, disability, age, or any other legally protected characteristics. We are proud to be an inclusive company with values grounded in equality and ethics, where we celebrate, support, and embrace diversity.



At no time during the hiring process will John Crane, Smiths Group nor any of our recruitment partners ever request payment to enable participation – including, but not limited to, interviews or testing. About Us


Founded in 1917, John Crane is a global leader in the design, manufacturing, and engineering of mission critical flow control solutions for increased efficiency, emission reductions and energy transformation. Our products include mechanical seals and systems, couplings, bearings, filtration systems and predictive digital monitoring technologies. John Crane customer service is accessed through a global network of more than 200 global sites in over 50 countries employing more than 6,000 employees worldwide. We partner with our customers and help them meet the latest environmental standards and keep their operations safe and controlled.



John Crane is part of Smiths Group, For over 170 years, Smiths has been improving our world through smarter engineering. Our technology benefits millions of people every day – making travel safer, supporting sustainable energy transition, efficiently heating, cooling our homes, and helping our world stay connected.

* Employee communication & management of newsletter
* On time submission of Payroll inputs to payroll vendor & ensure on-time disbursement of salaries
* Provide strategic and tactical support in decisions regarding personnel changes, including hiring, promotion, suspension, and discharge. Prepare termination and/or severance agreements and benefits termination letters to be in compliance with plan contracts and company policies
* Respond to daily policy and practices questions from management, line supervisors, and employees.
* HR compliance to Smiths quality standards and adherence to division/group policies/procedures/ code of ethics.
* Liaise with the People Operations team to ensure that employee or organizational transactional activities are completed efficiently and accurately within the HR master data system
* Coordinate the implementation of various employee programs & employee welfare activities
* Responsible for supporting all HR activities for respective business unit(s), providing generalist human resource guidance, support and service to business, advice and guidance on company Programmes and initiatives; employee relations; organizational design and effectiveness; recruitment, retention, performance management and grievance management.
* Works closely with line management and employees to provide support, planning and problem solving; fosters open communication with business partners and employee population. Resolves ongoing, complex Human Resources related issues and tracks employee data utilizing HRIS and other systems and tools deployed
* Support and develop human resources initiatives and the delivery of HR Services in coordination with HR Operations team and reflecting the business needs in the respective division(s)/region(s), liaising as needed with Business Partners and CoEs (taking global initiatives and delivering locally into the region(s)
The Individual


What you'll definitely need -


* Masters’ Degree in Human Resources or related field with 6-8years of experience of which at least 4 years in HR Generalist role Manufacturing or Engineering Services environment preferred but not essential
* Ability to shape and lead human resource programs to maximize support for company strategic business goals.
* Ability to build relationship as trusted advisor to management, proactively managing the stakeholders within Smiths organization.
* Excellent influencing, communication and people management skills with the ability to interact with all levels of staff.
* Highly motivated with initiative and drive; results-oriented and customer-focused.
* Very good verbal and written English communications skills.
* Local language proficiency is important & travelling required for site at Pune at least once a month.
* Interpersonal Relationship Development Skill.
* Problem solving and decision-making skill.
* Planning and organizing skill.


We believe that different perspectives and backgrounds are what make a company flourish. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, economic status, disability, age, or any other legally protected characteristics. We are proud to be an inclusive company with values grounded in equality and ethics, where we celebrate, support, and embrace diversity.



At no time during the hiring process will John Crane, Smiths Group nor any of our recruitment partners ever request payment to enable participation – including, but not limited to, interviews or testing.

description:
### **Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges**

**The future is what we make it..**
When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Own initiatives to support growth and optimization of the business.**Talent Development** - Own Talent development and execution, drive key talent development, critical roles identification & career pathing initiatives to ensure talent agenda aligns with the business agenda. Identify and lead initiatives to support the capability building agenda of the function, with respect to behavioral and leadership skills. Partner and influence business leaders to drive a performance-oriented work culture.**Coaching -**Build an ability to provide coaching/ counseling to both employees and business leaders in areas of people management.

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
NTT is a leading global IT solutions and services organisation that brings together people, data and things to create a better and more sustainable future.


In today’s ‘iNTTerconnected’ world, connections matter more now than ever. By bringing together talented people, world-class technology partners and emerging innovators, we help our clients solve some of the world’s most significant technological, business and societal challenges.


With people at the heart of our success, NTT is committed to attracting and growing the best talent and providing an environment where everyone feels they can belong and their contribution matters.

 **Want to be a part of our team?**


An Associate HR Operations Generalist, is an essential part of the HR team, supporting various operational aspects of the employee lifecycle. The role involves assisting in tasks related to recruitment, onboarding, benefits administration, HRIS management, and employee record maintenance. The role requires attention to detail and organisational abilities to contribute to the smooth execution of HR operations.**Working at NTT**

**Key Roles and Responsibilities:**

* Supports with HR processes, including recruitment, onboarding, benefits administration, employee relations, performance management, and offboarding.
* Assists with ensuring HR activities and processes are in full compliance with relevant employment laws, regulations, and company policies.
* Receives detailed instructions to use HR data to generate insights, trends, and metrics that inform decision-making and drive improvements.
* Contributes to organisational change initiatives within HR operations, providing guidance to employees during transitions.
* Works with other departments to align HR strategies with organisational objectives and ensure seamless operations.
* Works with HRIS software for data management, reporting, and analysis, ensuring data accuracy and integrity within the HRIS.

 **Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:**

* Basic understanding of HR processes, policies, and best practices across various functions, including recruitment, onboarding, benefits administration, employee relations, performance management, and offboarding.
* Basic understanding of HRIS software and tools for efficient data management, reporting, and analytics.
* Basic understanding HR data to generate meaningful insights and present key metrics to inform strategic decisions.

 **Academic Qualifications and Certifications:**  

**Required Experience:**

* Basic experience in HR operations, including recruitment, onboarding, benefits administration, employee relations, performance management, and offboarding.
* Familiarity with HRIS software and other HR-related software tools
* Basic experience as an HR administrative assistant or HR administrator
* Basic administrative support experience

**Skills Summary**


Communication, Data Management, Human Resources Policies, Human Resources Processes, Prioritization, Time Management**What will make you a good fit for the role?**

**Workplace type****:**

On-site Working**Equal Opportunity Employer**


NTT is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category

 **Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.**

 **A career at NTT means:**

* Being part of a **global pioneer –** where you gain exposure to our Fortune 500 clients and world-leading global technology partners and work with a network of over 40,000 smart and diverse colleagues across 57 countries, delivering services in over 200 countries.
* Being at the forefront of **cutting-edge technology –** backed with a 150-year heritage of using technology for good. With 40% of the world’s internet traffic running on our network and where Emoji were first invented, you can be proud of the group’s many new ‘firsts’.
* **Making a difference –** by doing meaningful work that helps to shape the future for our clients, and across industries and communities around the world.
* Being **your best self –** in a progressive ‘Connected Working’ environment that promotes flexibility, connection and wellbeing. Where diversity and different perspectives are embraced to ensure equal opportunities for all.
* Having ongoing opportunities to **own and develop your career –** with a personal and professional development plan and access to the broadest learning offerings in the industry.

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
**Job Title: HR Officer - Payroll, Statutory Compliance, and Drone Pilot Recruitment**

An HR Officer is sought to manage various aspects of payroll, statutory compliance, and recruitment, with a particular focus on recruiting drone pilots. The following responsibilities are to be undertaken:

Payroll Management: The payroll processes are to be managed efficiently, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and compliance with relevant regulations.

Statutory Compliance: Compliance with ESI, PF, and other statutory requirements is to be ensured, staying updated with changes in labor laws and regulations.

Recruitment: Skilled professionals, including drone pilots, are to be recruited through comprehensive sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding processes.

Employee State Insurance (ESI) and Provident Fund (PF): The ESI and PF processes are to be overseen, ensuring all eligible employees are enrolled and contributions are made accurately.

Joining Formalities: Joining formalities for new hires, including documentation, orientation, and induction, are to be conducted smoothly.

Induction: New employees are to be introduced to the organization, its culture, policies, and procedures through effective induction programs.

Employee Relations: Positive employee relations are to be maintained through effective communication, conflict resolution, and fostering a supportive work environment.

Full and Final Settlement: The full and final settlement process for exiting employees is to be managed, including clearance of dues and documentation.

Drone Pilot Recruitment: A talent pipeline of skilled drone pilots is to be developed and maintained, ensuring a robust recruitment process that aligns with the organization's needs and industry standards.

This role requires strong attention to detail, excellent communication skills, and the ability to multitask effectively. Candidates should possess knowledge of payroll management, statutory compliance, and recruitment practices, with a particular emphasis on recruiting drone pilots. If you are passionate about talent acquisition and HR management, and ready to contribute to our team's success, we welcome your application.

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
**Description**

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced HR Generalist to join our fast-paced Real Estate company. As an HR Generalist, you will play a vital role in ensuring that our company attracts, develops, and retains top talent. You will be responsible for overseeing a wide range of HR functions, including recruitment, employee relations, training and development, compensation and benefits, and performance management. If you are a dynamic and people-oriented professional with a strong understanding of HR best practices and are driven to make a significant impact on our organization, we want to hear from you!

**Responsibilities**

* Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including sourcing candidates, conducting interviews, and making hiring decisions
* Oversee employee onboarding and offboarding processes, ensuring a smooth and positive experience for new and departing employees
* Provide guidance and support to managers and employees on HR policies and procedures, ensuring compliance with all local labor laws and regulations
* Coordinate and conduct training and development programs to enhance employee skills and ensure alignment with company goals
* Manage employee relations issues, including conducting investigations and resolving conflicts in a fair and timely manner
* Assist in the development and implementation of HR policies and procedures, ensuring consistency and alignment with company values and objectives
* Administer compensation and benefits programs, including salary reviews, bonus calculations, and employee benefits enrollment and changes

**Requirements**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources or related field
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar HR Generalist role, preferably in the Real Estate industry
* Strong knowledge of HR laws, regulations, and best practices
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships at all levels of the organization
* Proven ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with integrity and discretion
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
* Proficient in HRIS systems and Microsoft Office Suite

title: Talent & Culture Executive
description:
**Job Description**  

* Support the Talent & Culture Manager to ensure the hotel implements its annual T&C Business Plan and Training/Development Strategy
* Provide advice and guidance including coaching and support to Managers, Supervisors and Team Leaders on talent administration, performance management, training and development.
* Handle any team member grievance matters or interpersonal conflict sensitively and professionally, with an understanding and consideration of business risk, taking mitigating actions where required and escalating as needed to the Talent & Culture Manager.
* Lead and facilitate positive change management in relation to workforce culture.
* Ensure the hotel induction process is monitored and updated regularly with changing conditions within the hotel.
* Support Reward & Recognition programs and assist Talent & Culture Manager to drive and communicate these programs.
* Ensure health, safety and welfare of all staff is provided for through implementation of Accor Health and Safety initiatives. Assist in the effective operation of the WHS Committee.
* Co-ordinate all internal events eg: employee briefings, annual Christmas party.
* Assist Talent & Culture Manager, General Manager and the Department Head team with employee relations initiatives, co-ordinate reward and recognition programs and deliver training programs.
* Support the Talent & Culture team in ensuring activities are in line with department budgets and keep accurate records of invoices and monthly expenditure, reporting any discrepancies or concerns to your manager.

 **Qualifications**  

* Bachelor of Human Resources or similar qualifications
* A true HR generalist with prior experience as a coordinator or executive
* Demonstrates passion for learning, is curious and finds opportunities to educate about L&D and T&C practices as well as digital techniques to bring new ideas to the hotels.
* Communicates positively with body language, written and verbal communication, demonstrates positive orientation building a strong positive brand.
* An effective communicator that is able to deliver a clear message to a diverse team
* A creative problem solver and has the ability to genuinely connect with others

* Strong attention to detail, organisational skills & ability to work in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to operate with honesty, integrity & professionalism at all times

title: People Partnerships Associate
description:
**Job Title:** People Partnerships Associate


**Reports to:** Sr Manager, People Partnerships


**Location**: Hyderabad, INDIA


**Education**: Master of Business Administration


Electronic Arts (EA) is the world's leading independent developer and publisher of interactive entertainment software for personal computer and consoles. We are now applying its 20 years of experience creating world-leading interactive entertainment experiences to mobile gaming.


**About the Role**


You will work with HR management, partners with EA managers and employees to develop and implement talent strategies at the individual, team, and studio level, that are designed to strengthen employee culture and to support the attainment of EA business objectives. Champion and help manage company-wide programs (e.g., performance review, compensation review, stock/recognition, benefits, workforce planning, succession planning, training, and organizational change). Customizes corporate HR programs to enable local implementation. Coach and recommend solutions to resolve employee relations issues and escalates to senior HR management. Develop both business and HR COE partner relationships to ensure respect and trust.


**Main Responsibilities:**


* Is seen as a trusted advisor by managers at all Responds to employees and management inquiries on a broad range of issues
* Provide guidance to managers on best practices in management and related programs
* Support hiring efforts; coordinates hiring and selection with COE Talent Acquisition partners to ensure a positive candidate experience
* Partner with HR management and COEs to improve our capability through identification and implementation of programs that provide development opportunities to meet our goals.
* Participate and promote employee engagement initiatives and help analyze feedback, related presentations, and may help facilitate meetings to review outcomes and develop action plans.
* Through ongoing relationship with critical talent, identifies retention risks and recommends actions to address and escalates where needed.
* Work with business to foster a culture of ongoing performance feedback and development.
* Liaise with HR management on matters relating to employee engagement, welfare, discipline, and employee satisfaction issues.
* Utilize knowledge of local employment legislation (and may include increasing understanding of global employment law), partners with managers and HR to address workplace issues.
* May also facilitate meetings to address ER issues identified from survey feedback and other sources and partner with management to create action plans to address.

**Skills Required**


* University degree in Human Resources, or Master of Business Administration.
* 1-3 Yrs years of professional experience in Human Resources experience (Recruitment /Generalist) in high-tech industry.
* Experience gained across core HR functions including Recruitment, NHO process Employee Relations, Performance Management, Resourcing, Learning and Development, Change Management, and HRIS.
* Fluent in English (written and spoken).

**Behaviors and Competencies**


* Strong organizational/multitasking and prioritization setting
* Teamwork spirit.
* Project management.
* Good verbal and written communication. Customer focus.
* Experience using data and data-driven insights to support the team by offering appropriate solutions.
* Presentation development and delivery

  

We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
Job Summary

SGBI is seeking an experienced HR Manager to lead our HR department. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and overseeing all HR-related tasks, including recruiting, training, employee relations, compensation, benefits administration, and compliance with labor laws and regulations. This is a challenging and exciting role that requires someone who can work independently, prioritize tasks effectively, and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. This is a hands-on role that requires a strong HR generalist with experience in recruitment, employee relations, performance management, and HR

operations. This position will involve working closely with senior management to align HR strategies with business objectives and cultivate a positive company culture.

Roles and Responsibilities:

* Develop and implement HR strategies, policies, and programs that align with the company's goals and objectives.
* Collaborate with department heads to identify staffing needs and create job descriptions.
* Manage the full cycle recruitment process, including job postings, resume screening, interviewingand hiring decisions.
* Develop and implement onboarding and training programs to ensure that new employees areintegrated into the company effectively.
* Provide guidance and coaching to managers and employees on HR issues, including employeerelations, performance management, and disciplinary action.
* Manage and maintain HR data and systems, ensuring accuracy and compliance with legalrequirements.
* Develop and implement compensation and benefits programs that attract and retain top talent.
* Ensure compliance with state, central and local employment laws and regulations.
* Collaborate with other teams, such as finance and operations, to ensure that HR policies andprograms are aligned with the company's goals and objectives.
* Implement, monitor & record KPIs for the team, conduct monthly and quarterly review meetingsto assess and validate the effectiveness of the KPIs, ensuring the team maintains discipline andaccountability.
* Create and present monthly progress reports to management, leveraging HR indicators to facilitateinformed decision-making process.
* Promote HR programs to create an efficient, supportive, and healthy workplace.
* Stay updated on HR trends and best practices to continuously improve HR processes and initiatives.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

Essential Skills:

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with active listening capability.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and record-keeping.

4. Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic

environment.

* Ability to multitask and manage competing priorities.
* Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
* Passion for technology and innovation.

SGBI Inc JD/2024/Operations/001

* Ability to develop and implement HR strategies that align with the company's goals and objectives
* Excellent planning skills & good negotiation skill.
* Demonstrated leadership abilities and strategic thinking.
* Knowledge of ERP systems & Microsoft suites
* Knowledge in preparing reports
* Knowledge of contracts, industry standard SCM terms.

Bonus Skills:

Experience

o 3-5 years of experience in HR management roles.

Preferred Qualifications

o Have worked in any organization with prior experience in technology or robotics startups. o Familiarity with hardware or manufacturing industries is a plus.

o Bachelor's degree in human resources, business administration, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

o Experience managing the full cycle recruitment process. o Familiarity with employment laws and regulations

Job Location: Cochin, Kerala

SGBI Inc (Sastra Global Business Innovations) is headquartered in the US specializing in robotic systems & solutions for testing automation. SGBI Pvt Ltd is the subsidiary of SGBI Inc. The company was founded by Mr. Aronin P, Mr. Akhil A & Mr. Achu Wilson. The current focus of the company is on manufacturing Intelligent Robotic Test Automation Platforms for HMI(Human Machine Interface) testing and remote operations. Our portfolio of customers includes OEMs, ODMs, and System Integrators such as Robert Bosch, Qualcomm, HCL, Honeywell, Tech M, etc. We operate in India, UK, & US. Our UK subsidiary SGBI UK Pvt Ltd handle European sales & support.

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
We are seeking a highly organized and proactive HR Generalist to join our team. As an HR Generalist, the scope of your role expands to encompass various aspects of both human resources and administrative tasks. you will be responsible for providing efficient HR & administrative support/assistance to ensure the smooth operation of our office. You will handle a variety of tasks and responsibilities, including managing office supplies, coordinating meetings, maintaining records, and assisting with general office operations. The ideal candidate should be detail-oriented, possess driven, have excellent communication skills, and be proficient in office management software.


**Job Description**
-------------------


**Responsibilities:**


**Recruitment:**


* You will be involved in the entire recruitment process, including posting job advertisements, screening resumes and conducting interviews.
* Source, screen, and interview candidates to assess their technical skills, experience, and cultural fit.
* Utilize various recruiting channels, including job boards, social media, and professional networks, to attract qualified candidates.
* Build and maintain a strong candidate pipeline for current and future hiring needs.
* Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, from job posting to offer negotiation.
* Stay updated on industry trends, market conditions, and competitor practices.


**Onboarding and Offboarding:**


* Coordinating the onboarding process for new employees, including paperwork, orientation, and office setup.
* Coordinating the offboarding process for exit employees, including assets handover.


**Training and Development:**


* You may assist in identifying training needs within the organization and coordinating training programs for employees. This can include both technical and soft skills training.


**Employee Relations:**


* Acting as a point of contact for employee inquiries, concerns, and grievances.
* Providing guidance and support to employees and managers on HR policies & procedures
* Mediating and resolving conflicts between employees and promoting positive employee relations.


**Employee Engagement:**


* You will work to foster a positive and engaging work culture by organizing employee events, coordinating employee recognition programs, and promoting team-building activities.
* Office Administration:
* Managing daily office operations, including office supplies, equipment, and maintenance.
* Coordinating travel arrangements and accommodation for employees, if necessary.
* Overseeing facilities management, such as space allocation, office layout, and maintenance requests.
* Managing vendor relationships and procurement of office-related services.


**Records and Data Management:**


* Maintaining accurate employee records and HR databases.
* Managing and organizing confidential employee files and documentation.
* Generating HR reports and analyzing HR metrics to provide insights to management.
* Ensuring compliance with data protection and privacy regulations.


**Administrative Support:**


* Providing administrative support to senior executives or management, such as scheduling meetings, managing calendars, and preparing correspondence.
* Assisting with general office tasks, including mail distribution, filing, and document management.


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor's Degree from any Stream.
* Proven experience as an Office Administrator or HR Generalist in a similar role.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Office365) and other office management software.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Strong written and verbal communication abilities.
* Attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.
* Discretion and confidentiality when handling sensitive information.
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well within a team.

description:
**Roles and Responsibilities:**

We are on the lookout for Executive - Human Resource Generalist to manage HR activities and Operations across the company - everything from recruiting, on-boarding and training management to performance management and compensation. The role will involve working, side-by-side, with our employees to foster a positive environment and make sure the company's mission and goals are effectively implemented.

* Enhances the organization's human resources by planning, implementing, and evaluating employee relations and human resources policies, programs, and practices.
* Manage recruitment, onboarding, performance management, employee relationships, training, and compensation process; monitor and make improvements as required
* Building Training Modules for employees of various roles, making training schedule, etc.

* Participate in job fairs and host in-house recruitment events. Collaborate with managers to identify future hiring needs. Act as a consultant to new hires and help them onboard.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Recruitment and Onboarding:**

Assist in the recruitment process by posting job openings, screening resumes, scheduling interviews, and conducting reference checks.

Coordinate new hire onboarding activities, including preparing offer letters, conducting orientation sessions, and ensuring all necessary paperwork is completed.

**Employee Relations:**

Serve as a point of contact for employee inquiries and concerns, providing guidance and support to foster positive employee relations.

Assist in resolving employee issues and conflicts in accordance with company policies and legal requirements.

**Performance Management:**

Support the performance appraisal process by providing guidance to managers and employees, ensuring timely completion of performance evaluations, and facilitating performance improvement plans as needed.

**Training and Development:**

Coordinate training programs and initiatives to enhance employee skills and knowledge.

Assist in identifying training needs and developing training materials and resources.

**HR Administration:**

Maintain accurate employee records in HRIS and personnel files, ensuring compliance with data protection regulations.

Process employee changes, such as promotions, transfers, and terminations, and update relevant HR documents and systems accordingly.

**Policy Development and Compliance:**

Manage payroll processing, including verifying timesheets, calculating wages, and ensuring timely and accurate payment to employees.

Assist in the development and implementation of HR policies and procedures to ensure compliance with legal requirements and industry best practices.

Stay updated on relevant employment laws and regulations and ensure company policies are up-to-date and in compliance.

**Qualifications:**

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management or related field.

Minimum of 2+ years of HR experience, preferably in a generalist role.

Strong knowledge of HR best practices and employment laws.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.

Proficiency in HRIS software and Microsoft Office Suite.

**Please Note:** Must have experience working in companies with an employee strength of approximately 300.

title: Office Manager
description:
**What's Ditto?**

  

At Ditto, our mission is to empower users with a deep understanding of insurance, enabling them to narrow down choices, sidestep common pitfalls, and ultimately make well-informed decisions. From delivering expert insurance advice to facilitating smooth policy purchases and providing dedicated claim support, Ditto ensures a seamless end-to-end insurance experience.

  

We pioneered the industry-first "No-spam" policy, underscoring our commitment to user-centric solutions. Over the past three years, we've successfully assisted over 300,000 users with personalised advice on health and term insurance.

  

Ditto is part of the Finshots family, a leading financial newsletter boasting a subscriber base of over 500,000 and we are backed by India’s largest stock-broker Zerodha

 **What’s the role of the QA team at Ditto?**

  

As the custodian of the customer experience at Ditto, our Quality Assurance team plays a pivotal role in shaping and enhancing every interaction with our brand. Proactively identifying areas for improvement across various touchpoints, including insurance advice, customer purchase journeys, policy issuance, renewals, and claims, our QA team conducts thorough audits to pinpoint potential gaps in our processes. Through a dedicated commitment to excellence, they not only identify violations but also drive meaningful solutions, leveraging feedback and training sessions to continuously refine and optimise our procedures, ensuring unparalleled satisfaction for our customers

 **What will you be working on as Program Manager?**

  

You will be working closely with the founders (Bhanu Gurram and Shrehith Karkera) on two things -

* Identifying and prioritising gaps in our current processes
* Streamlining the current QA audit processes and implement continuous improvement programs

  

 This role is ideal for someone with an entrepreneurial mindset, who is interested in starting their own venture in the future. Prior experience in the Insurance industry is not required.

 **What are we looking for?**

* 2-3 years of experience in program management
* A generalist with a can-do attitude who is willing to roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty.
* Strong managerial and analytical skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
* Demonstrates a strong sense of ownership.
* Prior entrepreneurial experience is preferred but not required.

 **Perks**

* Comprehensive Health Insurance
* Compensation as per industry standards

 **Our Interview Process:**

  

We would like to help you minimize your time and effort. There are 4 rounds & we will be working towards completing all the rounds within a maximum of 2 weeks time.

  

Please find the schedule here:

  

1. HR Introductory Call


2. Task or Assignment


3. Task Discussion Session


4. Final Founders Meeting

 **This is an in-office role. Our address is : 175/176 Billekahalli, BG Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076**

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
**Job Description:**

Are you an experienced Human Resources professional looking for an exciting opportunity to lead and direct a dynamic HR department? We are seeking a skilled and strategic HR Manager to deliver comprehensive HR services to our business.

**Key Responsibilities:**

- Employee Relations: Manage all aspects of employee relations including absence, disciplinary, grievances, sickness, etc. Measure employee satisfaction and identify areas for improvement.

- Performance Management: Provide coaching to managers on performance management issues and processes.

- Learning & Development: Offer guidance on development for managers and their teams.

- Training: Implement training and development agendas, identify areas for improvement.

- Reward Management: Advise and support employees on company benefits.

- Policy & Procedures: Implement new HR policies, procedures, and processes ensuring compliance with current employment laws.

- Budget Management: Monitor and alert the CEO/Directors to any variance between budgeted and actual salaries and headcount. Manage HR budgets effectively.

- Statutory Compliance: Ensure compliance with statutory requirements under various industrial laws.

- Payroll Management: Oversee payroll management, ESI, and PF compliance.

- Recruitment & Selection: Manage the full lifecycle of recruitment including sourcing, screening, qualifying, and closing positions. Maintain up-to-date recruitment progress reports and talent databases.

**Skills/Qualifications:**

- Solid communication skills with a proven ability to build rapport quickly.

- Experience in business partnering/advisory roles with examples of adding value as both an individual contributor and team member.

- Ability to handle senior and challenging individuals.

- Strategic planning and problem-solving skills.

- Commercial approach to HR with a focus on employee satisfaction, development, and reward.

- Flexibility to work in a matrix reporting environment.

- Strong leadership, coaching, and presentation skills.

- Education

UG : Any Graduate

PG : MBA/PGDM - HR/Industrial Relations

**Why Join Us:**

- Opportunity to lead and direct a dynamic HR department.

- Contribute to the overall success and growth of the business.

- Work in a collaborative and supportive environment.

- Competitive salary and benefits package.

If you are a motivated and experienced HR professional with a passion for driving organizational success through effective HR management, we want to hear from you! Apply now to join our team as the Human Resources Generalist.

Salary: ₹12,500.00 - ₹35,000.00 per month

description:

● End to End recruitment and hiring process for technical as well as non-technical profiles.

● Collaborate with hiring managers to set qualification criteria for future employees.

● Screen resumes and job applications.

● Conduct initial phone screens to create shortlists of qualified candidates.

● Interview candidates for a wide range of roles (junior, senior, and executive).

● Track hiring metrics including time-to-hire, time-to-fill and source of hire.
